LEONOR Y SU FAMILIA VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE VILLA SALOMÉ QUE SE ENCUENTRA A 30 MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. LEONOR TIENE UN BAZAR-LIBRERÍA FRENTE AL COLEGIO TOPATER DE PAMPAHASI. EL SR. JUSTINIANO ADEMÁS DE SER PROFESOR REALIZA TRABAJOS DE SERIGRAFÍA. LEONOR ES UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE CON SU TRABAJO Y SU FAMILIA YA QUE TIENE DOS TRABAJOS. SUS HIJOS ESTAN COMENZANDO A REALIZAR TRABAJOS DE SERIGRAFÍA GRACIAS A LA INFLUENCIA DE SUS PADRES. LEONOR Y JUSTINIANO ANHELAN DAR UNA BUENA EDUCACIÓN A SUS HIJOS Y DE ESA MANERA LOGRAR QUE ELLOS LLEGUEN A SER BUENOS PROFESIONALES. EL CRÉDITO QUE SOLICITAN ES PARA COMPRAR MATERIALES PARA EL BAZAR Y MATERIALES DE SERIGRAFÍA. ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Leonor is married. She and her husband, Sr. Justiniano, teach plastic arts. They have two young children who are high school students.

Leonor and her family live in the Villa Salome zone, located 30 minutes from the center of the city. Leonor has a variety store/bookshop opposite the Topater de Pampahasi High School. In addition to being a teacher, Sr. Justiniano creates silk screen prints.

Leonor is very responsible in both her work and her family as shown by the fact that she has two jobs. Thanks to the influence of their parents, her children are beginning to make works of silk screen.

Leonor and Justiniano want to provide a good education to their children so that they can succeed in becoming professionals. The loan that they are applying for is for purchasing inventory for the shop and silk screening materials. They are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown them in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies and silk screening materials.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el cruce de Villa Copacabana, en la ciudad de La Paz, donde vende refrescos, pan, conservas, dulces y otros.
Con la tienda puede solventar los gastos de educación de sus hijos y la alimentación de su familia ya que no vive con su esposo.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa San Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de la Paz en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de abarrotes, aceite, papel higiénico).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá comprar mercadería y mejorar sus costos por compras.
texts.en:
Mirna has a grocery store at the crossroads of Villa Copacabana in the city of La Paz, where she sells drinks, bread, canned goods, sweets, and other items. With earnings from this store she pays the costs of education for her children and food for her family, since she no longer lives with her husband. Mirna lives in the Villa San Antonio Bajo zone of the city of La Paz in her own house. The loan will be used to buy groceries, including oil and toilet paper. It is the first time she has solicited credit with Impro. With this loan she will buy merchandise and improve her costs for purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE FOR HER GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: LA SRA. SANDRA SE DEDICA A VENDER DVD's. ELLA ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO PERO VIVE JUNTO A SUS DOS JOVENES HIJAS, UNA DE ELLAS ES UN POCO ENFERMA PERO GRACIAS AL APOYO DE SANDRA SE ESTA MEJORANDO. ELLAS VIVEN EN LA ZONA DE ALTO PAMPAHASI QUE ESTA A 20 MINUTOS DEL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD. SANDRA TIENE UNA TIENDA DONDE VENDE LOS DVD's Y TAMBIÉN VA A VENDER A LA FERIA 16 DE JULIO DE LA CUIDAD DE EL ALTO, QUE ES LA FERIA MÁS GRANDE ESTA CIUDAD. SANDRA ES UNA PERSONA ALEGRE Y TRABAJA MUY DURO PARA QUE SUS HIJAS RECIBAN UNA BUENA EDUCACIÓN YA QUE ESPERA QUE ELLAS PUEDAN LLEGAR A SER PROFESIONALES. SANDRA Y SUS HIJAS VIVEN EN ESTE MOMENTO EN UN PEQUEÑO DEPARTAMENTO Y ESPERAN PODER AHORRAR LO SUFICIENTE PARA PODER COMPRAR UNA CASA. ELLA SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR CAJAS DE DVD'S EN BLANCO. ESTAN AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sandra sells DVDs. She is separated from her husband but lives with her two young daughters. One of them is a bit ill but, thanks to Sandra’s care, she is recovering. They live in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood which is 20 minutes from downtown. Sandra has a store where she sells the DVDs and she also goes to the 16 de Julio market in El Alto, which is the largest in the city, to sell. Sandra is a cheerful woman who works hard so that her daughters can have a good education, hoping that they will become professionals. Sandra and her daughters live in a small apartment and hope to save enough to buy their own home. She is asking for funding to buy cases of blank DVDs. They are grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 cases of blank DVDs

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: La señora Segundina se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio ubicado en el barrio 6 de febrero donde con la ayuda de su hijo quien le ayuda con la preparacion de algunos platos. Su esposo el Sr. Eladio trabaja de noche como guardia de seguridad. La señora Segundina tambien hace platos a pedido para acontecimientos sociales como ser fiestas, matrimonios quince años, etc. en esa parte cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo el cual tambien tiene experiencia como cocinero. Con el dinero del credito comprara ingredientes para la elaboracion de sus comidas como fideos, papa, aceite, verduras, etc. La señora Segundina  es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza por darle una buena educacion a sus hijos, ya que uno de sus deseos es de ver a sus hijos profesionales y que sean personas responsables y honestas. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Segundina sells food from her home, which is located in the "6th of February" neighborhood. Her son helps her with the preparation of some of the dishes. Her husband, Eladio, works at night as a security guard. Segundina also does catering for social events such as parties, weddings, 15th birthday galas, and others. In this part of the business she also relies on the help of her son, who has experience working as a cook. With the money from this loan she will buy ingredients to make her meals, such as noodles, potatoes, cooking oil, vegetables, etc. Segundina is a hardworking woman who strives to provide a good education for her children, because one of her wishes is to see her children become professionals who are responsible and honest people. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries, ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Viviana Monserrate

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal camino al progreso situado en la  ciudad de Montecristi en la Provincia de Manabí  conversamos con la socia Viviana, esta casada desde hace 12 años en cuyo matrimonio han procreado dos hijos, tiene 27 años de edad.

La señora Viviana lleva dos años con el negocio de venta de ropa y útiles escolares, en la casa tiene un espacio destinado con una vitrina para su negocio, ya es el cuarto  ciclo que lleva en la Fundación y ha podido hacer que sus ventas crezcan y sus ganancias sean mas altas.

Con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia Viviana invertirá en comprar más útiles escolares y ropa que tiene por  pedidos, en esta ocasión venderá más pantalones para damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
We are talking to Viviana, a member of the Camino al Progreso Communal Bank. The bank is located in the city of Montecristi in the Manabí province. Viviana is 27, has been married for 12 years, and has two children. Viviana has been selling clothes and school supplies for two years. She has a space in her house with a display case for her business. This is her fourth cycle with the Foundation. She has been able to make her sales grow and receive higher earnings. Viviana will use the new loan to buy more school supplies and clothes. She has received orders for these items. At this time she will sell more pants for women and men.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, pants for women and men

loans.name: Eliana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí se reúne el Banco comunal Camino Del Progreso, en este banco la señorita Eliana L. es una de las socias, ella  converso con nosotros y nos comentó que esta muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación para poder trabajar.

Eliana tiene 24 es una joven comerciante que tiene muchas aspiraciones, ella empezó en el  mundo de las ventas cuando tenía 18 años junto a su hermana ella fue quien la motivo para que trabajara, por motivo de la situación económica que estaban atravesando tubo que interrumpir sus estudios, el papá enfermo y ella junto a la hermana tuvieron que encargarse de los gastos del hogar, eso le hizo ser una persona responsable y decidió ingresar a la fundación, cuando en la ventas lo hizo con mercadería de ropa, pero en los actuales momento se dedica a vender productos de belleza con Avón y Yanbal como estos productos se vende según el pedido que haga el clientes mostrándoles la revista, y son pocos los días que le dan para que pague, ella decidió tener su propio capital y lo pudo lograr con los créditos que la Fundación le ha entregado, ahora esta joven comerciante puede comprar una variedad de productos y puede dejarles mas tiempo a sus clientes el crédito, un promedio de 35 clientes fijos ha podido reunir y que son muy responsables, hasta ahora no se ha atrasado con los pagos del  crédito.

Con este  nuevo crédito invertirá todo en productos como perfumes que son los que mas se venden y además bisutería para damas, el sueño de nuestra socia es tener su empresa de productos.
texts.en:
The “Camino del Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets in the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. Eliana L. is one of the members. She chatted with us and commented that she was very grateful for the opportunity that the foundation offers to be able to continue working. Eliana, 24, is a young merchant with many goals. She started in sales when she was 18 years old with her sister, who encouraged her to work. Because of the financial situation they were in, she had to interrupt her schooling; her father became ill and she and her sister had to take charge of the household expenses. This made her into a responsible person and she decided to become a member of the foundation. She started out selling clothing but now she sells Avon and Yanbal beauty products. Since these products are catalogue sales, she doesn’t have much time available between the time her customers place orders and when she has to pay for the products. So, she decided she needed her own capital and was able to secure it through loans from the foundation. Now, this young merchant is able to buy an assortment of products and is able to give her customers a longer period of time to repay her. She has an average of 35 regular customers that are very responsible; to date; she hasn’t been late with her own loan payments. She will use this new loan to buy products, like perfumes, which are the best sellers, and women’s costume jewelry. Her dream is to have a firm of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon and Yanbal beauty products.

loans.name: Esmeraldas Yasmin

texts.es:
La señora Esmeraldas forma parte del Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúnen en la ciudad de Montecristi en la Provincia de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador, esta ciudad es reconocida por sus grandes artesanos que elaboran a mano muebles y sombreros en paja toquilla al igual que los detalles mas finos en tagua.

Al visitar el Banco Camino Al Progreso conversamos con la señora Esmeraldas de 41 años de edad esta casada lleva 37 ciclos en el banco, se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos, para abastecer el negocio tiene que viajara hasta el puerto de Manta a unos 20 minutos de su ciudad natal, junto al esposo han sabido mantener el negocio, el es el encargado de hacer las compras en la pangas  en la madrugada dos veces por semana y en ocasiones cuando tiene mas pedidos y el pescado esta mas barato tiene que hacer algunas ventas y viajar hasta la ciudad de Quito a entregar a los clientes, cuenta la señora Esperanza que por esta época de semana santa el difícil conseguir a buen precio el pescado, es cuando mas caro está y no resulta porque no queda ganancias.

Nuestra socia Esperanza con este nuevo crédito invertirá todo en tiras de pescados, esta segura que se venderá todo aunque les quede poca ganancias lo importante  es no dejar el negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Esmeraldas is a member of the communal bank "Camino Al Progreso." They meet in the city of Montecristi in the Manabí province on the cost of Ecuador. This city is known for its great artisans who make furniture by hand and Panama hats as well as the finest details in tagua (a nut). When we visited the communal bank "Al Progreso" we spoke with Señora Esmeraldas. She is 41-years-old, married, and has been with the bank for 37 cycles. She buys and sells shell fish for a living. To stock her business, she has to travel to the port in Manta which is twenty minutes from the city of her birth. She and her husband have learned how to keep the business going. He is in charge of buying in the catfish early in the mornings, two times a week. And now and again, when has more orders, and the fish is cheaper, he has to make some sales and travels to the Quito to supply his customers. Mrs. Esmeralda tells us that during Easter week it's hard to get a good price on fish; it's when it's most expensive and isn't worth it because they don't make a profit. Our member, Esmeralda, will invest this entire loan in fish. She is sure that she will sell all of it even if she doesn't make much. The most important thing is to not let the business go.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Giorgina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúnen en la ciudad de Montecristi en la Provincia de Manabí, esta ciudad es de clima templado, es aquí donde se realizan los mas finos acabados de artesanía en paja toquilla y tagua, sus habitantes viven de este trabajo y son reconocidos a nivel mundial.

La señora Georgina es una habitante de esta bella ciudad, y desde hace 37 ciclos  forma parte de la Fundación, esta casada tiene 4 hijos, el esposo es empleado publico, y ella en sus ratos libres del hogar se convierte en comerciante informal de ropa, con los créditos que ha venido recibiendo de la Fundación ha ido invirtiendo en sus negocio y ha logrado incrementarlo de una manera bastante rentable que en los actuales momentos se siente muy bien con las ganancias obtenidas, para poder surtir el negocio ella tiene que viajara hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar a los distribuidores ropa tales como interiores, blusas, pantalones y todo lo que el cliente pida.

La señora Georgina invertirá  todo el crédito en surtir sus negocio tiene varios pedidos por entregar en este mes, la manera que ella entrega es visitando a los clientes en sus casas dejándoles a créditos con el plazo de quince días para reunir el dinero y una vez que reúne el capital y las ganancias viaja a comprar mas mercadería. Cuenta nuestra socia que su mayor sueño es poder agrandar su negocio y seguir trabajando con la Fundación.
texts.en:
The “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets in Montecristi, Manabí province. This city’s weather is mild and it is here where the finest straw and tagua nut handicrafts are made; its residents support themselves with this kind of work and are known worldwide. Georgina is a resident of this beautiful city. For the past 37 loan cycles she has been part of the foundation. She’s married and has 4 children. Her husband is a public employee. During her free time from household chores she is an informal clothing merchant. She has invested the foundation’s loans in her business and has managed to make it quite profitable; she is happy with her current earnings. To stock her business, she must travel to the city of Manta to buy clothing like underwear, blouses, pants and everything else her customers request, from wholesalers. Georgina will use the entire loan to stock her business. She has several pending orders to fill this month. She visits her customers door-to-door and leaves their items with them granting them a two-week period of time to save up to repay her. With her profits, she travels again to get more merchandise. She tells us that her greatest dream is to enlarge her business and to continue collaborating with the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es casado y tiene 3 hijos,  es taxista desde hace 30 años, ha trabajado como chofer de flota y hace el servicio de taxis de Santa Cruz a Paurito, tambien trabaja con las colonias de menonitas de las brechas llevando medicamentos de los cuales gana porcentajes. en las temporadas de siembra ayuda a su cuñado sembrando sandia, yuca, los cuales le genera ingresos adicionales que ayudan al mantenimiento del hogar. Junto con su esposa se encargan de la educacion y alimentacion de tres de sus hijos, uno de sus hijos tambien ayuda a sus padres ya que trabaja medio dia en la venta de CD`s en el mercado La Ramada. Con el dinero del credito com prara repuestos para su vehiculo y para el mantenimiento del mismo ya que esta teniendo algunas fallas, el  señor Francisco es un hombre trabajador que dia a dia se esfuerza para darles lo necesario a su familia y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida, uno de sus deseos es de comprar una casa para ir a vivir con toda su familia ya que vive en alquiler y es mucho dinero perdido ya que los meses pasan rapidos. Esta muy agracecido con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is married and has three children. He has been a taxi driver for 30 years and currently works as part of a fleet of vehicles that provides taxi services between Santa Cruz and Paurito. Francisco also works for the Mennonite colonies by delivering medicines, of which he earns a percentage. During the planting season, he helps his brother-in-law grow watermelons and cassava to earn additional income to maintain his household. His wife is in charge of feeding and acquiring an education for their three children. One child helps out by working half-days at the Ramada Market selling CDs.

The funds he requested will be used to buy spare parts for his vehicle and pay for maintenance since it is currently experiencing a few problems. Sr. Francisco is a hardworking gentleman who strives day after day to provide his family everything they need and improve their quality of life. One of his wishes is to buy a house in which his entire family can live because he loses a considerable amount of money paying rent as the months pass by quickly. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosalía no esta casada pero tiene 2 hijitos es madre soltera,  clienta nueva, se dedica a la venta de pan casero, empanada de queso y tortilla, viene trabajando hace 3 años en el rubro, tiene dos hijitos bajo su cargo  que se encuentran en edad escolar, por las tardes la señora se dedica a la venta de pan de manera ambulante, dejando en diferentes tiendas  de su zona, vive en la casa de su abuelo, desde que era niña ya que se crio con sus abuelos ya que quedo huerfana desde chica. 
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una heladera y lo restante para el incremento de capital de trabajo.

Es una persona responsable y trabajadora siempre pensando en lo mejor para sus hijas desea verlas convertirse en mujeres responsables y trabajadoras, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a single mother of two, school-aged children, who are under her care. She is a new client. She sells home-baked bread, cheese turnovers and tortillas. She has been in this line of work for three years. She sells bread door-to-door delivering to several stores in her area. She lives in her grandfather’s house because she was raised by her grandparents since she became orphaned as a little girl. She will use the funds to buy a refrigerator; the rest will be used to increase working capital. She is a responsible, hard-working person who is always seeking the best for her daughters, hoping to see them become responsible and hard-working women. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: LA SRA LUISA, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA QUE HA EMPESADO A TRABAJAR CON LA INSTITUCION EL 14 DE 12 DEL 2006. LA MENCIONADA CLIENTE ES VIUDA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA SEÑORAS DE POLLERA, ADEMAS ES MUJER SOLA QUIEN HACE ESTUDIAR A SUS TRES HIJAS QUIENES ESTAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD QUIENES TIENEN MUCHOS DESEOS DE SUPERACION PARA ENFRENTAR A LA VIDA Y POSTERIORMENTE AYUDAR A SU MADRE QUE LES DEDICA SU TIEMPO Y SU AMOR.ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA QUE DESDE LA MUERTE DE SU ESPOSO SE SACRIFICO SOLA POR SUS HIJAS PARA DARLES UNA BUENA EDUCACION, FUE MUY DIFICIL CUENTA LA SRA. LUISA SUPERAR LA MUERTE DE SU ESPOSO TANTO PARA ELLA COMO PARA SUS HIJAS, PERO SE ESFORSO PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y AHORA LE VA BIEN SENTIMENTALMENTE Y EN SU NEGOCIO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Luisa is an old client who began to work with the institution on the 14th of December, 2006. She is a widow who is dedicated to selling clothing to "Pollera" women (Pollera is a national costume). Additionally, she is a woman who makes her three daughters, who are at university, study. They have many desires to get ahead and face life and later help their mother who has dedicated her time and love to them. She is a hard-working woman who, since the death of her husband, has sacrificed only for her daughters in order to give them a good education. She has told us that it was very difficult to get over the death of her husband, as much for her as for her children. However, she pushed through to get ahead and now she is emotionally well and her business is going well. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise at wholesale. She is very appreciative for Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Pollera skirts and Cholita hats.

loans.name: Villa Florida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Villa Florida inicia su octavo ciclo con 17 socias, las socias son de la comunidad de Huanchos, Distrito de Paucarbamba, Provincia Churcampa, Departamento de Huancavelica.
Las actividades principales de las socias son crianza de animales menores, agricultura, tienda de abarrotes, compra y venta de animales.
Como es el caso de la Señora Flor que es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Flor se dedica a la venta de animales menores, que compra en las comunidades de la zona, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de animales menores. Los sueños de Flor son comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Huancayo y construir su casa.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamo como 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 6,600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Villa Florida communal bank is starting its 8th loan cycle with 17 members. The members are from Huanchos, Paucarbamba district, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. The main commercial activities of the members are: farming, raising small farm animals, grocery stores, and animal sales. Such is Flor’s case. She lives with her life partner and has two children. She sells small farm animals that she buys in area communities. Her husband helps her with this work. She will use the funds to buy small farm animals. Flor’s dream is to buy a lot in the city of Huancayo to build her house. The members need varying amounts: 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles adding up to a total group loan of 6600 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ANDRES VIVE EN CASA DE SU TIA DONDE VIVE CON SU ESPOSA Y SUS DOS HIJITAS EL COMENZO A TRABAJAR EN UNA  FABRICA DE CEMENTO HACE CUATRO  AÑOS ATRÁS DONDE VIO QUE VENDIENDO CEMENTO COLA ERA UN BUEN NEGOCIO E INGRESO , ACTUALMENTE A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CEMENTO COLA DE LA FABRICA YA QUE LE DAN EN UN MENOR PRECIO Y EL LO VENDE DOS BOLIVIANOS MAS ,ASI ES COMO EL SE GANA LA VIDA  PARA LLEVAR UN PAN DE CADA DIA A SU CASA COMO MUCHOS OTROS EL A IDO PROGRESANDO POCO A POCO Y A LO LARGO DEL TIEMPO  DICE QUE SE COMPRARA UNA CASITA PARA EL Y PARA SU FAMILIA YA QUE ES UN POCO INCOMODO YA QUE VIVE EN LA CASA DE SU TIA AHORA EL ESTA AGRADECIDO CON LA INSTITUCION Y CON KIVA POR DARLE UNA TAZA PREFERENCIAL Y REDUCIR EL MONTO DE SU CUOTA. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Andres lives in his aunt's house where he lives with his wife and his two little daughters. He began working in a cement factory four years ago where he saw that selling cement was a good business and entrypoint. Currently, he buys and sells cement from the factory since they give him a lower price and he sells it for two bolivianos more. In this way he gains life to bring bread home every day. Like many others, he has progressed gradually and after some time he says he will buy a little house for him and his family since it is a little uncomfortable since he lives with his aunt now. He is thankful to the institution and to Kiva for giving him a preferential cup and reducing the amount of his fee. He is appreciative of Emprender and Kiva for the confidence granted by providing the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement at wholesale.

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Vencedoras inicia su sexto ciclo con 14 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Locroja, Provincia D. Churcampa, Departamento D. Huancavelica.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales, panadería, comida, agricultura y ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Octavia que es casada y tiene 6 hijos, Octavia se dedica a la venta D. animales, que compra D. las comunidades D. la zona. Además Octavia tiene una panadería, actividades que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. animales menores. Los sueños D. Octavia son que sus hijos sean profesionales e implementar con máquinas modernas su panadería.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 9,500 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The “Vencedoras” (Triumphant Ones) communal bank starts its 6th loan cycle with 14 members, who are from Locroja district, Churcampa province, Huancavelica department. The members have different commercial activities like: animal sales, bakery, food preparation, farming and cattle raising. Such is Octavia’s case. She is married and has 6 children. Octavia sells animals that she buys in area communities. Besides, Octavia has a bakery. Her husband and children help her out with her work. She will use the funds to buy small farm animals. Octavia’s dream is that her children become professionals and to equip her bakery with modern equipment. The members need varying amounts: 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, adding up to a total 9500 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

loans.name: Lilliam Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Lilliam Del Socorro tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, con edades entre 11 y 15 años de edad. La señora tiene en su casa un negocio de carpintería, generalmente elaboran sillas abuelitas, comedores, roperos, y en general todos los artículos de madera. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años, cabe señalarse antes el negocio era manejado por su esposo,  pero él tuvo que ir a otro país en busca de mejorar su condición, sin embargo en ese tiempo ella quedo a cargo de mantener a flote el negocio ya que tienen todos los clientes solo de entregar los productos. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que actualmente tienen bastantes pedidos de camas matrimoniales de madera y de sillas abuelitas. Ella generalmente entrega sus mercancías a personas que vienen de Managua a encargarle sus productos, vende generalmente varios artículos a la vez, por lo que se le podría denominar como mayorista. Su sueño en el futuro, es comprar nuevas maquinarias para el negocio, buscando que este siempre se mantenga activo y brinde la estabilidad económica que ella y sus hijos necesitan.
texts.en:
Lilliam Del Socorro, 40, is married and has two children, who are 11 and 15 years of age. She has a carpentry shop in her home. Her usual products are rocking chairs, dining sets, armoires, and generally all kinds of wood items. She started this business 5 years ago; her husband used to run it. However, he had to move to another country seeking better work opportunities and she had to be in charge of the business and keep it solvent because they had customers that needed their products delivered. She will use these funds to buy raw materials because she has several pending orders for wood double beds and rocking chairs. Her usual customers are residents of Managua that come to her to order items. She sells several items at once so one could say that she is a wholesaler. Her dream for the future is to buy new machinery for the shop so that it will always be active and provide the economic stability that she and her children require.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry raw materials.

loans.name: Ema Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Emma Elizabeth actualmente es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno tiene 26 años de edad y el otro tiene 12 años de edad y habita con ella. La señora posee un negocio de cafetín, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación, normalmente ofrece refrescos, gaseosas, y también ofrece golosinas, últimamente también ha estado invirtiéndole un poco al negocio de comida el cual distribuye allí mismo. La señora ya tiene 40 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó con dulces, tortillitas. Con el tiempo fue invirtiéndole poco a poco hasta llegar a tener el negocio que posee ahora, más surtido y con mayor clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de productos varios, y ser distribuidos desde su cafetín. Su sueño más anhelado ha sido siempre establecer una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y de esta manera estabilizar un poco más los ingresos de la familia, ya que su esposo no trabaja por ser jubilado, sin embargo es muy poco lo que le dan para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Emma Elizabeth is married and has two children, one of whom is 26 years old and the other, who is 12, and lives with her She has a café in her home. She usually offers soft-drinks, beverages, sweets. Lately, however, she has also been offering prepared meals that she sells there as well. She has been in this line of work for 40 years; she started out with just candy and tortillas. In time, she gradually invested more until she had the business she now does: better stocked and with a larger customer base. She will use the funds to stock her café. Her greatest wish is to establish a large grocery store in her home so that she can stabilize her income a bit more because her husband, who is retired, no longer works and what he earns is not enough to survive on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her cafe.

loans.name: Los Saucos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Saucos inicia su octavo ciclo con 16 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. Pampalca, Distrito D. San Pedro D. Coris, Departamento D. Huancavelica. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales menores, quesos, cereales, verduras, ropa, agricultura y ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Julia que es casada y tiene 8 hijos, Julia se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir a base D. tejidos y también telar, la lana los compra D. Huancayo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. lana y para hacer arreglar su telar. Los sueños D. Julia son comprar un terreno para construir otra casa, porque la que tiene esta por derrumbarse y educar a sus hijos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 8,200 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Los Saucos" is starting its eighth cycle with 16 members; they are from the community of Pampalca, district of San Pedro D. Coris, Department of Huancavelica. The members are engaged in different types of business such as selling vegetables, cheeses, grains, small farm animals, and clothing as well as agriculture and cattle farming. For instance, Sra. Julia is married and has eight children. Julia works in the manufacture of clothing based on loom-woven fabrics; she buys the wool in Huancayo. Her loan will be used for the purchase of wool and to have the loom fixed. Julia's dream is to educate her children and also to purchase a plot of land to build a new house. She needs to do this because her present house may start to crumble soon. The members need loans in different amounts such as 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, and 600 soles, totalling 8200 soles in loans to be disbursed by the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and loom repairs

loans.name: Sofia Irene

texts.es: La Sra. Sofia A. H. vive en el Caserío de San Antonio,junto a sus dos  hijos de 10 y 23 años de edad. Es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos ya son casados.  Tiene casa propia. Su hijo quien vive con ella la apoya con los gastos de la unidad familiar. Su casa actualmente está construida de caña,ya que después del terremoto no pudo concluir dicha construcción. Labora como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años en una empresa agrícola de la zona. Solicita financiamiento para continuar con la construcción  de su vivienda, y lograr su objetivo, que es poder tener una casa digna. Su sueño es poder construir su casa para sus hijos y ayudarlos en su educación. La Sra. Sofia A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Sofia A. H. lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio. She lives in her own house with two of her children, one of whom is 10 years old and the other 23. She is a single mother of five children; three of them are already married. The son who lives with her helps her with household expenses. Her current house is made of reeds since, after the earthquake, she wasn't able to finish the construction. For the last two years Sofia has been working a field laborer for a regional agricultural company. She is asking for a loan in order to continue the construction of her house. Her dream is to build a decent home for her children and to help them with their education. Sofia A. is grateful for the help we are able to provide.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her home

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena C. de 44 años casada, tiene 4 hijos que le ayudan a atender el negocio llamado Deposito Santo Domingo; ella cuenta que es una persona con muchas ideas de superacion, ella soño con tener una tienda y lo logro con la ayuda de Dios de su esposo que la apoya en todo momento. Se ha superado ya que es una mujer emprendedora y con esfuerzo ha hecho crecer su negocio hoy ella distribuye su producto en varias zonas de Comalapa de donde es originaria ya cuenta con un vehiculo que le sirve para repartir el producto esto le ha ayudado a tener mas ganancias pero necesita mas capital para tener producto en existencia para poder atender a sus clientes siempre y darles un mejor servicio llegando hasta la puerta de su casa, lo que es este momento desea es poner otras ventas de producto lo que quiere tambien es que sus hijos tengan una vida de calidad y hacerse profecionales.
texts.en:
Elena C. is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children who help her tend to her business named the Deposito Santo Domingo. She is a person with a great desire to succeed who dreamt of having a store; she managed to achieve this with God’s help and her husband’s support. She has been able to overcome challenges because she is a very entrepreneurial woman who, with great effort, has managed to grow her business. She distributes her products in various areas in Comalapa, the area she’s from, and has a vehicle that allows her to distribute her merchandise. Being able to do this has helped her increase her earnings, but she needs additional working capital so she can stock more products to meet customer demand. At this time, she would like to have a greater variety of products to offer for sale, as well as to provide her children with a higher standard of living so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks/sodas.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Juana Mercedes tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, anteriormente había solicitado un crédito pues fue de gran beneficio. Actualmente sigue adelante con su negocio como es la venta de ropa usada. En meses ha tenido problemas con la distribución de su producto, pero esto se debe a que las personas sin trabajo ahora están buscando como poner negocios, y este negocio de ropa usada es el más fácil de establecer, además que las ganancias son promedias. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima, ya que tiene la demanda de sus clientes. Su sueño, es tener una tienda en el mercado de Managua, en el cual distribuya todos sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora Juana Mercedes has worked with Fundación for a long time. Previously, she applied for a loan which was of great benefit to her. Currently, she is moving ahead with her business selling used clothing.

The last few months sales have been low because a lot of unemployed people are trying to set up their own businesses, and the sale of used clothing is the easiest to establish. In addition, profits are just average. This loan is for the purchase of inventory to meet the demand from customers. Her dream is to have her own shop in Managua’s market in which she con distribute all her products at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Haydee Mercedes

texts.es: Haydee tiene un negocio que ella misma administra hace 5 años, empezó trabajando para otras personas, como vendedora y ayudante así pudo aprender  y decidió aperturar un negocio de confecciones de ropa para  niños, además juntamente con su esposo cantan música vernacular algo que hacen desde jóvenes. Estos trabajos les ayudan a solventar los gastos familiares  así como también la educación de sus hijos, sus objetivos son poder cancelar el terreno que obtuvieron con mucho esfuerzo y emprender una  pequeña empresa de confecciones. El préstamo obtenido lo invertirán en comprar telas e hilos para su nueva temporada de confecciones. La Sra. Haydee esta agradecida con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Haydee has a business that she has been managing herself for five years. She started working for other people as a salesperson and an assistant. That way she was able to learn. She decided to open a business making children’s clothes. Also, she and her husband sing vernacular music. They have done this since they were young. These jobs help them pay the family expenses. They also pay for their children’s education. Her objective is to be able to finish paying for a piece of land that they got through much effort. She wants to undertake a small clothes making company. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread for the new season of making clothes. Haydee is grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre han sido de gran ayuda. Ella realiza la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado luchar para mejorar su condición de vida, pues además ella sabe coser muy bien ciertas prendas de vestir y esto le proporciona ciertas ganancias. Con el dinero que solicita será invertido en capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, trajes y telas. Su deseo es mantener este negocio, activo ya que últimamente ha enfrentado una serie de problemas.
texts.en:
Lucia Ramona has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and they have been a great support. She has been buying and selling clothes for more than 20 years. She has always been struggling to improve her living condition as she also knows how to sew certain garments and this provides her a certain income. With the money requested she will invest in work capital to buy clothes such as trousers, shirts, suits, and material. It is her wish to maintain this business active as she has been facing some problems lately.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal club de la amistad está conformado por 9 socios comprometidos con el préstamo, todos son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos así lo demuestra su record crediticio.

La presidenta Giovanna se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, decidió hacer esto porque necesitaba apoyar en casa con los gastos familiares, así que una amiga la ayudo a ingresar a este negocio.. Ella está contenta porque les brindan charlas de belleza y puede aportar  a su hogar.
La mayoría de la socias tienen bodegas con las cuales pueden aportar en la economía familiar, Tal es el caso de Judith con los ingresos de su bodega pudo ayudar a su esposo, y juntamente abrieron una tapicería en casa, además el esposo se dedica al planchado y pintura de autos. Después de muchos inconvenientes ella está contenta con los pequeños negocios que tiene.
Leonarda se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de un colegio, hace mucho tiempo, ella es una socia de edad madura así que es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos. Además ella cría y vende animales en un  terreno  rural de su propiedad.
El grupo cursa el ciclo 15 y están agradecidos con el préstamo.
texts.en:
"La Alcancía Comunal", is a friendship club conformed by 9 members committed to the loan, who are responsible and punctual with their payments according to their credit history.

The president, Giovanna, sells beauty products from catalog. She decided to do so as she needed to help with the family expenses so a friend introduced her to this business. She is happy because she gets training on beauty and can contribute at home. The majority of the members have general stores and contribute to the family economy. This is the case of Judith who helped her husband with the earnings from her store and together they set up an upholstery at home, and her husband also irons and paints vehicles for a living. After many inconveniences she is pleased with the small businesses they own.

Leonarda has been selling food outside a school for a long time, she is an elderly member who is well-known and respected by her neighbors. She also raises and sells animals from a rural plot she owns. The group has been together for 15 cycles and is grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela M. B. de 32  años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su hija de 10 años de edad.Es madre soltera.Trabaja  como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años en la empresa agricola la Venta. Quiere terminar algunos acabados de su vivienda. Es una  persona muy trabajadora y gracias a ello le brinda una buena  educación a su hija con mucho esfuerzo y pretende tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. La Sra Angela M. B. agradece la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.





.
texts.en:
Mrs. Angela M. B. is 32 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her 10 year-old daughter. She has been working as a field worker for 2 years with the agricultural enterprise "la Venta". It is her wish to finish building her house. She is a hard-working lady and therefore she is giving a good education to her daughter with a lot of effort, and she hopes to obtain a better life quality. It is her dream to finish building her house. Mrs. Angela M. B. is grateful for the support given by us to make her dreams come true. .

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishes for a house

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: Noel Antonio tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, con capital propio y lo realizo con el objetivo de obtener un ingreso que es necesario para mantener a su hijo que está a su cargo. Pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. La comercialización de sus productos la realiza a las orillas del parque pues es muy transitado por mucho clientes. Fue este el motivo para solicita financiamiento que es para la compra de ropa interior, trajes, calcetines, pantalones y camisas. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio y además proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Noel Antonio is 44 years old, and for a living he has been selling general merchandise for more than 5 years with his own capital. It is his objective to obtain the necessary income to maintain his son as he has always been worried to satisfy the needs of his family. He sells his products outside the park as many customers walk by. Therefore he requests financing to be able to buy underwear, suits, socks, trousers, and shirts. It is his wish to get ahead with his business as well as to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores C. es otra  socia activa del Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 11 años estudiantes de secundaria y primaria  respectivamente  en establecimientos de la localidad, su esposo trabaja  como chofer de una camioneta de alquiler,   y ella es comerciante de todo tipo de  ropa, lleva dos años en ésta actividad de jueves a domingo no solo en su localidad sino también en pueblos vecinos donde recorre dejando a credito su mercadería,   su mayor orgullo es tener su casa propia aunque aún está en construcción, su meta es terminar de construir su casa y ampliar mucho más su negocio.

María Dolores tiene 39 años es socia del banco comunal hace tres ciclos invitada por su cuñada, ahora mantiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras  y socios del bankito con los  que comparten grandes momentos. Con el dinero del crédito solicitado va a comprar edredones, sábanas, pantalones, casacas, blusas, camisas, etc. para abastecer su negocio y ofrecer a su distinguida clientela variedad de prendas de vestir y para el hogar.
 
El Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil está ubicado en la comunidad Cochapamba  en la parroquia El Valle, se caracteriza por su gente cálida y muy amable que  en su mayor parte se dedican a la agricultura y  cría de animales de corral,  también cuentan con atractivos turísticos como la colina de Tasqui que nos permiten tener una impresionante vista de la parroquia y de le ciudad de Cuenca.
texts.en:
María Dolores C. is another active member of "Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil". She lives with her significant other and their two children, 12 and 11 years old, middle and elementary students at local schools. Her husband works as a driver of a van for rent and she has been selling all kinds of clothes for two years, from Thursday through Sunday, not only in her neighborhood but also at the neigboring villages. She sells on credit. It is her greatest pride to own her house even if it is still being built and it is her goal to finish building her house and improve her business. María Dolores is 39 years old, has been a member of the "banco comunal" for three cycles, invited by her sister-in-law and she has become friend with all the partners of the bank having a good time together. With the loan requested she will buy comforters, sheets, trousers, jackets, blouses, shirts, etc to improve business and be able to offer her distinguished customers a variety of clothes and items for their homes. "Banco Comunal Tierra Fértil" is located in the community of Cochapamba in the parish of El Valle. Its main feature is the warm and very kind people who mostly are dedicated to agriculture and raising of corral animals. It also has tourist attractions such as the hill of Tasqui which offers an impressive view of the parish and the town of Cuenca.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase comforters, sheets, trousers, shirts, blouses, jackets, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yams to sell

loans.name: G.s. G.m.s Group

texts.es: La Señoras Flor de Maria, Maria Ignacia y José Antonio. Forman el grupo solidario G.M.S ellos tienen diferentes actividades económicas, por lo que siempre se preocupan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su compañero José  se dedica a la  crianza y venta de pelibuey, por lo que se unió a Flor y Maria Ignacia ya que necesitaba mejorar su negocio, el tiene muy pocos animales y es por eso que solicita el financiamiento para la compra de pequeños pelibuey y así criarlos y venderlos. Por lo que juntos se han unido para proporcionarles mejores aportes a su negocio. el sueño de los tres integrantes es mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria, Maria Ignacia and José Antonio are the members of the G.M.S. communal bank. Each has a different commercial activity through which they each strive to improve their living conditions. José raises goats of the pelibuey breed; he joined Flor and Maria Ignacia in order to improve his business. He only has a few animals and this is why he is asking for funds to buy small pelibuey goats to raise for sale. They have banded together to provide better support for their businesses. The three group members dream with keeping their businesses active.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goats.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 30-year-old married father with one child. He has run a green-grocer shop since 2002. He and his wife work hard to provide for their family. He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future. John has requested a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to his stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juana Catalina

texts.es:
La señora  Juana Catalina  Vásquez es socia del banco  Tierra Fértil, integrado por un grupo de mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras dedicas al trabajo de campo y en otras actividades para salir avante junto a sus familias, éste banco lo encontramos en la comunidad Cochapamba en  la parroquia El  Valle, se caracteriza por ser una de las mayores productoras de maíz y papas,  tiene también lugares  turísticos como el Cerro denomiando El Verde que era  sagrado para los Cañarís población indígena que habitó ésta región, aquí  se encuentran gran cantidad de vestigios cerámicos de la época y además podemos disfrutar de una hermosa vista panorámica de  gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca.

Nuestra socia  tiene 25 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de un niño de cuatro  años,  vive en casa de sus suegros hasta terminar  de construir su casa propia que ya está bastante avanzada, su esposo se dedica al comercio de vehículos mientras que ella a la venta de productos cosméticos Yanbal en el que lleva tres años ofreciendo sus productos a familiares, conocidos y sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta dejando con facilidad de pago para captar más clientes.

Este es su  tercer ciclo y el dinero obtenido siempre lo ha invertido en su negocio abasteciéndole con nuevas líneas para toda la familia y  para su hogar con algo básico que ha faltado, con el crédito solicitado  va a adquirir  maquillajes, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos,  bisutería,  etc. para damas, caballeros y niños.

Tiene como meta  terminar su casa lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Juana Catalina Vásquez, 25, is a member of the Tierra Fértil (Fertile Soil) communal bank, composed of hard-working, enterprising women, who are into farming and other activities to support their families. This communal bank is in the Cochapamba community, El Valle parish. It is known for being a major potato and corn producing area. It also has tourist attractions like a hill, called El Verde, which was sacred to the Cañarís indigenous peoples that used to live here. One can find many pottery shards from that era and also enjoy a panoramic view of large part of the city of Cuenca. She is married and has a 4-year-old son. She lives with her in-laws while her own house is being built, construction is quite advanced. Her husband is a vehicle merchant and she sells Yanbal beauty products. She has been in this line of work for three years selling her wares to her relatives and acquaintances. She sells door-to-door and offers easy payment plans in order to attract more customers. This is her third loan cycle; she has used her previous loans to stock her business with new lines of products for the entire family and to buy any needed basic items for her home. With this requested loan she will buy makeup, perfumes, creams, skin treatments, jewelry, etc. for women, men and children. Her goal is to finish building her house as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Bernarda De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Bernarda de la Concepción tiene 46 años de edad tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio con muy pocas cantidades de ropa, y al ver que sus clientes respondieron decidió invertir un poco más, Bernarda es una persona que demuestra que le gusta mucho su trabajo. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como ropa para niños, ropa para caballeros, para damas y además sobrecamas. Algo que desea en el futuro, es ampliar su negocio de venta de vestuario, ya que su clientela es muy buena y le compran bastante. Por ello desearía establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 46 years old and has four children. She sells clothing and has been in this business for the past eleven years. She began with a few items and when she noticed that her customers responded, she invested more into her business. Bernarda is a person who demonstrates that she lives her work very much. She will use the money from this loan to provide working capital to buy more clothing for children, gentlemen, and ladies. She will also buy bedspreads. She would like to expand her clothing business, now that she has steady customers who buy plenty of items. This is why she would like to establish a clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
When Javier first opened his cosmetics stall at the Berryessa flea market in San Jose two years ago, he found that demand for the products he carried grew quickly. He can attribute much of his success since then to excellent rapport with his customers and high receptiveness to their suggestions. “I receive a lot of help from my customers. In this business, particularly, you have to treat people well, and then they’ll come back.” 

Before he began selling “everything for the woman,” as he describes it, Javier worked in construction and sold vegetables at the market, but he had a strong desire to be his own boss. He knew that he had the customer service skills, as well as the strong work ethic, to open his own stall. Javier sells his products at the market on the weekend, and works at a factory full-time during the week. He explains that he gets anxious if he has too much free time on his hands and enjoys his full work schedule. 

Javier learned about Opportunity Fund years ago from a friend that also operates a stall. This is Javier’s second loan with Opportunity Fund, and he will use the $4,500 to increase his inventory. By making monthly trips to Los Angeles, he will be able to purchase more goods at a cheaper price to bring back to his customers in San Jose. He hopes that the loan and his increased earnings will allow him to hire an employee to help manage the stall.

loans.use: Help fund trips to Los Angeles to increase inventory of his flea market business

loans.name: La Buena Union 2,3 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group la Buena Union (The Good Union), and her story is representative of her group's members and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor — an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable), and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure as a single mother with her children.

Martha is excited to be taking out her second loan from Esperanza, having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to buy shampoos and rinses which she sells to the various beauty salons in her neighborhood. She will use the profits to invest in her children's education and save toward sending them to college. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Shampoo and rinse to sell

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 61 años, por lo que no es la primera experiencia que obtiene. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una librería hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que tiene una amplia variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos, pues además ofrece precios muy bajos y esto atrae a las mayoría de sus clientes. En su negocio vende ciertos productos como papel, calculadora, tijeras y útiles escolares. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima que es necesaria para su negocio. ella sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Candida is 61 years old. She has had a bookstore for more than five years. She has a wide number of customers who request different items. She offers low prices and this attracts most of her customers. She also sells certain other products, such as papers, calculators, scissors, and school supplies. She will use the money from this loan to provide working capital and buy supplies for her business. She wants to improve her business and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Daniel Pascual

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel es transportista desde hace varios años, este es su segundo crédito y anteriormente fue cliente KIVA, no tuvo dias de atraso él es un joven que vive con su señora madre en la zona de Alto Florida, es soltero, y tiene hermanas con las que vive y comparte gastos en alimentación y otros servicios, actualmente el joven Daniel se esta haciendo cargo de los trámites de la casa que dejo su padre, quien fallecio hace unos seis meses aproximadamente, ya que es el único hijo varon y le dieron el poder para dichos trámites, es una persona joven, muy responsable en sus pagos, con su trabajo adquirió otra movilidad de la cual recibe renta semanal, con el dinero del credito comprara llantas para su movilidad ya que esta necesita un cambio de llantas ya que esta presentando fallas, uno de sus deseos es el de formar familia muy pronto, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Daniel has been a taxi driver for various years. This is his second loan and previously he was a Kiva client. He is a young man who lives with his mother in the Alto Florida zone. He is single and has sisters with whom he lives and shares the food bills and other expenses. Currently, young Daniel is in charge of responsibilities that were left behind by his father, who passed away six months ago. Since he is the only male child, he was given the power over said responsibilities. He is a young person, who is responsible with his repayments. With his work, he acquiried another vehicle for which he receives weekly rent. With the money from the loan, he will buy wheels for his vehicle since it needs a change since he's noticed faults. One of his wishes is to start a family soon. He is thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheels.

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarios 1,5 Group

texts.en: Carmen plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling underwear, by travelling to the capital to purchase her goods in the main markets and then selling them at a profit in her community. She is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She will use the profit to invest in her future by saving towards her goal of opening her own salon, as well as saving money for the education of her children. Carmen is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Solidarias ("Women in Solidarity"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children. Carmen thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase underwear to sell

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
El banco Tierra Fértil está ubicado en la comunidad Cochapamba aquí su población en especial la mayor se dedica a la agricultura sembrando principalmente maíz y papas,  también crían  aves de corral y además gozan de  atractivos turísticos como el Río  Maluay cuyo entorno ofrece la posibilidad de disfrutar momentos de recreación para toda la familia bajo el  hermoso paisaje andino.

La señora  Rosa Vásquez es otra de las socias de éste banco, con 37 años de edad se encuentra casada y madre de dos niños de 13 y 14 años, sus hijos estudian en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo era conserje de una clínica pero al momento no se encuentra trabajando, se siente muy orgullosa de poseer su casa propia gracias al esfuerzo conjunto con su esposo


AL momento Rosa se encuentra trabajando como conserje de una clínica actividad que hace un mes comenzó a desempeñar, tiene turnos  de 24 horas y  en sus días libres trabaja lavando ropa ajena  de sus conocidas en ésta labor lleva ya  varios años, mientras que los fines de semana vende comida rápida como  carnes asadas y salchipapas, como es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre está en busca de maneras para ganarse la vida y sacar adelante a su familia.

Es socia activa del banco comunal hace tres  ciclos y le gusta  mucho ya que está conformado  un grupo de amigas y amigos que siempre están en busca de mejores días con el apoyo muto de cada uno de los socios del mismo,  con su nuevo crédito va a comprar pollos, papas, carnes, y otros productos  para la elaboración de sus comidas. Su meta es llegar a tener un mejor espacio físico para aumentar su negocio y adaptarlo para dar un mejor servicio y atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
The bank, Tierra Fértil, is located in the community of Cochapamba. In this area the people work in agriculture. They grow mainly potatoes and corn. They also raise poultry and they enjoy tourist attractions such as the Maluay River. The river, in the beautiful Andean countryside, offers recreational activities for all members of the family Mrs. Rosa is one of the members of the bank. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children ages 13 and 14. Her children study at the local high school. Her husband was a doorman at a clinic but now he is unemployed. She is very proud to own her own house, thanks to the efforts of her and her husband. At this moment Rosa works as a doorman at the clinic. She began this job a month ago. She works 24 hour shifts. On her days off she washes clothes for various people that she knows. She has been washing clothes for many years. On the weekends she sells fast food such as roasted meat and pork with potatoes. She is a hard worker and is always looking for ways to earn money and help her family progress. This is her third cycle of activity with the community bank. She likes belonging to a group of women who are always looking towards better days and are always supportive of each other. With this loan she is going to buy chicken, potatoes, meat and other products to use to make her food. Her goal is to have a better physical space to use to grow her business. This space will allow her to provide better service and will attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, potatoes, meats, brochette sticks, and other products that she needs to prepare food

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl es un señor de 31 años de edad, no está casado pero vive con su concubina que se llama María Alicia y con quién tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad respectivamente. La vivienda donde vive la familia es alquilada y petenece a la tía de Raúl, esta tía vive en otra ciudad por lo que Raúl y María le ayudan en el cobro del alquiler de otros arrendadores que también viven en la misma residencia. Raúl se dedica a l rubro del trasporte desde hace varios años atrás, tiene un vehículo propio que maneja de una provincia a otra, si bien tiene bastante competencia lo que le favorece es que es parte de una cooperativa de transportistas que tiene bastante demanda por parte de los pasajeros. Por otra parte maría no trabaja se dedica a cuidar a su niño y paralelamente ve lo de los alquileres de la tía de su concubino. El destino del crédito fue para la adquisición de material de construcción, como Raúl tiene un pequeño lote tiene planificado construir poco a poco a fin de contar con un domicilio propio. raúl y su concubina tienen muy buenos antecedentes crediticios, esta es la 5ta operación con Agrocapital y durante todo el tiempo de relación comercial demostraron puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Raúl is 31 years of age. He isn't married but he lives with his partner, María Alicia, with whom he has a son, 7, who also lives with them. The house where they live is rented and belongs to Raúl's aunt. She lives in another city, for which reason Raúl and María help with collecting the rent from other renters who also live in the same residence. Raúl works in transport, which he has done for several years. He has his own vehicle which he drives from one province to another. He has quite a lot of competition but what favours him is that he is part of a cooperative of transport workers and there is a lot of demand from passengers. María doesn't work, she looks after her son and also watches over the other renters. This loan is for the acquisition of construction materials, as Raúl has a small plot of land where he plans to construct, little by little, his own home. Raúl and María have a good credit history, and this is the fifth loan that they have had with Agrocapital. During the time they have been with them they have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 4,5 Group

texts.en: Miguelina plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling candles of the dead (candles that people burn to honor their deceased relatives). She will use the profit to help with her goal of finishing remodeling her home and plans to add a musical element to her business – helping her customers celebrate their deceased relative with music. Miguelina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. Miguelina is the coordinator of her group Luz y Esperanza ("Light and Hope"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, an areas known for its tobacco production where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. Miguelina thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy candles

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio tiene 55 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nery de 53 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Aurelio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus sembríos de plagas que pueden afectar la cosecha. Es así que lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa, por ser muy pesados y los fardos de gladiolos que son muy delicados de transportar, resultándole muy agotador el trabajo. En el futuro, espera comprarse un carro, para que pueda realizar más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, sabe que el crédito que recibirá, le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Además de ser socio de su grupo comunal, le gusta mucho poner orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono e insecticidas para cuidar sus siembras y lograr que sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 55, is a very responsible, hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife, Nery, 53, and his 6 beloved children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Aurelio’s farmlands, which he has acquired through much effort and sacrifice, are the family’s main source of support. His products are highly sought-after by wholesalers in Tarma because he’s famous for producing high quality crops. This good reputation commands good prices. What he likes best about his work is watching over his plantings so that pests will not affect his crop yields. He has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport the sacks of potato, which are very heavy, and the bundles of gladioli, which are very fragile; thus his work is exhausting. In the future, he wants to buy a car so that he can move his products more easily. This is his 9th loan with MFP. He realizes that the loan he will receive will be very beneficial for his work. Besides being a member of his communal group, he enjoys keeping order at the meetings. He will use the 3000 new soles requested to buy manure and insecticide to care for his crops so that they will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for his potato and gladioli crops.

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Anita is the coordinator of her group La Familia Renacer (The Family is Reborn), and her story is representative of the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Anita is excited to be taking out her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado, or small general store, by stocking rice, beans, cooking oil, spaghetti, sauces, and flour as well as a freezer in which to store goods. She will use the profits to save towards her dream of one day opening a supermarket. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: rice, beans, cooking oil, spaghetti, sauces, and flour and a freezer

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  BEATRIZ ESTA CASADA VIVE EN CASA DE LA PRIMA DE SU ESPOSO CON EL Y SUS 2 HIJITOS LOS CUALES ESTUDIAN EN UN COLEGIO FISCAL LA SEÑORA, COMPRA Y VENDE CORTADORAS PARA PLASTOFORMO YA LLEVA CON ESTE NEGOCIO 5 AÑOS DONDE ELLA Y SU ESPOSO LLEVAN ESTOS A LOS COLEGIOS COMO TAMBIEN VIAJAN PARA PROMOCIONAR LAS CORTADORAS,LA SEÑORA SACO EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR MATERIAL Y ASI PODER FABRICARLOS YA QUE ELLA Y SU ESPOSO TOMARON UNAS PEQUEÑAS CLASES PARA APRENDER A FABRICARLOS AHORA ELLOS LO FABRICARAN Y VENDERAN COMO LO HACEN VIAJANDO LLEVANDO A LOS COLEGIOS A PROMOCIONAR ESTOS. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MATERIAL PARA LA ELABORACION DE PLASTOFORMOS,  LA SEÑORA Y SU FAMILIA ESTAN FELICES POR LA OPORTUNIDAD QUE LES DIERON YA QUE LA TASA PREFERNCIAL LE VAJO LA CUOTA QUE IBA A CANCELAR Y EL SOBRANTE LE SERVIRA PARA COMPRAR UN POCO MAS DE MATERIAL.
texts.en:
Beatriz is married. She lives in her husband's cousin's house with her husband and their two little children who are students at the public school. She buys and sells styrofoam cutters. She's had this business for five years where she and her husband take these items to schools. They also travel to promote the cutters. Beatriz took out the loan to buy material to make them since she and her husband took some small classes to learn how. Now they will make and sell them as usual by traveling and taking them to schools to promote them. With the money from the loan, she will buy material to make styrofoam. Beatriz and her family are happy for the opportunity given to them since the preferential rate lowers the fee that they were going to pay and the rest will serve to buy a little more material.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy notebooks, perfumes and stuffed animals

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es:
La Sra. Benigna  tiene como actividad la venta de fruta en el mercado Rodriguez de la ciudad de La Paz a demas de tener esta actividad tiene tambien una pequeña tienda de barrio en la zona donde vive donde vende articulos de primera necesidad la misma  que es atendida por su hija, estas dos actividades son la principal  fuente de ingreso para ellla y su familia. 
El destino del credito sera para la compra de mercaderia para equipar mejor su tienda y tambien comprar fruta de temporada para su correspondiente comercializacion, ella es una buena cliente, puntual y ya que tiene bastante tiempo trabajando junto a  nosotros, es una persona responsable y trabajadora y siempre esta buscando una actividad para tener un dinerito extra y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Benigna makes a living selling fruit in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz. In addition, she also has a small neighborhood store in the area where she lives, where she sells essential items while taking care of her daughter. These two activities are the main sources of income for Benigna and her family. Benigna will use this loan to purchase merchandise so that she can keep her store better stocked, and also purchase seasonal fruits to sell at the market. She is a good customer who is punctual and has worked with us for a long time. She is very responsible and hard working, and is always looking for activities that will allow her to earn a little extra money and thus improve her whole family’s quality of life. Benigna is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise and seasonal fruits

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Don José vive en San Martin, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado y por el momento ella se encuentra en el extranjero ya que tiene visa de contrato, el es chofer de transporte con ruta de San Martin Jilotepeque a Guatemala. Don José solicita el crédito para comprar un repuesto de su caminoneta ya que se le arruino. El sueño de José es tener mas caminonetas y asi tener su propia linea de transportes.
texts.en:
Jose lives in San Martin. He is 39 years old, married to a woman who is currently out of the country on a work visa. He is a driver on the San Martin Jilotepeque line to Guatemala. Jose is requesting a loan to buy a part for his bus, which is broken. Jose’s dream is to have more buses, and his own transportation line.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his bus

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
La alcancía Comunal Virgen D. Copacabana se caracteriza por ser solidaria y responsable en sus pagos.
Hilaria es la presidenta del grupo hace varios años se dedica al comercio viendo la necesidad D. apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. su hogar comenzó a vender ropa, y otros productos ahora solo se dedica a la venta D. queso, los fines D. semana viaja a un lugar D. Lima que se llama Huarochiri y allí es donD. compra el queso, para sus exigentes clientes, este negocio que le ha brindado algunas satisfacciones ya que pueD. conocer este lugar y buscar precios más bajos para tener mayores ganancias.
El tesorero Jorge se dedica a la venta D. tubérculos, en un mercado D. Huaycan vive hace 13 años, ello le permite mantener a sus 3 hijos que aun están en la etapa escolar, Jorge está contento con el préstamo y es muy responsable y exigente con el grupo.
