Edith es una socia que con mucho esfuerzo compro su mototaxi con la ayuda D. su esposo, pero como tiene que dedicar tiempo a su pequeña hija, alquila el mototaxi a una persona D. confianza. Ella trabaja con el mototaxi haciendo servicio D. transporte público los fines D. semana así pueD. tener más ingresos para su casa.
Todo el grupo agradece los préstamos recibidos por KIVA y EDAPROSPO
texts.en:
The “Virgen D. Copacabana” (Our Lady of Copacabana) communal bank is united and responsible with respect to its loan repayments. Hilaria is the group president and has been a merchant for several years because she needs to help her husband meet household expenses. She started out selling clothing and other products; now, she only sells cheese. On weekends, she goes to a part of Lima known as Huarochiri to buy the cheese for her discerning customers. This business has been very satisfying for her in that she has been able to get to know this place and look for better prices so that she can earn higher profits. The group treasurer is Jorge. He sells tubers in one of Huaycan’s markets. He has been in this line of work for 13 years and it has allowed him to support his three children, who are still school-aged. Jorge is happy with the loan and is very responsible and strict with the group. Edith is a member who, with much effort and with help from her husband, was able to purchase a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). Because she must care for her young daughter, she leases the mototaxi to a trustworthy person. She provides public transportation services during weekends to earn extra income for her home. The entire group appreciates the loans granted by KIVA and EDAPROSPO.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
El 1 de diciembre de 1999 Cuenca fue declarada  Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad e inscrita en la lista de Bienes Patrimoniales de la Humanidad  el 4 de Diciembre del mismo año,  pero más allá de esta declaratoria para los habitantes de ésta urbe  es patrimonio de su cultura,  por su situación privilegiada, por su arquitectura, sus vestigios arqueológicos y la belleza natural que encierra ésta hermosa ciudad del austro ecuatoriano. Aquí encontramos el Banco Comunal El Mirador integrado por mujeres soñadoras dispuestas hacer realidad sus sueños a base de esfuerzo y sacrificio con sus familias.

Silvia T. vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con su  hija de doce años, su esposo viajó al exterior y para legalizarse se divorció de ella hace siete años para casarse allá pero una vez legal se olvidó de su familia, ahora ella tiene un nuevo compromiso del cual concibió una niña que se encuentra de un año cuatro meses, aún no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia  trabaja como contadora en una mecánica hace  cinco años, su horario de medio tiempo  le permite por la tarde cuidar de su sobrina mientras que su hermana estudia, también se dedica a la confección y  arreglo de ropa en sus ratos libres y como le gusta los retos éste año se ha propuesto seguir belleza en una academia de la localidad. Su pareja trabaja en el arte de la joyería

Silvia se  encuentra en su cuarto ciclo en el banco comunal  y con su primer crédito compró una máquina de coser,  con los otros  créditos recibidos invirtió en la salud de sus hijas que durante un tiempo pasaron las dos internadas en una clínica del sector. Ahora con el préstamo obtenido va a adquirir  una maquina recubrid ora para así ir ampliando su pequeño taller de costura, tiene como meta llegar a tener un gran taller de costura.
texts.en:
On December 1, 1999 Cuenca was declared a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site, and it was officially registered on Dec. 4th of the same year. But beyond this declaration, for the inhabitants of this city, is the heritage of its culture, its privileged location, its architecture, its archaeological remains and natural beauty that surround this beautiful city of the Ecuadorian highlands. Here we find the communal bank "El Mirador" which is comprised of women dreamers who are ready to make their dreams a reality, based on their efforts and sacrifices with their families. Silvia T. lives in the city of Cuenca with her 12 year-old daughter. Her husband traveled outside the country and, in order to become a legal immigrant, divorced from Silvia 7 years ago so that he could marry there. But once legal, he forgot his family. Now she has a new relationship in which she conceived a daughter, who is now 1 year and 7 months old. They do not have a house so they live in a rented home. Silvia has worked as an accountant at a mechanic's shop for 5 years. Her part time schedule allows for her to care for her niece in the afternoons while her sister studies. In addition, she makes and mends clothing in her free time. As she enjoys a challenge, this year she intends to enroll in a beauty class at a school in her area. Her partner works in the art of jewelry. Silvia is in her 4th loan cycle with the communal bank. With her first loan she bought a sewing machine. With the other loans she received she invested in the health of her daughters who, during a period of time, were admitted to a clinic in her area. Now with this loan she will acquire an industrial sewing machine to expand her small dressmaking workshop. Her goal is to eventually have a large sewing workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to acquire an industrial sewing machine for her business making and mending clothes

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen D. Guadalupe inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, las socias son D. Muchic, Distrito D. Huaytara, Departamento D. Huancavelica.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. animales menores, quesos, cereales, además del servicio D. lavado D. carros.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Teofila que es casada, tiene 3 hijos, Teofila venD. cuyes, al inicio vendía otros productos como la venta D. quesos y frutas, y con la ayuda D. sus hijos su negocio ha mejorado, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cuyes. Los sueños D. Teofila es constituir una empresa y exportar cuyes.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 100 soles, 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 3,000 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen D. Guadalupe begins its first loan cycle with 10 members. The members are from Muchic, in the Huaytara district, Huancavelica department. The members do different activities such as selling small animals, cheeses, cereals, and one has a car-wash business. For example, Señora Teofila is married with 3 children and sells guinea pigs. At the start she sold other products such as cheese and fruit, and with the help of her children her business has improved. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs. Teofila's dreams are to set up a business exporting guinea pigs. The members need different loan amounts such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, making a total of 3,000 soles in loans in this communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Alicia Marina

texts.es:
Alicia J. es socia del banco Comunal  El Mirador, ella  vive en el centro de la parroquia Turi que quiere decir “hermano” en quichua, sus atardeceres son muy hermosos ya que ésta comunidad se encuentra ubicada sobre una colina empinada proporcionando una vista espectacular de las luces de la ciudad en la tarde y noche así como de la cadena montañosa que la rodea.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años  se encuentra casada y fruto de su amor engendró tres hijos  que  se encuentran de 16, 15, 13 años todos estudiantes de colegio, su esposo es empleado domestico, en cambio  Alicia tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres hace diez años  en ella atiende desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.,  y los ratos libres también se dedica a la cría de pollos que luego los vende pelados y también tiene gallinas ponedoras y comercializa sus huevos, con el esfuerzo de su unión conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Lleva tres ciclos en su banco comunal  con los créditos recibidos ha comprado sus animales poco apoco, ahora con el nuevo crédito va a adquirir arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, atún, artículos de limpieza y aseo personal para abastecerla e incrementarla un poco más,  su meta es comprarse un auto  y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia J. is a member of the El Mirador (The Lookout) communal bank. She lives in the middle of Turi, which means “brother” in Quechua, parish. Its sunsets are beautiful because this community is located on a steep hillside which provides a spectacular view of the city lights in the late evening and night as well as of the mountains surrounding it. Alicia is 36 years old, married, and has three children, who are 16, 15 and 13 years of age; all are students. Her husband is a domestic employee. Alicia has had a small grocery store for the past 10 years that she opens for business from 6am to 8pm. During her free time she raises chickens, that she later sells dressed, as well as laying hens that produce eggs for sale. She, together with her husband, has made it possible for them to build their own house. She has been in three loan cycles with her communal bank and has used her loans to gradually buy her animals. She will use the new loan to buy rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, tuna, cleaning supplies and personal hygiene items to stock her store a bit more. Her goal is to buy a car and to continue to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, tuna, cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items.

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Abejitas, inicia su primer ciclo con 7 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Vinchos, Comunidad D. Mayobamba.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cereales, animales menores, carne, agricultura y ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Agustina que es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 11 y 6 años, Agustina se dedica a la venta D. cereales que compra en las diferentes comunidades D. su zona, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad D. Pisco y Cañete, también venD. verduras. Agustina invertirá su préstamo en la compra D. verduras. Los sueños D. Agustina son ampliar su negocio, tener capital propio y educar a sus hijos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total D. 2,200 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Abejitas begins its first loan cycle with 7 members, who are from the Vinchos district, Mayobamba community. The members do different activities such as selling cereals, small animals, meat, agriculture and livestock. Señora Agustina is married with 2 children, 11 and 6 years old. Agustina works selling cereals that she buys in different communities in her zone, which she then sells in the cities of Pisco and Cañete, and also sells vegetables. Agustina will invest her loan in the purchase of vegetables. Agustina's dreams are to expand her business, have her own capital and educate her children. The members need different amounts of loans such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles, making a total of 2,200 soles in loan with the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: Elmer tiene 29 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Saraid de 25 años y su pequeño hijo Antony de 1 año, quienes son el motivo para salir adelante. El trabajo al que se dedica Elmer, es la siembra de papa, choclo, habas, maíz y arvejas, que luego de ser cosechados, son vendidos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Él tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo la calidad de sus productos, no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sobre sus tierras y hacer que sean más fértiles y productivas, es así que lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado, para que lo químicos no perjudiquen su salud. En adelante, continuará vendiendo su producción y aumentar sus rentas, y con el tiempo, desea comprarse un auto, con el que pueda él mismo transportar sus cultivos. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que desea tener nuevos créditos. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los mil setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insecticidas para fumigar sus siembras y asegurar una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Elmer is 29 years old, a hard-working, dependable man. He lives in his own house with his wife Saraid, who is 25, and their 1-year-old son Antony, who is the reason they would like to get ahead. Elmer grows potatoes, corn, beans, and peas, which after being harvested, are sold in Tarma’s wholesale market. He has a number of customers who are always willing to wait for him to buy wholesale, because they know the quality of his product. What he likes best about his work is sowing the seed on his lands and making the crops more fertile and productive. He has been in this line of work for 6 years, and finds that the hardest part is to spray his farms. He has to be careful when spraying, so that the chemicals do not pose a threat to his health. He will continue to sell his crops and increase his profit. In time, he wishes to buy a vehicle, so that he himself can transport his crops. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he will continue to pay the installments on time, since he would like to continue to have credit. He is a responsible member of his communal group, concerned for its wellbeing. With the 1,700 new soles he is requesting, he will buy insecticides to spray his crops and ensure a productive harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides to spray his crops

loans.name: San Jose Mayobamba Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San José D. Mayobamba, inicia su primer ciclo con 7 socias, las socias son del Distrito D. Vinchos, Comunidad D. Mayobamba.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. cereales, animales menores, abarrotes, agricultura.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Maura es casada y 2 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio cuando comenzó a convivir con su pareja, con sus ingresos ayuda a los gastos del hogar, el préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar. Los sueños D. Maura son ampliar su negocio y surtir con mas productos.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total D. 1,600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank San José D. Mayobamba begins its first loan cycle with 7 members, who are from the the Vinchos district, Mayobamba community. The members do different activities such as selling cereals, small animals, groceries and agriculture. Señora Maura is married with 2 children and has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries. She began this business when she started living with her husband. With her earnings she helps with the household costs. This loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Maura's dreams are to expand her business and stock more products. The members require different loan amounts such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 500 soles, making a total of 1,600 soles in loans with the communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Aguas Cristalinas Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Aguas Cristalinas, inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, las socias son del Distrito de Vinchos, Comunidad de Paccha.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta de animales menores, cereales, agricultura.
Como es el caso de la Señora Segundina que es casada, Segundina se dedicara a la compra y venta de animales menores, hasta ahora no realizaba ninguna actividad económica, se dedicaba a su hogar porque no tenia capital, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de cerdos y ovejas. Los sueños de Segundina son ampliar su negocio y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamo como 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles haciendo un total de 8,000 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Aguas Cristalinas (Crystalline Waters) communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with 10 members, who are from Vinchos district, Paccha community. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities such as: animal sales, cereals, farming. Such is the case of Segundina. Segundina is married and is a small farm animal merchant. Up to now, she wasn’t involved in any commercial activity. She was a housewife only because she had no capital. She will use her loan to buy pigs and sheep. Segundina’s dream is to expand her business and educate her children so that they may become professionals. The members each need different loan amounts: 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, adding up to an 8000 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 29 años, es una hombre muy trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejora su calidad de vida. Por lo que considera que tiene la edad suficiente para trabajar y ganar su propio dinero, y dejar de ser una carga para su familia. Es así que todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano trabaja en las chacras que le heredaron sus padres y de esa manera lograr que sus cultivos de papa y arvejas tengan los cuidados necesarios, por que sabe que al momento de venderlos, serán rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, siendo esta actividad su única fuente de ingreso, por lo que lleva 3 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus siembras de los cambios climáticos que afectan mucho su productividad. Más adelante, desea comprar más terrenos para extender sus cultivos. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de arveja, abono e insecticidas, para llevar a cabo una exitosa siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel, 29, is a very hard-working man. He lives in his parents’ house and his greatest desire is to improve his quality of life. He feels that he’s old enough to work and earn his own income and stop being a burden for his family. So it is that every morning he works the fields his parents left him so that his potato and pea crops will have the proper care that will insure their speedy sale once they are harvested. What he likes best about his work is the planting; this activity is his only source of income and he’s been in this line of work for three years. The most difficult part of his work, he thinks, is caring for his plants so that they are protected from the climate changes that so affect productivity. Later on, he’d like to buy more fields so that he can expand his growing area. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he is sure the loan will be of much benefit in the development of his activity. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is highly respected as a result of this. He will use the 1500 new soles requested to buy pea seed, manure and insecticides so that his crop will be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Blanca Elvira

texts.es:
La señora  Blanca P. es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive en  el sector la autopista en la parroquia Turi que quiere decir  "hermano" en quichua, esta localidad está ubicada en  una colina empinada, desde donde podemos disfrutar de  una vista espectacular de las luces de la ciudad en el atardecer y noche, así como apreciar la belleza natural de su cadena montañosa  que lo rodean.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad se encuentra casada y en su unión ha concebido 8 hijos quienes se encuentran de 31, 30, 29, 27, 24, 22, 16 años de edad, cinco de sus hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos de 27 y 24 años solteros trabajan en una fábrica de calzado y le ayudan económicamente con los gastos del hogar, su última  hija estudia en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en una carpintería  y ella se dedica a la cría y venta  de cuyes, pollos en su comunidad  manteniendo un ingreso adicional para cubrir las necesidades de su hogar  y también es para el consumo en su casa , gracias al  sacrificio del  trabajo mutuo lograron  edificar  su casa propia.

Lleva dos ciclos trabajando con  los prestamos de la Fundación gracias a la invitación que le hizo su consuegra a formar parte de éste grupo de mujeres emprendedoras para buscar la superación personal y familiar, con el  nuevo crédito comprará crías de cuyes y alimento para incrementar su criadero. Su sueño es que si le va bien en la venta  de sus animales va a crear otro piso de su casa para agrandar su criadero.
texts.en:
Blanca P. is a member of the communal bank El Mirador. She lives in the Autopista sector of the Turi parish, which means 'brother' in Quechua. This place is located on a steep hill, where one can enjoy a spectacular view of the city in the afternoon and at night and appreciate the natural beauty of the mountain range that surrounds it. Our member is 56 years old and is married with 8 children (31, 30, 29, 27, 24, 22 and 16 years old). 5 of her children are married and live independently. The children who are 27 and 24 are single and worked in a shoe factory and help with the household costs, and her youngest daughter studies in a college in the region. Blanca's husband is a carpenter and she works raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens in her community, giving additional income to cover the necessities of their home, and also for consumption in their home. Thanks to the sacrifices of their mutual work they have been able to have their own home. Blanca has been working with loans from Fundación for 2 loan cycles, thanks to the invitation from her mother-in-law to become part of this group of empresarial woman, in search of improving her family and personal situation. With the new loan she will purchase guinea pigs to breed and feed to increase her breeding place. Her dream is that sales go well. She is going to create another level in her house to increase her breeding room.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs and feed

loans.name: Wilmor Javier

texts.es: Wilmor Javier tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería y ofrecer el servicio de billar. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante. El tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser un hombre responsable. Al inicio no tenía mucho conocimiento de este negocio, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando, además a sus clientes siempre les ha ofrecido un excelente servicio y les gusta conversar con Wilmor. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilmor Javier, 28, has a grocery store and pool tables. He has been in this line of work for over 5 years. He has always enjoyed working and getting ahead in life. He has two children under his care and he has always liked being a responsible man. At the beginning, he didn’t know this business very well but he improved with time; besides, he always offers good customer service and they like chatting with Wilmor. He is asking for funding to buy needed stock items. His wish is to improve his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sarita Colonia, inicia su primer ciclo con 8 socias, las socias son del Distrito de Huaytara, Comunidad de Collahuasi.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta de abarrotes en general, comida, agricultura y ganadería.
Como es el caso de la Señora Marisol que es casada, tiene un hijo de 16 años que esta estudiando, Marisol inicio su negocio con la venta de comida y luego inicio con la tienda de abarrotes, su negocio esta creciendo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar. Los sueños de Marisol son comprar un carro, aumentar su negocio y que su hijo sea profesional.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de préstamo como 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total de 2,600 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The Sarita Colonia communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with 8 members who are from Huaytara district, Collahuasi community. The members have a variety of commercial activities such as: grocery sales, food sales, farming and cattle raising. Such is the case of Marisol. She is married and has a 16-year-old son, who is a student. Marisol started selling food and then set up a grocery store. Her business is growing and she will use these funds to buy rice and sugar. Marisol’s dream is to buy a car, expand her business, and that her son becomes a professional. The members need a variety of loan amounts: 200 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles, 600 soles, adding up to a total 2600 sol group loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno tiene 45 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rafaela de 45 años y sus 5 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida. La actividad a la que Magno se dedica, es la agricultura, en donde cultiva papa, maíz y arvejas, por lo que todos los días desde muy temprano trabaja en sus chacras y sabe que cuanto mejor sea la calidad de sus productos, mejor será el precio que obtenga de la ventas de éstos, en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde ya cuenta con muchos clientes fijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, ya que así ve la recompensa luego de varios meses de trabajo, es así que lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre corre el peligro de que los químicos afecten su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos hasta el mercado con más tranquilidad. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Asimismo en su grupo comunal, es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de papa y arveja, por estar de temporada estos productos, en donde tiene mayor demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Magno, 45, is a loving and responsible father. He lives in his own house with his wife, Rafaela, 45, and their five children, for whom he wants to provide a better life. Magno is a farmer; he grows potatoes, corn and peas. He goes out to work his fields every day very early in the morning. He knows that the better the quality of his products, the higher the sales prices they will command in Tarma’s wholesale market, where he already has many regular customers. What he likes best about his work is harvesting because he sees the result of many months of hard work. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of the job to be fumigating his fields because he always runs the risk that the chemicals might affect his health. In time, he wants to buy a car so that he can move his products to market more easily. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he states that the loan will be of great use to him. He is a responsible and respectful member of his communal group. He will use the requested 500 new soles to buy potato and pea seed since this is the season for these products when demand for them is highest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato and pea seed.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 32 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposa Lourdes de 26 años y sus 2 pequeños hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los campos de cultivo, han sido en la vida de Víctor, una actividad necesaria para vivir, ya que desde muy pequeño sus padres siempre le enseñaron este trabajo, puesto que nada le faltaría y por eso decidió continuar con esta labor familiar. Ahora tiene sus propios cultivos, en donde siembra papa y arveja, y una vez cosechados, los llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma, generando lo ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia. Es así que lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios climáticos que afectan su productividad. Más adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorando sus cultivos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que el crédito que necesita, será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, abono e insecticidas, para tener un buen cultivo.
texts.en:
Victor, 32, is a loving and responsible father. He lives in his own house with his wife, Lourdes, 26, and their two small children, who are the motivating force behind all his efforts. Farming has been a necessary activity for survival in Victor’s life. From a very early age his parents taught him these skills because with farming, he would lack nothing, so he decided to follow in their footsteps and continue with this work. Now, he has his own fields where he grows potatoes and peas. Once harvested, he takes them to Tarma’s wholesale market to sell and produce income necessary to support his family. He has been in this line of work for 8 years and he considers the most difficult part of it to guard his plants against the climate changes that so affect productivity. Later on, he would like to continue to work hard improving his crops. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows that the loan he needs will be very beneficial for him to develop his crops. In addition, he’s a very responsible member of his group, for which he is held in high esteem. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy pea seed, manure and insecticides to insure good crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo que Yolanda se dedica, es el cultivo de papa y arvejas, es así que todos los días desde muy temprano, empieza su labor, tratando de mejorar la calidad de su producción, para luego ser vendidos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, cuyas ganancias le ayudarán a cubrir sus propios gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, por lo que lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus cultivos, ya que pone en riesgo su salud. Más  adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para que pueda aumentar su producción. Este es su Primer préstamo con MFP, considera que el crédito que necesita, le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, por ser muy solidaria con ellos. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en la compra de insecticidas, para evitar que la plaga de insectos afecten sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 23, is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. She lives at home with her parents, and her biggest wish is to improve her quality of life. The work that Yolanda does is growing potatoes and field peas. Every morning she starts work very early, trying to improve the quality of her production, so that she can sell her products in the wholesale market in Tarma. The earnings that she receives help her cover her own expenses. What she likes most about her work is to cultivate the fields. In this she sees the results of the months of work as the fruit of her labor. She has been doing this work for the last 3 years and finds the most difficult part is fumigating the crops since this puts her health at risk. In the future she would like to buy new fields so that she can increase her production. This is her first loan with MFP. She feels that the loan is necessary to help her progress in her work. She is very well-liked by the rest of the members of the communal group. She is considered a supporter of all. The nine thousand soles that she is requesting will be used to buy insecticides, to avoid the plagues of insects that affect her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy insecticides to protect her crops from plagues

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
Armandina vive en la ciudad de Urubamba, tiene 38 años, tiene un hijo llamado Kevin  de cuatro años. Ella es una joven responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Armandina se dedica a la venta útiles escolares y pasamanería. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Armandina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar cuadernos, lapiceros y muchos útiles más para implementar su librería. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Armandina lives in the city of Urubamba. She is 38 years old and has a four-year-old son named Kevin. She is a responsible woman who looks for every opportunity she can to progress and help her family. Armandina sells school supplies and adornments. She has been working in this business for ten years. The business has been doing well thanks to the determination she devotes to her work. Armandina belongs to the Third Millenium Community Bank of the Arariwa Association. She has been a member of this community bank for the past six years. Her first loan was for 100 dollars, which she used to invest in her business. She would like this loan in order to buy notebooks, pencils and other items in order to increase her inventory of school supplies. This member is thankful for the opportunity provided by the bank and she promises to pay back the loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Armandina would like this loan in order to buy notebooks, pencils and other items.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha G. is a 26-year-old parent to her only child, 1-year-old Edcent. At present, she lives with her parents, her husband and their son in her parents’ house. Though her parents are very supportive of her family, Editha still dreams of having her own house where she and her husband and son can enjoy their privacy and live their own lives independently. To be able to achieve this dream, Editha needs to have her own sari-sari (variety store) business and make her own profit. Presently she shares her mother’s sari-sari store and the loan she is requesting now will be used to put up her own store. She plans to build her own small sari-sari store cottage away from her mother’s and purchase grocery items for selling. Editha is very much hoping that someday her business proceeds will enable her to build a home for her own family and they will be independent from her parents.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
A Sari-sari store owner is our featured entrepreneur for this story. She is Julieta C., 60 years of age, a widow and a resident of Fernan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. For her means of living, she engages in a Sari-sari store business. For 20 years she has been able to sustain this business even in times of crisis. At present, she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP1,500.00 a month. This income is so helpful in order to support her basic needs. Aside from that, she is also earning support from her son. 

She joined the cooperative just this year. As a newly recognized member under the PDP-LP Program, she is applying for an amount of PHP3,000.00 to add to the capital for her existing business. The future income will be used for her basic needs, loan repayments and savings. She is hoping that she can  also help her grandchildren in sending them to schools by means of this business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Mr. Kim Y. is a 42 year old, married man who resides in a district of Phnom Penh city, in Cambodia. He works as a district consultant advisor. He has had this job since before he was married. He has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photo here. She earns a daily income by selling various items, such as meat, vegetables, and some groceries. The couple has given birth to two children, both are going to school. The children also help their parents' business when they are not in school. Kim Y. sees that his wife’s trade is very profitable, therefore he hopes to expand this business. Because Kim Y. doesn’t have money, he is looking for his wife to assist in the improvement of her store and to accumulate a bigger inventory of items to sell.

loans.use: To improve her store and invest in more inventory.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosela E., 40, lives in Fernan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She has four children, three in school and one still an infant. Her husband, Antonio, is a farm laborer who does odd jobs. To help her husband support the family, Rosela opened a sari-sari (general) store. She’s been in this business for eight years and has been able to sustain it even in times of crisis. She earns an average net income of P2,000.00 a month. She joined the PDP-LP Program cooperative just this year. As a new member, she is applying for a loan of P4,000.00 to add capital to her business. Future income will be used for basic needs, loan repayments, and savings. Rosela hopes that some day she will be able to send all her children to school and college for a better future. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing sari-sari store

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mr. Touch L. K. is a 44-year-old married man who lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. He is a temporary construction laborer often hired by neighbors to build or mend their houses. His wife farms a small plot of land where she plants different kinds of crops. The couple has three teenage children who work at various occupations. Touch L. K. would like a loan of $600 which, with his savings, he will use to buy a motorcycle to provide transportation for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Mrs. Raquel B., 36, lives in Fernan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She is married with three school-age children. Her husband is an engineer who has worked as an OFW in Saudi Arabia for the past year earning only a minimum salary. To help her husband support the family, she opened a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been in this business for six years and has been able to sustain it even in times of crisis. She earns an average net income of P4,000.00 a month. Raquel joined the PDP-LP Program cooperative just this year. As a new member, she is requesting an amount of P7,000.00 to add to her business capital. Future income will be used for basic needs, loan repayments, and savings. Raquel hopes that some day she can build a separate stall for her sari-sari store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Erdenetungalag

texts.en: Erdenetungalag is 42 years and lives with her family in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She has a son and three daughters, ages 16 to 22. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent, called a ger. Her oldest son, Purevdaavuu studies at a religious institution in India and her three younger daughters all attend a local secondary school. During the day, Erdentungalag operates a carpentry business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs, and has successfully expanded her business over the years. Today her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 tugrugs. In addition to her carpentry business, Erdenetungalag also operated a sausage manufacturing business between 2008 and early 2010. However, with the growing success of their carpentry business she and her husband have decided to focus on one business. Erdenbileg has used her earnings to support her family's expenses and children's tuition fees. She says that being reliable has helped her most to expand her business. She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase paint for her carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase paint.

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mr. Mut P. is a 41-year-old married father who currently lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is skilled in cooking food and uses his knowledge to earn a living. He is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties or ceremonies, while his wife is a sewing worker in industry. This couple is blessed with three teenage children who attend school.

Mr. Mut P. is taking out a loan in order to pay to connect electricity for his family's use.

loans.use: To pay for connecting electricity for his family's use

loans.name: Erdenebileg

texts.en:
Erdenebileg is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Baynhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Erdenebileg operates a sewing business in her town. She started her business by herself in 2000 after operating a small cafe for the previous 10 years.

She has worked hard over the years to gain experience and build a loyal customer base. In 2005, she began operating a sewing workshop with three other sewers. Her business is very important to her and she attributes her success to her good communication skills. Erdenebileg is optimistic about the future and says, "I would like to expand my sewing workshop into a company in the future." She is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~ 590 USD) loan to purchase more materials and fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie D. is requesting a loan to increase her business capital and to support her plans to develop her vegetable and fruit farming business in partnership with her husband. Through the proceeds of this business, she hopes to purchase an agricultural lot which they can use for their farming business. They will then be able to have more profits because they won’t have to pay for the land rental which they currently do. Her business proceeds would be the main source for achieving her dreams to support the education of her three children who are now in a secondary school through to college.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of vegetables and fruits for planting and to pay the machine rentals for land preparation

loans.name: Gombodorj

texts.en:
Gombodorj is 42 years old and lives with his wife and five children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Gombodorj currently operates a grocery store and raw material trading business in his town. He started his raw material trading business in 1992 and has steadily expanded it over the years. He was able to purchase his own truck in 1998 which has helped him grow his business further. Since 2006 he has been operating the grocery store with the help of his wife.

Gombodorj is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. He is optimistic about the future and has been making plans to open a brick and cement manufacturing center in May 2010. He says, "I also hope to stabilize my business and expand my grocery store." Gombodorj is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~ 1100 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his grocery store

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 20 years old and lives with his parents and sibling in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have been living together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, for 15 years. Batbayar is a meat preparer and cutter at Huchit Shonhor, the biggest food wholesaling market in Mongolia, where he has been working since 2004. With his earnings, he purchased his own car in 2008. Furthermore, he has been planning to open a counter of his own for a meat selling business at the Huchit Shonhor market.

Batbayar has been working hard to improve his family's quality of life. He is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. Batbayar's sibling is in his first year at university. Batbayar is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 750 USD) loan to pay his sibling's university tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay his sibling's university tuition fee

loans.name: Rona Fe

texts.en:
Rona Fe P., aged 24, is requesting a loan which will be used to support the growth of her "sari-sari" (variety) store business. With the support and love of her husband, she is willing to face any challenges in her business until it becomes stable and profitable enough to provide her family, especially her two children aged one and five, with the things they need and so they can enjoy life through not being poor. 

Despite Rona’s age, she is confident that through accessing the loan she will be able to enhance her skills in managing a business and her family.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store inventory

loans.name: Thorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorng Yoen, 55, and her husband, Mr. Bunthon Hem, 61, (pictured together), live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1971 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home.

Thorng and her husband have been operating a business selling jasmine flowers and bananas for 15 years. They buy them under contract from the nearby district and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market.
  
Thorng does not have enough capital to purchase jasmine flowers and bananas for resale. So, she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay O., 54, is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh. A widowed mother, she cares for her five children, who are all single and attend school. To support the family's daily living, she sells a variety of groceries from her home, and also plants vegetables O. her farmland to sell. All of her children help her businesses when they are not studying.

Chhay O.'s investments are running smoothly and provide her with a suitable daily income. Because her businesses are growing, she hopes to increase her income by taking out a loan to use as extra capital to invest in her businesses. She will buy more fertilizers, seeds and other supplies for her crop-growing activity.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds and other supplies

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
C. is 26 years old and has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for more than six years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is married to Run Sok, 30, who fishes in and around the lakes of his community.

Currently, the quantity of fish caught is declining due to the lack of fishing gear. This is why C. has requested a loan in order to purchase more equipment for her husband to use when fishing. With the rest of the loan, C. will buy an old vehicle to provide transportation for her family. Note: C. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and a vehicle

loans.name: Sunnara

texts.en:
Mr. Sunnara C., aged 31, (in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Pov Kim, aged 26, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2006 and have a young son.   
 
Sunnara has been a construction worker for 10 years, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $600 to purchase a cow to raise and to connect his house to a private electricity utility service. 

He will be able to get extra income from selling the cow when the cow has grown big enough.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise and to connect his house to a private electricity utility service

loans.name: Chenratana

texts.en:
Mr. Chenratana C., age 20, and his wife, Mrs. Srey-at An, age 30, have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. They live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.
 
Chenratana has been a clerk for six years and his wife has been a garment factory worker since 1994. He is asking for his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Soknak

texts.en:
Mrs. Soknak N., age 48, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Soknak has been a silk weaver since she was 29 years old. Besides selling her own products, she also buys silk fabric from weavers in her village and sells to the middleman who comes to buy it at her house.

Soknak is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase silk materials for continuing her weaving business and to buy finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials (raw silk) for continuing her weaving business and to buy finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San N., 31, and her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Khoeun, 31, have been married for ten years and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One of them attends school and other three are still too young.

San has been selling pork for six years. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna C. is from the village of Poblacion, Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a general store. This is not the only means for generating revenue since the main source of income for the family comes primarily from the income of her husband as a farmer. Lorna has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory, used as working capital and, most especially, used for the education of her two children. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and for the future of her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell and for the education of her children

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreysros C. and her husband, Mr. Samneang Prak, live in a small village along National Road Number Two, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children attends school while the other two are still too young.

Sreysros has been a garment factory worker since 2001 while her husband is a motor taxi driver (tuk tuk: a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer). She is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Mrs. Edna L. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and is married with six children. Edna operates her business, which is a sari-sari (variety) store, and her husband manages his farm.Their main source of income comes primarily from their farm. Both of them earn approximately 12,000 a month. Edna is a PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) member. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP taken from PMPC and this loan was for the expansion of her business. As of now, Edna has a new loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC and the purpose of this loan is for additional capital for her sari-sari store and for the expansion of her husband’s farm.This is her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans that her additional revenue will help to improve with the living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store and for the expansion of her husband's farm

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en: Miraluna M., is from the village of Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Miraluna owns and operates a general store. This is not the only means for generating revenue, as the main source of income for the family comes primarily from the income of her husband who is a fisherman. Miraluna has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Miraluna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Miraluna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng M., age 30, and her husband, Mr. Moeng Meas, age 32, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have three daughters. The eldest daughter attends school. Besides her children, Loeng also has her mother-in-law living with her.
 
Loeng has been a garment factory worker for eight years while her husband has been a construction worker for ten years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria S. is from Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married with four children. Victoria operates a business which is sari sari (variety) store and her husband is a farmer and sometimes a tricycle driver. She earns approximately earns 5,000 a month from her business. Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financing and to engage in other business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 12,000 from PMPC.This previous loan was used for the expansion of her business. As of now, Victoria has a new loan of 25,000 from PMPC and this loan is intended for the repair of her house. This is her 4th loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for house repair and as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn B. is very thankful for the opportunity to join ASHI last year. Because of it, she has able to access a loan which was used to sustain the operation of her husband’s transportation business using a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar). The income from this business is her family’s main source for food and other primary needs. Also, this has enabled Roselyn to have savings in ASHI in preparation of her family’s emergency needs and for the education of their only child who is now two years of age.

Presently, Roselyn is again requesting a loan through ASHI. This loan will be used to improve their tricycle and recondition its engine.

loans.use: To pay for reconditioning of her husband's tricycle engine and to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
68-year-old Catalina has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) for more than a few years now. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store at her house. She sells soft drinks, oil, vinegar, and other goods that people in her neighborhood regularly look for.

Having ten children, Catalina and her husband work hard to give them a proper education. Now that their older children are already grown-up, she still wants to help provide for her family. She is currently requesting Php 25,000 from CEVI which she will use to buy supplies for her store. She also hopes to earn more and to improve her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store

loans.name: Sokuntheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokuntheary C., 30, and her husband, Mr. Phally San, 36, live along National Road Number One, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1999 and have four children: one daughter and three sons. Two of their children are in school and another one is still too young.

Sokuntheary has been a nail artist for five years. She cuts and paints toenails and fingernails. Her husband has been a soldier for fifteen years.

Sokuntheary has a motorbike that she uses for commuting but it is old and breaks down often, which costs her a lot of money to make repairs. This means that she can not manage her income to support her family.

Facing this, Sokuntheary is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase the new motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana raises hogs to earn a living. She is 56 years old with three children. She and her husband separated but it didn’t stop her from continuing with her life. Her youngest child is taking up Electronics and Communications Engineering at a university in her town. She works hard to have him graduate this year.

Cayetana also sought the help of CEVI, an MFI (micro-finance institute), to support her business. She says that its program is a big help to her hog-raising business. She is now applying for a loan of Php 14,000, which she will use to buy additional piglets and feeds. She is hopeful to earn more so she is able to pay for her son’s university fees.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean M. is from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 24 years old and single.

Jean manage a business which is buy and sell of peanuts. She buy peanuts and make them into finished products which is called peanut roll and PENIATTO. From her business she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Jean is a PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) member. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to help improve her living conditions. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 5,000 from PMPC.

As of now, Jean has a new loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC and this loan will be used as additional capital for her peanut business. This is her 3rd loan from PMPC.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her peanut business

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin M., is 32 years old and her husband, Mr. Savuth Thorn (they are pictured together), is 32 years old. They live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1992 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One of the children attends school while the other one is still too young.
 
Sophoin and her husband have been selling vegetables for three years. They buy them from farmers in their village and transport them to sell at Koki market. Sophoin is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: To build a brick room under her wooden house

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is a 48-year-old entrepreneur from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She is married to Dexter and they have three children, her eldest being aged twenty-one.

To help provide for her family, Cecile acquires imported products and local souvenir shirts that she sells in her town. She also makes accessories whenever she has time. Living in a tourist spot, she also started a small travel agency as an additional source of income.

Cecile hopes that her businesses will grow. She applied for a loan of Php 30,000 from CEVI which she will use to buy additional products to sell. This loan will help increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh T. T. is 42 years old and lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She is married with three children.

Binh T. T. sells fruit in the market and has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA for two years and has taken out loans. She wants to have a better life so she always tries to work hard.

Besides selling fruit, Binh T. T. breeds pigs and poultry. This time, she wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to invest in her business and buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To invest in her business and buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Mrs. Ban C. is a 56-year-old widow who currently lives in a village located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was not available for the photograph so her daughter is pictured instead. Ban C. has given birth to two children: one daughter and one son. Her daughter is now married but still lives with her in her home.

To pursue a daily income, Ban C. owns a farm where she grows crops and has had this job for years. Also she depends on the income from her son and her son-in-law, who are local construction laborers.

Ban C. will be using her loan to pay the bill for connecting a new electricity line for family use.

loans.use: To pay the bill for connecting a new electricity line for family use

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Evelyn S. is from Balamban, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old and is married with five children. Evelyn is a PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) member and her business is a sari-sari (variety) store. Her family’s main source of income comes from their farm which her husband operates. Their monthly income is approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Evelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services and to help improve her family’s living conditions. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. As of now Evelyn has a new loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC and this loan is for the expansion of her business. This is her 4th loan from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for the expansion of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Aside from Milagros F.’s sari-sari (variety) store financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a hog-fattening business which is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially for her child’s education until college.

Hogs she fattens will be sold after four months, either alive or slaughtered, to people in their village or to the market vendors in the public market. Milagros really enjoys her productive role managing two business because both are financially enhancing her capacity to support their needs in addition to her husband’s small income as a hired laborer.

Milagros is hoping to increase the volume and variety of her store inventory to be able to increase her sales as well as her profits. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that is larger than the ones she received previously through ASHI.

Once her store can offer more grocery items and immediate-use commodities to her costumers, Milagros is pretty sure that someday her business would become stable and profitable. By then her life, along with that of her husband and child, will be improved and happier.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items and goods to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorna B., from Balamban MAhayag Zamboanga del Sur, is a 49-year-old married mother of four children. She is a PDP_LP member who, along with her husband, grows ginger, harvesting the crop every nine months. Their income is approximately 3000 PHP a month. Having fully repaid her previous loan of 5000 from PMPC that was used for the expansion of her garden plot, a new loan of 6000 PHP, her fourth from PMPC, will be used as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her garden

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mr. Sitha S. and his wife, Mrs. Sokvanna Phauk (pictured together), live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1990 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and another one is still young. 

Sitha has been a hairdresser for more than eighteen years. He operates his shop in Kor Ky market. His first loan has just been finished. He hopes to organize the house where he lives become neater, so he is asking for his second loan of $1,000 to fill up the land and put an addition on his house.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget M. is 58 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was married but her husband died years ago. She currently stays at home to do homework and to take care of their family. Nget M. relies on the income from her daughter who is a garment factory worker, and a son-in-law who is a blacksmith. 

Nget M. has been living in an older house which is in need of repair, and the living conditions have often been affected. To solve this, Nget M. decided to ask for a loan of $700 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL, to be used to hire a laborer to mend her old house.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to mend her old house.

loans.name: Thua

texts.en:
Thua T. N. is 39 years old. She lives in yen Phong, bac Ninh with her husband and three children. She is farmer and has livestock. Besides that, she is a seasonal worker. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND), which is about $117 US. 

In 2008, she joined SEDA to gain access to financial resources. Her loans, which were used largely to buy food for pigs, are always repaid punctually. In the next round, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND more to invest in her livestock. Hopefully, that plan will turn a profit so that her family may afford to buy more household appliances.

loans.use: For livestock

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mr. Hai H., age 62 and his wife, Mrs. Choem Laisorng, age 58, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have two married children: one son and one daughter. One of them lives in separate home and another one lives in the family home. Hai was available for the photo, his wife is pictured instead. 

Hai has been a rice farmer for twenty years. Besides farming, he is a horse cart driver as well. His wife has been running a grocery store in front of her house for eighteen years. He is requesting his first loan of $700 US to purchase a trailer to connect to a motorized hand tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect to a motorized hand tiller

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan G. has been a member of ASHI since 2009. The loan she received then was used to support the growth of her hog breeding and fattening business. Once fattened pigs are sold after four months, or piglets from breeding are sold for fattening, the profits are used to support the maintenance of her tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for her transportation business. 

Aside from her husband’s small income as an employee of a cooperative office in their municipality, the proceeds of Susan’s business supply a large amount of her family's needs, especially the educational expenses of her three children. 

Soon, Susan’s eldest child will go to college and also her second child will follow in the next couple of years. Because of this, Susan really wants to grow her business to gain more profits and fulfill her dream of seeing her children graduate from college. To achieve this, Susan is requesting a much larger loan through ASHI. Along with that financial assistance, she is certain that through her determination and courage to undertake whatever challenges growing a business will bring, someday she will be able to make it stable and profitable. She is also looking forward to having a sound revenue for the family.

loans.use: To buy medicine and vitamins for a piggery

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok L. is 44 years old and sells fritters in the village. Her husband, Chou Somnang, 41, helps her in selling these products. This couple has helped each other in order to earn money to feed their children. Right now, two of their children are employed and provide their incomes to help with the responsibilities of the family, while the remaining two are students. Sok L. wants to enlarge her business, which is the main source of  income. Because Sok L. doesn’t have capital, she has decided to request a loan to be used to improve her store, as well as to buy more ingredients to produce the fritters that she sells.

loans.use: To improve her store as well as to buy more ingredients to produce fritters to sell.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun K. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Sophal Veng, live on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: three daughters and one son. Two of the children have full-time employment, one attends school and another one is still young. 

Sokhoeun is a silk weaver, while her husband is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy piglets to raise. 

She will be able to earn extra income selling the pigs when they grow big enough.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Kimleng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimleng S. (shown in the photo), 48, and her husband, Mr. Thy Thorn, 47, have been married since 1991 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.  One of them is married and lives outside the family home and the other three children are in school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kimleng has been fishing for fifteen years; while Mr. Thy Thorn has been driving a motor taxi for eight years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand the house where she lives.

loans.use: To expand her house.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Mrs. S., 43, is a seller. She sells desserts and fruit to people who are her nearby villagers, in the capital of Phnom Penh. She has been engaged in her business since 2005. She is married and lives with her husband and two children. One of her daughters is now married and works in the garment industry. In addition to her current business, her husband farms crops, which he will sell when they are mature. Mrs. S. will be using her first loan to increase the financial capital of her business. She will use any remaining money from the loan to decorate her shop in order to attract her customers. (Mrs. S.'s husband is in the photo).

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her business.

loans.name: Onn

texts.en:
Mrs. Onn K. (pictured here) has asked for a Kiva loan one time already. Because the main source of income is from her daughter’s tailoring business, she is asking for her second loan of US $500 to purchase additional materials for her daughter’s tailoring business.

It would be better for Onn’s daughter to operate her business and respond to her customer’s needs as well.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her daughter’s tailoring business.

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthy S. (in the photo), 49, is single and lives with his mother, sister and brother on an island located fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  He is a rice farmer. Besides farming, he is a fisherman as well. 

Bunthy does not have enough capital to pay for plowing fees and to purchase seed, pesticide and fertilizer to maintain his rice farm. So, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help build his capital.

loans.use: To use for farming expenses

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise W.g. Group

texts.en:
R. Juliet is a 53 year old widow with six school-going children.

For the last three years, Juliet has been selling cows to earn a living in Ntungamo district in western Uganda. Her main drawback in the course of doing this business has been the unstable prices of cattle. With a determined resolve and efficient customer care skills, she has managed to keep her business going. In a month, Juliet says she makes profits to the tune of 90,000 shillings.

Juliet’s future plans are to fully expand her cattle farm and to pay for her children’s university education. With this loan, she anticipates great strides in achieving this dream.

loans.use: To restock her cattle farm with more cows.

loans.name: Phait

texts.en:
