loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva Celosa dreams of escaping the spiral of poverty. In 1995, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Her hope was to gain access to capital in order to start a business. She and her husband started a business making kaing (small baskets). Since then, over the course of nine loans, her business has continued to grow and provide good income for her family. However, the income from the business is not enough to sustain everyday needs. Therefore, the couple is now requesting Minerva's tenth loan in the amount of 35,000 pesos to use as working capital to start a fishing business as supplementary income. The loan will be used to pay for fish netting and a motor boat, and the remaining funds will be used to support the raw materials needed for her kaing business.

Minerva is looking forward to increased demand for fish on the island and expects her secondary business to grow and generate enough income for her family. She dreams of sending her grandchildren to school all the way through college and for them to find stable livelihoods. Through her business success, she also dreams of building a home made of concrete for more comfortable living.

Minerva C. is happily living with her five children and her 62-year-old husband Marcial, who is a fisherman and kaing maker in the province of Rizal.

loans.use: To pay for fish netting and a motor boat for a fishing business, and the remaining funds will be used to buy the raw materials needed for her basketmaking business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products and underwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Tomato Group

texts.en:
Hamisi C., age 33, is married with four children, ages 13, 11, 5 and 2 years old.  He has had a brick business in three different places since 1997. He works from 6 am to 7 pm daily and he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $294.

This will be Hamisi’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the first loan to open a bricks shop in Chanika. He hopes for a loan to increase good stock in all three locations. 

Hamisi will share this loan with his group, Tomato, which totals 15 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, Hamisi is first from the right in the last row.

loans.use: To increase stock in the three places where he sells his bricks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: Aura Estela tiene 51 años, tiene la actividad económica pulpería ella inicio con otro tipo de negocio como es el destace de cerdo y venta de frijoles ya que anteriormente ella habitaba contiguo al cerro llamado casitas, pero debido a deslave que hubo tuvo que ser trasladada a otro lugar en donde comenzaría a comprar todo nuevamente, por lo que es una mujer muy admirable pues lo ha logrado con la ayuda de los financiamientos y los negocios anteriores. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, pan, jugos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes y ropa interior. Ella sueña con mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Aura Estela is 51 years old. She has a mini-market. She started with a different type of business, butchering pigs and selling beans. She previously lived next to the hill called Casitas. But, due to a landslide she had to be moved to another place. That is where she would start to buy everything once again. She is a very admirable woman for what she has achieved with the help of the loans and her previous businesses. The loan she is requesting is to buy basic grains, bread, juice, sweets, natural drinks, detergent, and underwear. Her dream is to improve her economic condition and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Norma Justina

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Norma Justina A. Montalván tiene 72 años de edad, es viuda, con 7 hijos todos mayores de edad, 5 de ellos viven en sus propias casas y dos aun conviven con ella al igual que 3 nietos. Doña Norma tiene una pulpería desde hace más de 20 años y con la cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Por el tiempo que tiene de administrar su pulpería es bien conocida en el sector por lo que su negocio es bastante visitado. Doña Norma ya ha sido beneficiada en dos ocasiones por préstamos de kiva y ha cancelado los dos anteriores en tiempo y forma. Además aprovecha para agradecer a todos los prestamistas que han confiado en ella y le facilitaron los préstamos anteriores.

Esta solicitando se le financie para comprar:

3 Quintales de Arroz americano a US 45 cada quintal, 80 libras de pollo a US 1.40 cada libra, 60 libras de  carne de res a US 1.50 cada libra, 3 quintales de frijoles a  US 45 cada quintal,  2 bidones de aceite a US  30 cada bidón,  2 quintales de azúcar a US 35 cada quintal, 25 sacos de  carbón a US 3 cada saco y 3 quintales de  harina a US 41 cada quintal.
texts.en:
Norma Justina A. Montalván is a 72-year-old widow with 7 adult children, five of whom live independently and two who still live with her; three grandchildren live with her also. Norma has had a grocery store for over 20 years that has made it possible for her to raise her children. After all this time running her store, she is well-known in the neighborhood and her store is quite popular. Norma has had two previous Kiva loans and repaid both on time. She thanks all the lenders who have trusted her and provided the past loans. She is asking for funding to buy the following: 3 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of American rice at US45 each, 80 pounds of chicken at US1.40 each, 60 pounds of beef at US1.50 each, 3 quintales of beans at US45 each, 2 large jugs of cooking oil at US30 each, 2 quintales of sugar at US35 each, 25 sacks of charcoal at US3 each and 3 quintales of flour at US41 each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy American rice, chicken, beef, beans, sugar, charcoal and flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia G. operates a rice retail business and tends to a fishing business at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The businesses are a big help for her family in covering their expenses and setting aside savings for the future. 

This couple is requesting a new loan of 45,000 Philippine pesos to buy a motorboat, fishnet, bamboo and gasoline, and to cover labor expenses. The proceeds of the business support the immediate and basic needs of her family. Leticia hopes that her businesses will become successful some day. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, she hopes to see the graduation of her child from college and to see him find a stable job. She also still dreams of having a durable and concrete house for the safety of her family and she wants to save for her family’s future. 

Leticia wishes to thank Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. This is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy a motorboat, fishnet, bamboo and gasoline and pay for labor expenses

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items	to sell

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday is a faithful businessman who lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is a carpenter and he makes beautiful chairs, cabinets and wardrobes for his customers. He has been in this business of fifteen years. He is married with three children and he is 45 years old.

Sunday is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more wood to boost his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to boost his business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 67-years-old widow with two grown children.  As an active entrepreneur, she has been running a sari-sari store for almost 9 years. To improve her business, Norma would like a loan of 23,000 PHP to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store.  She is planning to purchase additional products, such as rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil and other inventory for her store. Norma believes that offering a wide assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and maintain customer loyalty in their village. 

A loyal member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 2000, Norma has been a model member, demonstrating regular attendance to weekly center meetings and steady repayments of previous loans. Her long term goals are to offer a better future for her family and sustain the profitability of her store.  Through hard work and determination, Norma is focused on improving her quality of life with the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products to sell

loans.name: Adeshola

texts.en:
Adeshola is 35 years old and is a single parent with a child under her care. She is hardworking and has been borrowing from LAPO for the past three years.

Adeshola sews clothes for both males and females and even sells tailoring accessories. She has been in this business for ten years. She makes sure her customers’ demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially.

Adeshola is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bottles of wine and drink to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to boost his business

loans.name: Luis Simeon

texts.es: Luis Simeón tiene 44 años, por lo que él se dedica a una pulpería. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación León. Por lo que tiene más 5 años con este negocio, Luis tiene levantarse temprano, por lo que también ayuda a su esposa con su hijo pues él tiene que ir a dejarlo a la escuela, juntos se han apoyado mutuamente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El ofrece los productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, jugos, detergentes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle a su hijo la oportunidad de estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su humilde negocio.
texts.en:
Luis Simeón, age 44, has a mini-market. This is not his first loan with Fundación León. He has been in this business for over five years. Luis has to get up early because he also helps his wife with their child. He has to take him to school. He and his wife have mutually supported each other in order to have better living conditions. He sells products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, juice, and detergent, among other things. His wish is to give his child the opportunity of an education. The loan he is requesting is to buy the raw materials he needs for his humble business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more plastic to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pea seed.

loans.name: José Gregorio

texts.es:
José Gregorio M. T. nació San Onofre en Sucre, habitado por una diversidad étnico-cultural en la que confluyen elementos de la costa, la sierra y la sabana que determina una particular y muy armónica manera de relación social y productiva entre sus habitantes; José tiene 28 años y  emigró hacia un municipio, a  diez kilómetros al oriente de Cartagena llamado Turbaco, buscando oportunidades de estudios superiores y con el fin de conseguir sus sueños empezó a estudiar Derecho en la Universidad,  pero la muerte de su padre lo obligó a suspender esa carrera y debió trabajar para sostener su familia; así fue como trabajó en  oficios de carpintería y albañilería, pero estas actividades no le generaron los  ingresos suficiente para subsistir.  Con su origen cultural artesano, empezó a elaborar productos de la cultura precolombina como mochilas, gorros, bolsos en tela y con su dedicación, creatividad y por ser muy estudioso de su cultura creó sus propias herramientas de trabajo de tipo artesanal: bastidores, pulpo, caja de revelado de diapositivas,  con los cuales elabora sus productos que son de mucha  aceptación entre turistas nacionales e internacionales, porque combinan las tendencias actuales con el legado de la cultura precolombina. Jose necesita avanzar en la calidad de sus productos, porque eso es lo que mas cuida, por eso su actual crédito por valor de $ 2.100.000  lo usará para adquirir una maquina sesgadora que mejore su calidad  y también para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos como telas y pinturas. 

José es una persona muy solidaria, por eso muchas veces hace esfuerzos laborales para  ayudar a su familia, él hace pequeñas producciones y  la distribuye mediante el sistema de consignación en tiendas, hoteles de la ciudad turística de Cartagena y logra constantes  pedidos semanales de estas unidades de negocio en la ciudad amurallada. Su meta es culminar su carrera profesional, crear una tienda de artesanías interactiva, donde el turista conozca y sienta el proceso productivo de los artículos que está comprando.

Sueña mas adelante con exportar sus artesanías y tener un lugar propio donde producir lo que mas ama las artesanías de la cultura precolombina.
texts.en:
José Gregorio M. was born in San Onofre in Sucre. Its inhabitants are of diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds. There are elements of the coast, the mountains, and the plains. This makes for special and harmonious social interactions and productivity among its inhabitants. José is 28 years old, and he emigrated to the Turbaco municipality, which is ten kilometers to the east of Cartagena. He was looking for opportunities for a college education. In order to follow his dreams he started studying law at the university. But, the death of his father obliged him to suspend this career because he had to work to support his family. That is how he started working at carpentry and bricklaying. But, these activities did not generate enough income to survive. Looking back to his heritage, he started making products from the pre-Colombian culture. He makes things like backpacks, hats, and fabric bags. With his dedication, creativity, and by studying his culture a great deal he created his own work tools for handicrafts. He made various types of frames and a slide projector. He uses them to make his products, which are very well received among locals and tourists. This is because he combines the current tendencies with the pre-Colombian legacy. José needs to make headway with the quality of his products because this attracts the most attention. Therefore, he will use his current loan for the amount of 2,100,000 COP to get a serger (overlock machine) that will improve the quality. He will also buy materials and supplies like fabric and paint. José is a very supportive person, and he often does work to help his family. He makes small handicrafts and distributes them to stores and hotels in tourist city of Cartagena through a consignment system. He gets constant weekly orders from businesses in the city of Amurallada. His goal is to finish his professional career and to create an interactive handicrafts store where the tourists know and feel the productive process of the articles they are buying. He dreams of later exporting his handicrafts and having his own place where he produces what he loves the most, handicrafts from the pre-Colombian culture.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get a serger (overlock machine) and buy materials and supplies like fabric and paint

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Sr. Edwin esta casado, tiene 32 años de edad y viven en la casa de sus papas, el Sr.  Edwin se encuentra casado con la Sra. Lucy con la que tiene 3 hijos, dos que se encuentran en edad escolar y uno que es pequeñito, la señora Lucy es cliente antigua del Banco de Emprendimiento Bolivia ya trabajo con este banco en varias secuencias.

El Sr. Edwin tiene como actividad la atencion de un restaurante con el que ya esta mas de 8 meses en funcionamiento, el mismo que queda ubicado en su mismo domicilio, el restaurante se abre a partir  trabaja a partir de las 12:00 horas hasta las 24:00 horas, el crédito solicitado está dirigido a la remodelación y refacción de la cocina del restaurante. El Sr. ofrece a su clientela una variedad de platos es un lugar muy concurrido ya que elaboran platillos riquisimos, Su esposa y el sr. Edwin quienes elaboran los platillos tienen muy buena sazon y estan muy contentos con los ingresos de su restaurante.

El Sr. Edwin esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin is married and 32 years old and he lives in his parents' home. He is married to Ms. Lucy, with whom he has three children, two are in school and the third is still a babe. Ms. Lucy is a long time client of Banco de Emprendimiento Bolivia [Entrepreneur Bank Bolivia] and has worked with this bank for several loan cycles. Mr. Edwin's activity is a restaurant that has been working for more than 8 months already. It is located in his own home, It opens from 12:00 to 24:00 hours. The loan he asks for is meant to remodel and remake the restaurant's kitchen. Mr. Edwin offers his customers a variety of dishes. It is a very sought after place because they make delicious dishes. His wife and Mr. Edwin, who cook the dishes, have a good hand cooking and they are very happy with the income the restaurant generates. Mr. Edwin is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they show in granting him the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelling of restaurant's kitchen

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela M. C., es casada y con sus dos hijos pequeños habita en el Populoso Barrio de Los Ríos, su esposo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella es agricultora desde hace más de 17 años.

Dentro de las prioridades que tienen para el hogar esta la reparación de la entrada de su casa, debido a que con la llegada del invierno se deterioro y por el momento no les brinda una seguridad para sus pequeños hijos, dentro de los principales problemas que ha tenido con las tierras ha sido la sequía en la zona que ha bajado en un 40% la producción trimestral, dentro de los cambios a futuro, se tienen trazado para el cultivo esta el cambio de las áreas que  no produzcan y cultivar arboles que den sombra, solicita un préstamo para la mejoría continua de los campos en la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes, fungicidas e insumos vegetativos , ella espera que este apoyo económico le aporte mejores condiciones de siembra y con esto le favorezca económicamente para invertir en futuros proyectos que tenga la familia, tales como la reparación de la fachada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rafaela M. C. is married and lives with her two small children in the densely-populated Los Ríos neighborhood; her husband is a fruit and vegetable merchant and she has been a farmer for over 17 years. Among the priorities they have for their home is repairing its entrance because winter damaged it and they currently lack proper security for their children. Among the main problems she has had with her farmlands is the drought that has caused a 40% reduction in production this quarter. For the future, plans are in place to replace crops in unproductive areas with shade trees. She is asking for funding for soil maintenance; she needs to buy supplies like, fertilizers, fungicides and other farm supplies. She hopes this financial help will help provide better growing conditions so that she will be benefited financially in order to be able to invest in future projects for the family, like repairing their home’s façade.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, fungicides and farm supplies.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena G. is from Morong, Rizal. She is 59 years old. She is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Azucena sells vegetables and fruits in her village and nearby town. 

Azucena has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a week from these activities. In 1998, Azucena joined ASHI to secure access to financial services to help improve her living condition and ability to engage in more business activities.

Azucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of from ASHI. This previous loan was used to purchase inventory of her business. Azucena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more food to sell, including mango, tomato, pineapple, papaya. This will be Azucena's 12th loan from ASHI. She plans to use the additional proceeds generated from the loan to develop her business.

She hopes that, with the help of her KIVA field partner, she can reach her goals of stepping out from under the umbrella of poverty, developing her business, and providing for the needs of her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Unidos Para El Futuro Group

texts.en:
Yrene is the coordinator of the "Unidos Para el Futuro" (United for the Future) group and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti . Her group is located in the urban slums north of the capital where crime is rampant, running water is not potable, and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Yrene is excited to be taking her third loan from Esperanza  after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. Yrene sells underwear and cosmetics. She will use her loan to buy bras, panties and briefs as well as creams and makeup to sell. She will use the profits to finish building her home and to save to buy a vehicle. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Panties, bras, briefs, creams and make-up

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more blocks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more salon materials to sell

loans.name: Kebbeh Group

texts.en:
Kebbeh K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Kebbeh Group. She is 45 years old and married, and she has five children who range in age from 17 to 30 years old. She also cares for 4 siblings. She did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 25 years, Kebbeh has been selling cooking oil at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She sells good, fresh oil to customers to encourage them to continue buying from her. Kebbeh started by selling a few bottles of oil, but now sells so many bottles. 

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cooking oil to sell. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

In the photo that accompanies this loan, Kebbeh is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris hails from Agbara in Ogun State and she lives with her husband who is a businessman in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells drugs and groceries and she has been in the business for the past 10 years. 

She hopes to see her business grow more than her expectations. She is asking for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more drugs and groceries  to sell. 

Doris is 40 years old and has 5 children. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support especially in these hard times.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs and groceries  to sell.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Jose Francisco S. C. es originario de Nindirì, un pueblito de la ciudad de Masaya, él es casado y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad, es un hombre de 63 años, que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 32 años, dentro de sus planes a corto plazo está la compra de un camioncito para la transportación de la cosecha, él inicio sus trabajos en el campo, gracias a la Reforma Agraria de los años 80’s.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha afectado a los cultivos, han sido la  afectación de plagas y enfermedades de las tierras, es por esta razón que ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales fertilizantes, fungicidas e insumos vegetativos, debido a que también desean diversificar la producción, el apoyo que se le brinde a la familia les favorecerá la reinversión de un mayor capital de trabajo y el fortalecimiento económico-social de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Jose Francisco S. C. is from Nindirí, a small village in the city of Masaya. He is married and has five grown children. He is 63 years old, and he has been farming for 32 years. His short term plan is to buy a small truck to transport his harvest. He started his work in the field thanks to the agrarian reform in the 80’s. One of the main problems that has affected his crops has been pests and illnesses on the land. For this reason they are asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, fungicides, and vegetative supplies. They also want to diversify their production. The support offered to his family favors reinvesting more work capital and strengthening his family’s socio-economic condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers, fungicides, and vegetative supplies

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a businesswoman. She has a piggery where she rears pigs for commercial purposes. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Oyo State, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children and she is 55 years old. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more feed to boost her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more feed to boost her business

loans.name: Paula Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. Paula, tiene 34 años ella vive en anticretico junto a su conyuge el Sr. Sandro quien trabaja como transportista brindando servicio de transporte urbano, la pareja tiene un hijo de 1 año y don Sandro 2 hijos de un matrimonio anterior los cuales decidieron mantener juntos, para la Sra. Paula son sus hijos tambien porque los quiere como si fueran sus hijos. La Sra. Paula tiene una licoreria en la que vende por las noches y de dia trabaja de hrs.11:00 am a 17:00 en un restaurante como Cajera Administradora hace 16 años; La Sra. Paula se provee de mercaderia de vendedores mayoristas para revenderlos en su licoreria; los sueños de doña Paula es poder tener acceder a un anticretico de una casa entera en la zona sur, donde pueda vivr y abrir su propio restaurante de comida china ya que tiene 16 años de experiencia en el rubro.
El Credito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir su licoreria, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Paula is 34 years old. She lives in a rental property along with her spouse, Sandro, who works as a taxi driver providing urban transportation service. The couple have a one-year-old son and Sandro has two children from a previous marriage who they decided to raise together. For Paula, they are her children too because she loves them as if they were her own children. Paula has a liquor store where she sells at night and, during the day, she works from 11AM-5PM in a restaurant as a Cashier Manager, which she's done for 16 years. Paula gets her merchandise from wholesale vendors in order to resell from her liquor store. Paula's dreams are to be able to have access to rent an entire house in the southern area where she can live and open her own Chinese food restaurant since she already has 16 years experience in this field. The loan requested is to buy merchandise at wholesale prices to stock her liquor store. She is thankful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust given by granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liquor at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nyame Boa Yen Group

texts.en:
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Margaret is also a wife and mother of six children from age 3-23 years old who are pursuing an education at various levels. She is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of her family. She is married to a farmer and together they want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

Margaret trades in smoked fish. Fish is a common and important protein source in most diets and lot of people prefer fish to meat. She buys assorted smoked fish from fish mongers in fishing areas and sells to households and food vendors in her community. She has operated this trade for the past 20 years. She now sells her fish to a new market of gold miners as well, which has enabled her to grow her customer base and expand her market.

Margaret is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Nyame Boa Yen" (translated as 'God help us'), comprised of 11 members. The other members are also engaged in trade such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothes sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Judie

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Judie J. Malespín tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, con dos hijos mayores de edad y se dedica hace 23 años a administrar un restaurante el cual esta ubicado en el barrio Teodoro Martínez de esta ciudad de Bluefields, en donde oferta todo tipo de comidas nacionales y extranjeras tales como las comidas chinas (Tallarín,  shoup siu) y comidas típicas como el ron don. 

Este local en bien conocido y tiene como nombre TAURUS y es visitado por clientes de todas las etnias existentes en esta ciudad, principalmente por las comidas típicas. Doña Judie ya fue beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de kiva el cual ya fue cancelado.

Actualmente esta solicitando otro préstamo para poder invertir con su capital en algunas mejoras en infraestructura del negocio, solicita financiamiento para comprar:

80 libra de Carne de cerdo a US 1,25 cada libra, 100 libras de  pollo a US  1,45 cada libra, 80 libras de carne de res a US 1.50 cada libra, 60 libras de carne molida a US 2 cada libra, 2 bidones de aceite a US 30 cada bidón, 2 quintales de azúcar a US 35 cada quintal, 2 quintales de arroz a US 45 cada quintal, 20 sacos de carbón a US 3.50 cada saco, 15 cajillas de  jugosa US 7 cada cajilla y 15 cajillas de  gaseosas a US 8 cada cajilla.
texts.en:
Judie J. Malespín, 55, is a single mother of two adult children. For 23 years she has run a restaurant in Bluefields’ Teodoro Martínez neighborhood; she offers a variety of both national and foreign dishes, like Chinese food (noodles, chop-suey) and traditional dishes, like rondon (traditionally from Bluefields. Rondon is prepared with turtle meat, fish, and red meat or pork. Sometimes you combine two of these meats. When preparing, cook the meat with pepper, hot pepper, a herb named nargan, onion, sweet pepper, banana, yucca and quequisque). This is a well-known establishment, called Taurus, and it is popular with all the various ethnic groups that live in this city, primarily for its traditional dishes. Judie has had a previous Kiva loan which was repaid on time. She is asking for another loan in order to make some improvements to her business. She will use the funds to buy the following: 80 pounds of pork at US1.25 each, 100 pounds of chicken at US1.45, 80 pounds of beef at US1.50, 60 pounds of ground meat at US2 each, 2 large jugs of cooking oil at US30 each, 2 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of sugar at US35 each, 2 quintales of rice at US 45 each, 20 sacks of charcoal at US3.50 each, 15 cases of juice at US7 each and 15 cases of soft-drinks at US8 each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pork, chicken, beef, ground meat, cooking oil, sugar, charcoal, juices and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more yams and plantains to sell

loans.name: Mery Rossio

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery tiene 39 años de edad y se encuentra casada con el Sr. Edgar con el que tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en la Universidad, su esposo trabaja como empleado en Multivisión(empresa que brinada el servicio de telecable) como técnico instalador. La Sra. Mery tiene como actividad principal sus dos vehiculos que los hace trabajar en la empresa de radio taxi San Luis, del cual recibe una renta semanal, y su segunda actividad es la venta de joyas donde le va muy bien en su negocio, ella conoce sobre la venta de joyas. 
El crédito solicitado por doña Mery está dirigido a su segunda actividad que es la venta de joyas, la misma que lo realiza  de acuerdo a pedido de los clientes, las hace hacer modelos exclusivos y las vende a sus clientes, actualmente tiene un pedido mayor, y el préstamo está dirigido a la compra de anillos, pendientes y pulseras.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mery is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Edgar with whom she has 2 children, both in university. Her husband works for Multivisión (a cable television provider company) as an installation technician. Mrs. Mery’s primary source of income is her two vehicles that she rents by the week to the San Luis radio taxi business. Her second source of income, which is going very well, comes from selling jewelry. She knows a lot about selling jewelry. The credit that she is soliciting will be put towards her second business, the jewelry sales which are done by customer request. She makes unique models and sells them to her clients. She currently has a surplus of requests. The loan will be sued to buy rings, pendants and bracelets. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they show in the awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rings, pendants and bracelets.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 44 years-old, married, and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and two young children. To earn additional income for her family, Elenita is opening a local business in her neighborhood where she will sell vegetables and other foods .

Elenita would like a loan to purchase an inventory of vegetables, pork, and other supplies.  Elenita believes in offering a diverse assortment and inventory of goods in her business for customers seeking convenient purchases.  A new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Elenita is grateful for the access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams.

Her long term goals are to have own restaurant, fund the college education of children, and support her family financially.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve success her new entrepreneurial endeavor.

.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of vegetables, pork, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary’s business is of two kinds — the sale of drinks and sachet water, and a fashion designer. She is very happy with the way her business is growing. She is able to make profit that she reinvests into the business. She has been in the business for more than 15 years and she has been able to retain many customers with her good relationship with them. 

Mary is married with two children and she is 36 years old. Her husband is a transporter and they combine their take-home pay to manage their home financially. Mary hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to buy more drinks, sachet water and tailoring materials to sell. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, sachet water and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El señor Vidal L. G. tienen la edad de 44 años, es casado y se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos y los dos mayores le apoyan en los trabajos del campo.

Dentro de los problemas principales que ha tenido la comunidad de San Caralampio han sido la falta del vital liquido, que no abastece a la comunidad, ocasionándole problemas de salud e higiene para los que habitan en la zona, ellos ahora necesitan de insumos agrícolas, que le brinden mejores condiciones a sus tierras pudiendo producir un producto de mayor calidad debido a que actualmente la erosion del suelo le ha dificultado los porcentajes de produccion, este apoyo economico le favorecera a señor en la venta a mejor precio, permitiendole mejores condiciones económicas para emprender a nuevas inversiones del campo. Y el mejoramiento continuo de los niveles de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Vidal L. G., 44, is a married farmer; he has 4 children, the two oldest help him with his field chores. Among the main problems that the San Caralampio community has faced has been the lack of potable water in the community, which occasionally causes health and hygiene problems for area residents. They need farming supplies that will improve the condition of their fields so that their crops will be better quality; soil erosion has decreased crop yields. This funding will be very beneficial because he will be able to sell at better prices thus improving his family’s living standard and allowing for new investment in the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fungicides.

loans.name: Los Capullitos Group

texts.es:
Gisela es una socia responsable del grupo ella se dedica al alquiler D. mototaxi hace varios años, su esposo es chofer D. transporte público él la apoya con los gastos en casa, ellos desean tener mayores ingresos, es por eso que Gisela es responsables en el grupo y la escogieron presidenta.

Para Nerea nunca es tarD. el estudio, así que ella está estudiando en la Universidad para luego poner en práctica lo que aprendió, además se dedica al comercio D. tablas para skateboard, ropa, zapatillas y zapatos en un stand que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo. Ella está satisfecha con lo que hace y  tiene el apoyo D. su familia.
 La Alcancía Comunal LOS CAPULLITOS cursa el 7mo Ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. Los socios agradecen a cada una D. las personas que hacen posibles sus préstamos.
texts.en:
Gisela is a responsible group member who has leased out a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) for several years; her husband is a public transportation driver and he helps out with household expenses. They would like to have more income and this is why Gisela is so responsible in the group and she was chosen group president. For Nerea it’s never late to study so she is studying in the university so that later she can put into practice what she’s learned. She also sells skateboards, clothing and shoes in a stand that she got with much effort. She is content with what she does and her family encourages her. The LOS CAPULLITOS (Little Flower Buds) communal bank is in its 7th loan cycle and they have been responsible and punctual with their repayments. The members are grateful to each person who has maD. their loans possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Elena, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la Zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vive en alquiler en la casa de sus padrinos, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, convive con el Sr. Roberto  que trabaja como empleado, y con el aporte de los dos mantienen a sus 2 hijos.

La Sra. Elena tiene un puesto en la Av. Tumusla este lugar es conocido en la ciudad de la paz ya que es llena de comerciantes minoristas y de comerciantes ambulantes, en su puesto de venta ofrece varios artículos en especial los de plástico, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta finalizar el día. la Sra. Elena tiene el sueño de contar más adelante con una tienda propia donde pueda vender sus productos y así mejorar su economía y calidad de vida. 

El destino del crédito es para comprar artículos de plástico, pañales desechables, cinta de embalaje y otros productos que se venden por el lugar.

La Sra. Elena esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la Otorgacion del Credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena is 35 years old and lives in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. She rents a room in her Godparents house. She has 2 children who are in school. Her partner is Mr. Roberto who works as an employee and with the contribution of their two incomes they are able to raise their 2 children. Mrs. Elena has a booth on Tumusla Avenue which is well known in the city of La Paz as it is full of small businesses and ambulatory businesses. Her booth sells a variety of articles, especially those made from plastic. She works from very early in the morning until the end of the day. Mrs. Elena’s dream is to eventually own her own store where she can sell her products and in this way improve her economic situation and her quality of life. The loan will be used to buy plastic items, disposable diapers, packing tape and other products that she sells from her booth. Mrs. Elena is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in awarding her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy plastic goods.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 31 years old and married with one child. He runs an electronics shop to earn a living. He had previous employment before he started this business. He has been in business for three years and has great plans for the future. He plans to grow his business and start his own company. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy a drilling machine. He describes himself as hardworking and honest. 
The photo has been taken in the office.

loans.use: To purchase a drilling machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Ana Elena

texts.es:
Ana Pérez C. tiene 30 años, vive en San Juan Nepomuceno, llamado el municipio verde de Colombia y pulmón de los montes de María y ubicado en el departamento de Bolívar.  Ana tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, por el que día a día hace sus mayores esfuerzos para sacarlo adelante, ayudada por sus padres de los cuales recibe un incondicional apoyo; ella siempre ha trabajado en el sector comercial con su madre y mas aun cuando se separó, que su mama  le prestó dinero para comprar 2 computadores con el que inició su propio negocio, donde ofrece servicios de Internet y transcripciones, y aprovecha la buena comunicación con su clientela porque también vende mercancías, como productos de belleza mediante guías especializadas; ambos negocios quedan ubicados en un local al lado de la casa donde vive con sus padres y su hijo. Ella invirtió en su negocio su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y dice que le han servido de mucho pues le generó una utilidad adicional a la que obtenía sin este y la utilizó en sus gastos emergentes; en la actualidad  solicita su segundo crédito de $1.500.000 para comprar mercancías, como papelería, ropa para damas y productos de belleza como perfumería, con este se propone aumentar su clientela y reinvertir la nueva utilidad de este crédito en su negocio, pues sueña con ampliarlo y que éste le de lo suficiente para estudiar  Ingeniería de sistemas y ahorrar para proporcionarle una educación de calidad a su hijo y mucho mas adelante tener su carro. 
El mas grande desafió es educar a su hijo sin su cónyuge, pero gracia a dios recibe la valiosa ayuda de sus padres y le va a ir muy bien, porque está ubicada muy cerca de una avenida comercial, rodeada por zonas recreativas, estudiantiles y microempresas que ayudan a la afluencia de un número importante de reales y potenciales clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Pérez C., 30, lives in San Juan Nepomuceno, known as Colombia’s green city and lung of the María Mountains, located in Bolívar department. Ana has a three-year-old son and it’s for him that she struggles daily to provide support; her parents help her out with their unconditional support. She has always worked in commerce with her mother, even more so when she separated from her husband. Her mother lent her money to buy two computers that she used to set up her own business, offering Internet access services and transcriptions. Because of the good relationships she has with her customers, she also offers assorted merchandise for sale like, catalogue beauty products. Both businesses are located next-door to the house where she lives with her parents and son. She invested her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in her business and she states that it was of great use because it helped generate additional profits to those she earned without it; she used it to pay outstanding expenses. Currently, she is requesting a $1.500.000 loan to buy merchandise like: stationery, women’s clothing and beauty products, like perfume. She hopes to increase her customer base and reinvest the new profits obtained in her business because she dreams with expanding it so that it will produce enough for her to be able to study systems engineering and save to provide her son with a good quality education; for much further down the road, she wants to have her own car.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise, like: stationery, women's clothing, beauty products.

loans.name: Lucila Migdalia

texts.es: Lucila Migdalia tiene 47 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa, además de esto la venta de carne. Tiene la edad de 46 años. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar su condición económica pues es muy importante para el ingreso de su hogar, ya que es el único medio de ingreso que tiene. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. el sueño de Lucila es lograr establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucila Migdalia is 47 years old. She works selling clothing and also sells meat. This is not the first time she has received a loan from the foundation. She has three children. She has been concerned with improving her financial situation and the income from her business is very important for her household because it is the only income they have. She will use the loan to purchase necessary materials for her business. Lucila's dream is to start a mini-market in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Tupanka

texts.en:
Tupanka is a 42-year-old married lady with three children. She has been selling clothes to local community residents for ten years. She also sells cultural products to earn extra income. Her husband is a businessman and they work hard to improve their standard of living. 

Tupanka plans to expand her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Kefer

texts.en: Kefer is a 36-year-old married man with two children who go to school. He runs a tailoring shop to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 10 years and has three employees. They work together with his wife who is also a tailor. He had previously taken out a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business.  He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future. He has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a tanning machine.

loans.use: To buy a tanning machine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fatima Maria

texts.es: La señora Fátima Maria posee un negocio que es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ella tiene 33 años de edad madre de 2 hijos que estudian gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su esposo el cual trabaja como taxista. Doña Fátima sale a vender todos los días en su único medio de transporte que es una bicicleta, ella recorro distancias muy largas pero esto no la desanima para salir adelante pues siempre le ha gustado su actividad económica. Ella solicita este financiamiento para el mejoramiento del negocio ya que se aproxima la semana Santa y tiene muchos pedidos. Sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima Maria selling clothing door-to-door. She is 33 years old and has two children who are studying. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Fatima goes out selling her products every day using her only method of transportation, a bicycle. She travels long distances, but this does not discourage her. She has always strove to succeed and has enjoyed working. She will use the loan to improve her business because Holy Week is coming up and she has many orders. She dreams of improving her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 40 years old and married with two children who go to school. He raises dairy cattle and sells milk to the local community residents to earn a living. He was previously employed by a maize mill company before he ventured into this business. He has been in this business for four years and has many plans for the future. He plans to expand his business and improve his living standards.  He had previously taken out a loan of Kes. 80,000 from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and he successfully repaid.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more dairy cattle.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: El Progreso De La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Sara se dedica a la venta D. ropa ambulatoriamente, es madre soltera por lo debe mantener sola a sus tres hijos, empezó vendiendo algunos productos en el mercado pero no obtenía muchas ganancias así que opto por vender ropa, ella camina largos trechos y ofrece sus productos a personas recomendadas por sus amistades, el esfuerzo es mucho pero se siente satisfecha con su trabajo ya que así pueD. obtener mayores ganancias y pagar los gastos D. su familia.
Lizbeth tiene un negocio por las noches se dedica a la venta D. comida como : salchipollo, hamburguesas, salchipapas, etc. pero eso no es suficiente para ella así que con el préstamo recibido desea poner otro negocio que le permita generar mayores ingresos, para mantener a sus 4 menores hijos.
La venta D. cuadros no es suficiente para Isabel además D. eso, se dedica a lavar ropa, hacer limpieza en diferentes casas o cualquier  otro trabajo que se le presente para subsistir. Es una socia soltera. La ALCOM “El progreso D. la Amistad” agradece el préstamo y se comprometen a cancelar sus cuotas según su programación establecida.
texts.en:
Our partner Sara works selling clothing door-to-door. She is a single mom who has to support her three children. She began selling products at the market, but she did not earn much of an income. So she decided to sell clothing. She walks long stretches and sells her products to people her friends introduce her to. The work is hard, but she feels satisfied with her job because she can earn more money and support her family. Lizbeth has a business selling food at night. She makes sausage with chicken, hamburgers, sausage with potatoes, and other dishes. However, this job is not sufficient. She is applying for a loan in order to start another business that will help her increase her income, so that she can care for her four children. Isabel sells paintings and pictures, but this is insufficient so she also washes clothes, cleans different houses, and takes on any job available in order to get by. She is single. ALCOM "The Progress of Friendship" is very thankful for the loan and they are committed to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ice fish in cartons to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are aged fifteen and fourteen years. Both of her children are currently in school. Janet lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in their community. She works hard to support her husband, a saw miller, to provide for the family financially. 

Hard-working Janet is a dressmaker. She has been in the dress-making business for twenty-two years. Though Janet owns the shop in which she works, she yearns to get another shop and also help her husband to put up a house to accommodate the family. 

Janet intends to procure textiles and sewing accessories in bulk with the loan. It is also Janet’s dream to buy a taxi for commercial purposes.

loans.use: To buy textiles and sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 38-year-old father of four. He runs a retail shop and offers telephone services in his shop. He has been in this business for 10 years. He also runs a video production and a photography studio to earn extra income.  He previously took out seven loans from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and he successfully repaid.   He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 90,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy mobile phone calling cards and phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and calling cards

loans.name: Biafra

texts.en: Biafra is 38 years old and married with two children.  He sells second hand clothes at wholesale to earn a living.   He also supplies food to earn extra income.  He had previously taken out one loan from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and he successfully repaid.   He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standard in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To increase his stock of clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is widowed and the mother of seven children, some of whom are still in school while others are out of school and working. The fifty-four year old businesswoman lost her husband some years ago and has since been the sole provider for the family. Her children are between the ages of thirty – two and twenty. Some of the grown-ups are married and live with their spouses. 

Mary lives with the younger ones in a rented apartment in her community. The hard-working widow delights in sales and has been a merchant for the past thirty-five years. She sells groceries and other food items such as cooking oil, rice, spices, etc. 

It is Mary’s dream to increase her profit margin and be able to give her younger children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is 24 years old and married with one child. She makes clothes and sells them in the market place in Kibera slums to earn a living.  She has been in this business for five years and has one employee.  She gets extra income from her husband who is employed.  Her business has grown tremendously since she joined Faulu Kenya because she can access loans.  She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future.  She has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sewing machines and fabric.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines and more fabric

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi. Hace más de 10 años, que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio con esfuerzos propios, por lo que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, el se encarga de proporcionarle lo más necesario a toda su familia. Pues sus inicios fueron muy duros ya algunas veces como no tenía el capital suficiente su automóvil no presentaba las condiciones necesarias. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, batería entre otros artículos. El sueña con tener otro vehículo que presente mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 44 years old and he works as a taxi driver. For more than ten years he has worked in this business, which he started with his own hard work. He has one son and is responsible for providing the necessities for his family. Early on things were very hard because sometimes he did not have enough money to keep his car in good condition. He will use the loan money to purchase tires, a battery, and other parts. He hopes to get another vehicle that is in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business

loans.name: Philipa

texts.en:
Philipa B. is truly a hard worker. She is 24 years old and sells bales of empty sacks and ropes to customers in the busy Central Market of Kumasi. Philipa has been operating her business for seven years and is excited to be taking out this loan. She plans to add to her stock of empty sacks, ropes and jute to meet customer demand. 

Philipa is married to a trader who sells televisions and DVDs. They have one child who is just 6 months old. As Philipa looks to her future, she says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profits that she will be able to educate her children to at least the tertiary school level. 

Philipa knows hardship, and is confident that she will continue to persevere no matter what challenges she faces. During her third loan cycle from Sinapi Aba Trust, Philipa’s business premises burned down. She was able to recover and pay back the loan well with extra hard work. Now requesting her fourth loan, Philipa is excited about what the future may bring.

loans.use: To purchase stocks like empty sacks, ropes and jute.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is twenty-seven years old. She is single and has no children. She works very hard to be able to meet her personal expenses. She lives alone in a rented apartment in her community. 

Esther enjoys trading. She trades in ladies’ wear such as dresses and shoes. She has been in this business for the past four years and looks forward to growing her business to a very big one. Esther needs the loan to procure additional goods in bulk to scale up her business. It is her dream to own a big boutique in her community. Spinster Esther is hoping for a good husband in the near future.

loans.use: To buy ladies' wear in bulk

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 40-year-old mother of two. She runs a salon and a cosmetic shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and has two employees. Her business is located in Zimmerman in the outskirts of Nairobi city.  She had previously taken out a loan of KES 50,000 from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid. She hopes to grow her business and offer better education to her children in the future. She has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to add stock of hair chemicals, nail polish and beauty products.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals, nail polish and beauty products

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca Azucena tiene 27 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que trabaja con Fundación León 2000, por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda, tiene 1 hijo y esta a su cargo. Ella inicio este negocio hace más de 7 años y comenzó con la venta de perfumes y cremas. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y depender de sí misma, pues es madre soltera y ha sabido luchar por su hijo sin importar las circunstancias. Ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos, ropa, entre otros productos. Siempre desea tener su propio local para ofrecer sus diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Blanca Azucena is 27 yeard old and works selling a variety of merchandise. This is not the first loan she has received from the Leon 2000 Foundation, which has been a great help to her. She has a son who lives with her. She started her business more than seven years ago and began by selling perfume and creams. She has always liked to work and be independent. She is a single mother and has fought to help her son no matter what the circumstances are. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cosmetics, clothing, and other products. She has always dreamed of having her own store to offer all of her different products.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She runs a retail shop where she sells general merchandise such as rice, sugar, maize flour and cereals. She has a lot of experience because she has been in this business for 10 years. She had previously taken out a loan of KES 40,000 from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standards in the future. She has requested for a loan of KES 90,000 to add stock of maize, beans and flour.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of maize, 10 bags of beans and flour

loans.name: Belia Cecilia

texts.es:
Belia G. vive con sus padres y una hermana en San Juan Nepomuceno, municipio de Bolívar, en un barrio donde muchos de sus habitantes pertenecen al sector educativo y  la comunidad en general se caracteriza por ser vecinos solidarios.
Ella estudió Administración Hotelera y vivió 20 años en Cartagena, donde conoció a mucha gente y le surgió la idea de vender ropa o prendas de vestir, realizando su mercadeo inicial mediante catálogos. Belia hace un poco mas de 2 años, trabajó en una empresa que cerraron, y con sus ahorros construyó un local y creo su negocio “Belia Boutique” cuando se fue a vivir nuevamente a San Juan Nepomuceno, lugar donde nació y sigue atendiendo a su clientela de Cartagena y agregando a su negocio nuevos clientes de San Juan Nepomuceno. Para ella su negocio ha sido muy importante, porque depende económicamente de él, aunque también recibe sus ingresos de su apartamento, arrendado porque vive en casa de sus padres. En la actualidad aplica a primer crédito con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $ 2.300.000 para comprar prendas de vestir para damas caballeros y niños, y calzado elegante ya solicitado por sus clientes.

Su sueño es ampliar su local y más adelante  tener un carro para viajar a traer mercancías desde Bogotá y Medellín. Su gran desafío fue quedar desempleada y sostenerse mediante su negocio y otro de sus grandes desafíos y aprendizaje, fue la cuando hizo una oferta inicial de créditos a pesonas que no conocía y perdió parte de su dinero ahorrado, porque las cuentas por cobrar crecieron, pero quedaron dineros incobrables, con los que ya no cuenta;  finalmente  con esta experiencia negativa aprendió a ser muy cuidadosa en la selección de sus clientes  y en la actualidad  eso es precisamente lo que hace elegirlos bien.
texts.en:
Belia G. lives with her parents and a sister in San Juan Nepomuceno in the Bolívar municipality. She lives in a neighborhood where many of the inhabitants belong to the educational sector. In general, the people in the community are characterized as being supportive neighbors. She studied Hotel Administration, and she lived in Cartagena for 20 years. She knew a lot of people there, and she got the idea to sell clothes. She got her initial merchandise through catalogs. A little over two years ago Belia worked for a company that closed. She used her savings to build her place and created her business, Belia Boutique. Once again she went to live in San Juan Nepomuceno, the place where she was born. She continues to take care of her customers from Cartagena, and she is adding to her business with new customers from Juan Nepomuceno. The business has been very important to her because she is economically dependent upon it. This is true even though she receives income from her apartment, which is rented because she lives in her parents’ house. She is currently asking for her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 2,300,000 COP. She will buy clothing and elegant footwear for women, men, and children, which has been requested by her customers. Her dream is to expand her place and to later on have a car. She would use the car to travel and bring merchandise from Bogotá and Medellín. Her big challenge is continuing to be unemployed and supporting herself with her business. Another big challenge and lesson was when she gave credit to people she did not know, and she lost part of the money she had saved. The bills she had to pay grew, and there was money she could not collect. She does not have that now. Finally, with this negative experience she learned to be very careful choosing her customers. That is precisely what she now does, and it makes her choose them well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and elegant footwear for women, men, and children; which has been requested by her customers.

loans.name: Alfredo Antonio

texts.es: Alfredo Antonio es un hombre muy trabajador y ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. Tiene 45 años por lo que su actividad económica es brindar sus servicios en una tenería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alfredo inicio este negocio por cuenta propia pues siempre puso mucho empeño y sacrificio ya que este trabajo no es fácil y los diferentes procesos que realiza todos los días, pero este medio de trabajo es el que lo ayuda a salir adelante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar cromo, sulfato de sodio, cloruro sódico entre otros productos. El desea tener su propio negocio, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo Antonio is a hardworking man who has shown himself to be an excellent client. He is 45 years old and his economic activity is providing services in a tannery. He has been working in this business for more than 15 years. Alfredo started in this line of work on his own, and he always puts a lot of effort and sacrifice into his work. This type of work is not easy, as there are many different processes that he carries out each day, but this type of work is what helps him to get ahead. The loan is for working capital to buy chromium, sodium sulfate, sodium chloride and other products. He wishes to have his own business, in order to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 48 years old and married with three children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she sells general merchandise such as rice, sugar, cooking fat and cereals. She has been in this business for 10 years and has two employees. She also rents her residential houses to earn extra income. She was previously employed as a teacher before she started this business. She has previously taken out a loan of KES 50,000 from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid. She has requested for a loan of KES 60,000 to buy a weighing machine, bales of flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine, bales of flour and sugar

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora H. de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (una zona muy apartada de la ciudad), su casa es de cemento y no cuenta con servicios básicos. Esta separada de su esposo pero tiene 1 hijo de 16 años. 

Dora a los 34 años tenia una panadería pero por el sector por donde vive no había mucha acogida para ese negocio decidió invertir lo que le quedaba de sus ahorros en víveres para una tienda. 

En la actualidad trabaja todos los días en su tienda vendiendo el arroz en quintal a $ 32.00, el quintal de azúcar a $ 40.00. Una de las dificultades es la falta de energía que tiene en su casa. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, harina, azúcar para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que su tienda sea una de las mejores en su sector.
texts.en:
Dora H., age 49, lives in the outskirts of the city in Paraíso de Guayaquil (an area very isolated from the city). Her house if made of concrete, and it does not have basic services. She is separated from her husband, but she has a 16 year old son. When Dora was 34 she had a bakery, but it was not well received in the area where she lives. She decided to invest what was left of her savings in supplies for a store. She currently works everyday in her store. She sells rice for $32.00 per “quintal” (100 pounds) and sugar for $40.00 per quintal. One of the difficulties is there is no electricity in her house. She will use the loan to buy rice, flour, and sugar for her store. In the future she wants to finish building her house. She also wants her store to be one of the best in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 30 years old and is married with two children. He runs an auto spare parts shop to earn a living. He previously was working in his father’s workshop before he started his own business. He is a very hardworking person. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for the training they offered him. He acquired customer care skills and learned how to keep business records, and his business has tremendously grown. He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy more auto spare parts

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Originales Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento SIEMPRE ALEGRES ORIGINALES estan en su primera secuencia todas las socias son nuevas, y el nombre que pusieron al banco es porque estan muy contentas con el prestamo otorgado.

La Sra. Sonia, tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vive en la casa de sus familiares, actualmente no tiene hijos y es soltera, la Sra. Sonia se dedica a la venta de artículos de plástico, por no tener un puesto fijo ambula por las calles aledañas a la Av. Tumusla donde trabaja durante todo el dia. Ella es la presidenta del banco de Emprendimiento fue elegida por su responsabilidad y carisma en el momento de formar el Banco de Emprendimiento. Con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor y asi ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Katerin, tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciuidad de La Paz, ella vive en la casa de sus familiares, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos, la Sra. Katerin se dedica a la venta de comida en su mismo domicilio donde realiza exquisitos platillos donde tiene mucha clientela, tiene muchas ganas de superacion y desea continuar con sus estudios posteriormente una vez que tenga estabilidad economica. La Sra.  Katerin  es Secretaria de Actas del Banco de Emprendimiento Siempre Alegres Originales, El destino del crédito es para la compra de abarrotes como aceite, fideo, arroz, etc. y asi poder elaborar sus platillos y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo y asi poder sobresalir económicamente.

La Sra. Doris, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi de la ciuidad de La Paz, ella vive en la casa de sus familiares, tiene 1  hijo, convive con el Sr. Walter quien trabaja como pintor es Secretaria de Actas de la Mesa Directiva. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital de trabajo y asi poder sobresalir económicamente.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos tienen que mantener solas su hogar, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Siempre Alegres Originales (The Original Always Happy) Communal Bank is in its first lending sequence. All the members are new. The bank was given its name because they are all very happy with the lending specification. Mrs. Sonia is 34 years old and lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her family’s home. She is currently single and has no children. As she doesn’t have a fixed booth, Mrs. Sonia sells plastic goods from a moving cart in the area around Tumusla Avenue. She is the president of the communal bank. She was elected at the formation of the communal bank because of her responsible and charismatic nature. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise from the wholesaler and in this way, offer a greater variety of products to her customers. Mrs. Katerin is 22 years old and lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her family’s home. She is currently single and has no children. Mrs. Katerin sells food from her own home. She makes exquisite dishes and has many customers. She has a strong drive to improve and would like to continue her studies once she is more economically established. Mrs. Katerin is the secretary of the Siempre Alegres Originales communal bank. The loan will be used to buy groceries such as oil, noodles, rice etc. In this way she will be able to make her dishes and increase her working capital in order to improve her economic situation. Mrs. Doris is 35 years old and lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone in the city of La Paz. She lives in her family’s home. She has one son with her partner Mr. Walter, who works as a painter. She is the recording secretary for the board of directors. The loan will be used to increase her working capital and in this way she will improve her economic situation. All the members are responsible and hardworking people and are, in many cases, the sole provider in their home. They are very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust they show in the awarding of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Danilsa

texts.es:
Danilsa L. es un a mujer que conoce las necesidades de las mujeres y hombres en belleza e imagen personal, y esta la razón por la que su negocio vende belleza saludable e  imagen personal a clientes desde el sitio donde ellos se encuentren, pues trabaja a domicilio y con  su misma imagen  proyecta lo que ofrece. Desde hace 19 años Danilsa inició su negocio ofreciendo servicios de  manicure, pedicure, Blower, tinturado y corte de cabello en  San Fernando un barrio en la ciudad de Cartagena; ella atiende clientes de todas las edades, pero especialmente a mujeres residentes en los estratos 3 y 4 de la ciudad. 
Es usual ver llegar a Danilsa muy contenta cargada con todos los implementos que requiere para empezar en cualquier residencia o sitio de trabajo el arreglo personal de sus clientes en horarios adaptados a sus posibilidades, porque su trabajo es a domicilio especialmente para quienes les gusta verse lindas y saludables con los tratamientos que ella aplica y que algunas veces no tienen tiempo de hacérselos por la multiplicidad de  roles que mantienen hoy hombres y mujeres ocupados.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación, con el primero  compró implementos de trabajo  para brindar un servicio de excelencia a sus clientes, en la actualidad solicita un monto de $2.000.000, con el que comprará al por mayor esmaltes, tintes, cremas para manos y algunos productos de uso personal, pues conoce mucho de bioseguridad. Su principal sueño es tener casa propia y planea vincularse al programa Ciudad Bicentenario liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su misión constructora de desarrollo social en comunidades
texts.en:
Danilsa L. is a woman who knows what women and men need with respect to beauty and personal image; this is why she sells healthy beauty and personal image to her customers wherever they are located. She provides in-home services and projects the services she offers with her own personal image. Danilsa began her business 19 years ago providing manicures, pedicures, hair-drying and dying, and haircuts in San Fernando, a neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. She has customers of all ages but especially women who are in the city’s stratus 3 and 4 classifications (Estrato: a method of the Colombian government to classify people according to their socio-economic standing: estrato 3 is lower-middle class and estrato 4 is middle-class). It is customary to see Danilsa happily arrive loaded down with all the tools and supplies she needs to provide personal beauty services at her customers’ homes or other locations following a schedule that is convenient to them. She provides in-home services for those who want to look beautiful and healthy with the treatments she applies that don’t have the time to do it themselves due to the busy schedules men and women have nowadays. This is her second loan with the Fundación. She used the first one to buy work tools in order to provide excellent customer service. She is now asking for a $2.000.000 loan with which to buy nail polish, hair dyes, hand creams and some personal use items because she knows a lot about biosecurity. Her main dream is to own her own home and she plans to associate herself with the Ciudad Bicentenario (Bicentennial City) program led by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of its mission to build social development in communities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nail polish, hair dyes, hand cream and other personal use items at wholesale.

loans.name: Buenas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Buenas Emprendedoras es un banco nuevo que se encuentra en su primera secuencia.

La Sra. Mary, tiene 34 años D. edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi D. la ciudad D. La Paz, ella vive en la casa D. sus familiares, tiene 1 hijo y convive con el Sr. Manuel  que es Abogado D. profesión.
