La Sra. Mary  se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogo, no tiene un puesto fijo pero tiene varios clientes por los cuales se desplaza por toda la ciudad. La Sra. Mary es la  Presidenta D. la Mesa Directiva del Banco D. Emprendimiento Tiene el sueño D. contar más adelante con una casa propia donD. pueda vivir junto a su pareja y su hijo, el destino del crédito es para incrementar sus productos ya que muchos D. ellos están en promoción.				
				
La Sra. Fatima, tiene 24 años D. edad, vive en la Zona Villa Nuevo Potosi D. la ciuidad D. La Paz, ella tiene y vive en su casa propia, tiene 1 hijo, convive con el Sr. Marcelo  que trabaja como obrero en una empresa constructora. La Sra. Fatima tiene un puesto propio en el cual se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesas, salchipapas y otros (comida al paso), sale a vender por las noches y por el dia se dedica a los labores D. su hogar.La Sra. Fatima  es Secretaria D. Actas D. la Mesa Directiva. El destino del crédito es para incrementar los materiales para la elaboración D. sus productos ya que por mayor son mas barátos.

La Sra. Maria, tiene 21 años D. edad, vive en la Zona D. Tembladerani D. la ciudad D. La Paz, ella vive en la casa D. sus padres, tiene 1 hijo al cual mantiene sola. La Sra. Maria  tiene una tienda D. barrio en la casa D. sus padres la cual atienD. durante todo el dia, donD. tambien cuida y cria a su hijo. es Tesorera D. la Mesa Directiva. El destino del crédito es para incrementar su capital D. trabajo y asi surtir su tienda. El sueño que ella tiene es ver algun día a su hijo ser profesional.

Todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank Buenas Emprendedoras is a new bank in its first loan cycle. Mary, who is 34 years old, lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi zone of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who is a lawyer, and their son in her relatives' house. She makes a living selling cosmetics by catalogue. Rather than having a fixed stand, she has various clients for whom she travels around the city. Mary is the president of the board of directors for her communal bank. Her dream is to eventually have her own house where she can live together with her husband and their son. She will use this loan to increase her products, since a lot of them are on sale. Fatima is 24 years old and also lives in Villa Nuevo Potosi in La Paz. She lives in her own house with her son and her partner, Marcelo, who works for a construction company. Fatima has her own stand where she sells hamburgers, hot dogs, fries, and other types of fast food. She does this job during the night, while during the day she keeps busy with the domestic chores. Additionally, she is the secretary of the board for her communal bank. This loan will be used to increase the materials for making her products, since they are cheaper wholesale. Maria is 21 years old and lives in the zone of Tembladerani in La Paz. She lives in her parents' house and has one son whom she takes care of by herself. In her parents' house, Maria has a convenience store which she attends to all day long, while also taking care of and raising her son. She is the treasurer of the board for the communal bank. She will use this loan to increase her working capital and thereby stock her store. Her dream is to see her son become a professional some day. All of the group members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence provided to them through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Heyssell Sarai

texts.es:
la sra. Heyssell V. se dedica a la venta de comida en su casa de habtacion, esta soltera y es muy dedicada a sus estudios y a su negocio, Heyssell se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar sus deliciosas comidas   y a las 5 de la mañana ya esta vendiendo. Vive  con sus papas y la apoyan con su negocio y sus estudios.
el prestamo lo nesecita para comprar carnes ya que tiene mas demanda en estos dias.
las ganancias las utilizara para ayudar a sus padres y pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Heyssell V. sells prepared meals in her home. She is single and very dedicated to her studies and her business. Heyssell rises at 4am every day to prepare her delicious meals and is open for business by 5am. She lives with her parents and they support her work and study efforts. She needs funding to buy meats because they are in high demand these days. She will use her profits to help her parents pay for her schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, pork and chicken.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica Renee

texts.es:
La Sra. Veronica tiene 41 años D. edad, vive en la Zona villa Santiago I en la ciudad D. El Alto en un domicilio familiar. Ella está casada con el Sr. Hernan que es empleado D. una gasolinera ubicada en la zona D. San Pedro, tienen 3 hijos a los cuales aun mantienen, este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja, anteriormente ya saco la misma suma para la compra D. un equipo D. sonido para su hogar, la sra. Veronica se siente satisfecha por trabajar con el credito Kiva otorgado por Emprender es por eso que solicitó la renovación del crédito
Doña Veronica tiene una tienda D. artefactos electricos ubicada en la calle Eloy Salmon D. la zona Gran Poder, este lugar es muy conocido en la ciudad ya que venden artefactos electricos, camaras digitales, celulares, etc el destino del credito es para comprar unas máquinas D. afeitar que se encuentran en promoción. Esta muy agradecida cxon Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 and lives in a residence in the Villa Santiago area in the city of El Alto. She is married to Mr. Hernan, who is employed at a gasoline station in San Pedro. They have three children whom they still support. This is the second loan cycle for Veronica. Previously, she borrowed the same amount to buy a sound system for her home. She is pleased with the results of having received a Kiva loan through Kiva partner Emprender, and she is seeking a new loan for this reason. Veronica owns an electric shop located in Eloy Salmon Street in the Gran Poder area. This location is well known in the city as a place where electric fixtures, digital cameras, cell phones, etc., are sold. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase electric shavers that are on sale. Veronica is very grateful to Kiva and field partner Emprender for the confidence she gets from being granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electrical appliances.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La Sra. Maria, tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la Zona Alto Tacagua en la ciuidad de La Paz, su domicilio es propio, tine 4 hijos, convive con el Sr. Valerio que tiene una movilidad con la cual trabaja como chofer de transporte urbano, La Sra.  Maria tiene un carrito para la venta de tripitas (comida al paso) con el cual trabaja por las noches en inmediaciones de la plaza Alonzo de Mendoza. La Sra. Maria tiene el sueño de contar con mas carritos de tripitas para poder generar empleo a otra personas y asi crecer como microempresaria, es por eso, que el destino del crédito es para comprar más carritos para venta de tripitas como también papa, maní y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de las tripitas y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada  en la otrogacion del credito.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and lives in the Alto Tacagua neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She has her own home, has 4 children, and lives with Valerio, who has a vehicle that he uses to work as a driver in urban transportation. Maria has a cart from which she sells tripe tacos (fast food) in the evenings in the area surrounding the plaza Alonzo de Mendoza. Maria dreams of having more taco carts so that she could generate employment for other people and grow as a small businesswoman. For this reason she will use this loan to buy more carts to sell tripe, and in addition, potatoes, peanuts and other ingredients to make the tripitas, and in this way increase her working capital. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase working capital - buy food ingredients

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
doña Olga Z. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Jacolito, Namasigue departamento de Choluteca. Olga se dedica a su negocio que es una pulperia. la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene mas de 20 años de residir en ese lugar. Todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender su clientela. el lugar en donde reside es una zona bien productiva. Olga y su esposo han sacado adelante a sus hijos y los han hecho profesionales.
doña olga es bien dedicada a su negocio y a su familia.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son bastantes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Olga Z., 49, lives in the village of Jacolito, Namasigue department, Choluteca. She has lived her for over 20 years. The area where she lives is a very productive area. She has a grocery store in her home. She rises daily at 5am to start tending to her customers. Olga is very dedicated to her business and to her family. Olga and her husband have raised their children to become professionals. She will use the funds to buy inventory items to stock her store because her customers have many needs. She needs the profits to meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Clara Lía

texts.es:
La señora Clara T. es socia del banco comunal La Playa, ella vive en el Sector la Playa en la parroquia el Valle a unos 45 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  su gente se dedica principalmente al cultivo de  las tierras  con  maíz, fréjol, papas, verduras, no en gran cantidad porque la mayor parte de su población  sale a la ciudad a trabajar en diferentes actividades  pero si para abastecer el mercado del  sector y para consumo propio de los agricultores,  además  crían animales como vacas, borregos, pollos, gansos, cuyes, etc.

 Clara tiene 51 años de edad, concibió sólo un hijo que ahora bordea los 26 años quien se encuentra casado y vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar,  en cambio  ella  le ayuda con el cuidado de sus dos niños pequeños mientras sus padres trabajan.
 

Nuestra socia  se dedica  a la cría de animales,  tiene dos vacas lecheras y su producción entrega al carro lechero de la zona,  los cuyes y  pollos los vende vivos  a sus vecinos de la comunidad o a quien se lo solicite y también tiene para su propio consumo, ésta actividad la comparte con los quehaceres propios del hogar.
 

Clara se encuentra cinco  años integrando el banco comunal La Playa,  los créditos recibidos  le han permitido  comprar sus  animales e ir construyendo de a poco su casa,  el dinero que recibirá de su nuevo crédito  invertirá en la  compra de  una vaca y un cerdo, teniendo como meta  ir mejorando cada día su casa y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Clara T., 51, is a member of the La Playa (The Beach) communal bank. She lives in the La Playa neighborhood of El Valle parish, which is 45 minutes outside of Cuenca. Its residents are primarily farmers that grow corn, bean, potatoes and vegetables; not in large quantities because most of the population goes to the city to work at various jobs but enough to supply the local market and for personal use of the farmers. In addition, they raise cows, sheep, chickens, geese, guinea-pigs, etc. Clara had just one son, who is almost 26 years old. He’s married and shares his mother’s house and household expenses. In exchange, she helps him to care for his two small children while he and his wife work. Clara raises animals; she has two dairy cows and she delivers their milk to the area milk collecting truck. The guinea-pigs and chickens she sells live to her neighbors or to whomever asks for them; she also keeps some for personal consumption. She combines these tasks with household chores. Clara has been a member of the La Playa communal bank for five years. Loans received have made it possible for her to buy animals and to gradually build her house. The funds from this new loan will be used to buy a cow and a pig, her goal being to make daily improvements to her home and to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow and a pig.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina R. P., oriunda de San Vicente de Chucurí, municipio del departamento de Santander, vive en el barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana del municipio Soledad, parte del área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Es madre cabeza de familia y vive con su hijo de 20 años que la ayuda en su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas. Martina aprendió cómo elaborar empanadas y papas rellenas de su cuñada y ahora vende papas rellenas, empanadas santandereanas con carne, huevo y arroz, añadiéndoles perros calientes los fines de semana. También prepara chicha de arroz y avena, bebidas que las produce “a lo santandereana” echándoles vainilla y canela, los sabores de su tierra. Tiene un carrito de comidas rápidas a cada uno de sus dos vendedores que ubican en la terminal de transportes para servir a su clientela mayormente compuesta de pasajeros de bus intermunicipales.
Con este su quinto crédito de $ 1.500.000, Martina planea comprar materias primas como arroz, azúcar, papas y aceite en mayor volumen y hacer algunos pagos a proveedores para ganar descuento a largo plazo. Llegó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 3 años por medio de su nuera que vino a capacitarse. Manifiesta que a partir de esa fecha los créditos le sirvieron para ampliar el negocio porque pasó de vender empanadas y frituras en un canasto a tener dos carritos para transportarlas; y de tener una pequeña nevera de icopor donde envasaba la chicha y avena a tener unos termos más higiénicos. El mayor desafío del trabajo es que es muy agotador: se levanta a las 3:20 cada mañana y a las 9:00 de la noche todavía no ha terminado. Sueña con tener su propia vivienda y su propio local para no salir a recorrer las calles. Es más, quiere que su hijo termine de estudiar: ha entrado en varios colegios pero ha tenido que retirarse por razones del cansancio que le produce su trabajo.
texts.en:
Martina R. P., a native of San Vicente de Chucurí, a municipality in the Santander department, lives in the suburb of Ciudadela Metropolitana in the Soledad municipality, part of the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. She is a mother and head of the family, and lives with her 20 year old son who helps her in her business preparing and selling fast food. Martina learned to make empanadas and stuffed potatoes from her sister-in-law and now she sells stuffed potatoes, Santander empanadas with meat, eggs and rice, and also makes hot dogs on the weekends. She also prepares chicha from rice and oats, drinks which she produced in Santandean style, adding vanilla and cinnamon, the flavours of her region. She has a fast food cart that each of her 2 sales people use, located in the transport terminal to serve customers who are passengers of the municipal buses. This is her fifth loan of $1,500. Martina plans to purchase large volumes of ingredients such as rice, sugar, potatoes and oil and to make some payments to provedors to obtain a discount in the long term. She arrived at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 3 years ago through her daughter-in-law. She expresses that from this date on the loans have served her to expand the business because she has gone from selling empanadas and fried food from a basket to having 2 food carts to transport the food; and she has a small fridge where she bottles the chicha and oats to make the containers more hygienic. The biggest challenge of her job is that it is very exhausting: she gets up at 3.20 each morning and at 9pm each night she still hasn't finished. Martina dreams of having her own home and own place of business so that she doesn't have to go out in the streets. She also wants her son to finish studying: he has entered in various colleges but has had to quit due to exhaustion-related reasons due to the work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk volumes of ingredients such as rice, sugar, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to the location of her store, such as adding walls and a terrace, to make the business more visible.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Ana T. también es socia del banco comunal La Playa, ella  vive en el Sector de Quillapungo en la parroquia el Valle a  unos 45 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  su tierra es fértil facilitando la siembras de  maíz, fréjol, papas, verduras y algunas frutas no se lo realiza en gran escala sino únicamente para cubrir la demanda local y para abastecer los hogares de los agricultores ya que la mayoría de su población se  traslada a la urbe cuencana donde realizan diversas actividades para mantener  a sus familias. Cabe recalcar que las mujeres son quienes emprenden en el negocio de la cría de animales y aves de corral para contribuir con la economía de sus hogares.

Ana es casada tiene dos hijos de 13 y 12 años que estudian en un colegio de la localidad, su esposo se encuentra el extranjero ya que viajo en busca de mejores días para su familia, y es quien ayuda en la economía de su hogar, se siente muy orgullosa de contar con su casa propia para tranquilidad de su familia.

Nuestra socia al igual que  la mayoría de mujeres del sector  se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos que luego  los  vende en su comunidad o en la Feria Libre de Cuenca, nos comenta que ya lleva  mucho tiempo en ésta actividad y le ha servido para mejor un poco la economía de su hogar, por otro lado manifiesta que lleva dos ciclos en su banco comunal y se siente a gusto porque a más de la gran  amistad que mantiene con todas sus compañeras los créditos le han ayudado a comprar sus animales y ahora con el dinero del nuevo  préstamo comprará crías de pollos, chanchos y alimento para su crianza y el resto adquirirá productos de primera necesidad para su hogar. Su mayor sueño es algún día poder viajar a New York a reunirse con su esposo.
texts.en:
Ana T. is a member of the La Playa cooperative bank. She lives in the Quillapungo sector of El Valle, located about 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. Her land is fertile, which facilitates the planting of corn, beans, potatoes, vegetables, and some fruit. She doesn’t farm on a grand scale, only enough to meet local demand and supply local farmers’ homes as the majority of the population goes to Cuenca to carry out various enterprises to support their families. It’s worth stressing that the women are the ones that undertake the business of raising livestock and fowl to contribute to their families’ finances. Ana is married and has two children ages 13 and 12 that study at the local school. Her husband is abroad, having traveled out of the country to seek better prospects for his family. She is very proud to have a house of their own, for the tranquility of the family. Our client, like most of the women in the area, dedicates herself to raising chickens and pigs that she later sells in her locality or at the Free Market of Cuenca. She tells us that she’s been carrying out this type of activity for many years, and it has served her well in allowing her to better support the family. She also mentions that she has two cycles with her cooperative bank. She is happy to be part of this group because of the friendships she has built with the other women members. The loans have helped her to buy her animals and, with the current loan, she would like to buy chickens, pigs, and livestock feed. With the rest, she will buy some basic necessities for the home. Her greatest dream is to, one day, travel to New York to be reunited with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, pigs, livestock feed, and some basic necessities for the home.

loans.name: Rosiris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Rosiris T. M. tiene 37 años y vive en San Juan de Nepomuceno, departamento de Bolívar  tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 17 años. Ella inició su idea de negocio cuando no conseguía fuentes de empleo e hizo un curso en el Sena de elaboración de desinfectantes y no le fue muy bien; luego comenzó un curso de belleza y desde ese momento se ha dedicado a la prestación del servicio de arreglo de uñas, tinturado de cabellos, oficio que realiza a domicilio y tiene mucha clientela por la facilidad de llegar donde el cliente la solicita.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo dolicita $2.000.000 que serán invertidos en  la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como una plancha para el cabello, un secador, esmaltes para el trabajo de las uñas y para comercializarlo entre sus clientes, también comprará ropa para damas, niños, cubre lechos y toallas porque  simultáneamente vende mercancía  variada. Con su primer crédito  compró esmaltes, e implementos para cortar el cabello porque no tenia, e invirtió  en la línea de ropa para damas, es así  como su negocio ha ido creciendo. Su familia se sostiene con las utilidades de su negocio y con los ingresos que tiene su esposo en la actividad de construcción de casas y obras civiles. Así sus hijos están estudiando es que esta es precisamente una de sus  metas  ayudarlos  a   que terminen completamente sus estudios; otro de sus sueños es adquirir su casa propia, porque viven dende los suegros y  mas adelante desea realizar estudios profesionales de belleza.
Su negocio está ubicado en la vía principal de San Juan Nepomuceno en un barrio donde los vecinos se conocen y donde viven familiares profesores y empelados del sector  público.
texts.en:
Rosiris T. M., 37, lives in San Juan de Nepomuceno, Bolívar department. She has two children who are 13 and 17 years old. The idea for her business came when she was having a hard time finding employment. She took a course on disinfectant making at SENA (National Employment Service) but she didn’t do too well. She then started a beautician course and since then has done quite well providing in home manicures and hair dying services; she has a lot of regular customers thanks to the convenience of going to their homes to provide the service. This is her second loan with Fundación Santo Domingo; she’s asking for $2.000.000 to buy work tools, like a hair straightening iron, a hair dryer, nail polish for manicures and to sell to her customers. She will also buy clothing for women and children, bedspreads and towels because she also sells assorted merchandise. She used her first loan to buy nail polish and hair cutting tools because she didn’t have any. She also invested in a women’s clothing line and this is how her business has been expanding. Her family supports itself with profits from her business and with her husband’s earnings as a construction worker. Her children are in school because it is precisely one of her goals to help them finish school. Another of her dreams is to own her own home because they are sharing with their in-laws; she would also like to take a professional beautician course in the future. Her business is located on San Juan Nepomuceno’s main street in a neighborhood where she is well known and where her neighbors are known teachers and public sector employees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies and tools.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder tiene 24 años, es un joven laborioso y correcto, casado con Shirley de 23 años, con quien tiene un niño, y juntos viven en casa de los padres de su esposa. Desde hace 4 años,  Wilder  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arveja, papa, asimismo tiene gusto por la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y porcino, en tanto su esposa se dedica en la crianza de cuyes, siendo estos seleccionados por jaulas e instaladas en el patio de su vivienda. De esa manera, ambos cubren los gastos familiares, para cada uno de ellos, lo más difícil es combatir con las plagas que atacan sus campos de cultivo y aquellas que afectan la salud de sus animales. Esta actividad le resulta muy rentable, por lo que ha tenido una mejora económica, lo que le asegura poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Es por eso, que con la experiencia y solvencia que tiene en la agricultura, piensa continuar ahorrando, para que en el futuro pueda extender su siembra en búsqueda de una mejor productividad. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y manifiesta que gracias a la buena inversión de estos créditos puedo progresar en su negocio, así como la buena organización de su grupo comunal. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja, dos sacos de fertilizantes y una botella de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Wilder, 24, is an upstanding, hard-working young man. He’s married to Shirley, 23, and they have a son; they all live together in his wife’s parents’ house. For the past 4 years, Wilder has farmed corn, peas and potatoes; he also enjoys raising cattle, sheep and pigs. His wife raises guinea-pigs that are sorted into cages in their yard. In this way, they both contribute to meeting household expenses. The greatest difficulty is fighting against pests that attack his farmlands and those that affect the health of his animals. This activity is quite profitable and his economic condition has improved which assures his being able to provide a better quality of life for his children. Thus, with the experience and solvency he has in farming, he plans to continue saving so that he can expand his plantings in the future, seeking better productivity. This is his 9th loan with MFP and he states that, thanks to the judicious investment of these funds and his communal bank’s good organization, his business was able to grow. He will use the requested 600 new soles to buy a sack of pea seed, two sacks of fertilizer and a bottle of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilfrido E. O.  tiene 63 años y vive en San Juan Nepomuceno Municipio del Departamento de  Bolívar,  con su cónyuge y su hijo de 7 años. Él se dedica a la reparación y ensamble de baterías,  actividad que aprendió hace 20 años en el municipio El Difícil en el municipio del Magdalena con un sobrino. Anteriormente trabajaba en Cartagena pero sufrió un accidente de transito, que lo obligó a dejar de trabajar y por esto se quedó sin recursos, pero al aprender este oficio monto su negocio   y  de él depende su familia junto a una pensión que tiene. Para el desarrollo de este negocio Wilfrido  compra baterías viejas, las desarma y luego las arregla y las vende;  también compra las partes y las arma.  El ha recibido varios créditos con la fundación en el programa de grupos solidarios y este es su primer crédito individual y solicita un valor de $2.000.000, para invertirlo  en la  compra de  placas, separadores y cajas para batería. Su sueño es mejorar locativamente su taller e independizarlo pues funciona en su casa  y quiere repellar las paredes y instalar pisos nuevos pero sobretodo seguir reciclando baterías  viejas para el uso muchos mas vehículos que amplíen su mercado de trabajo.

El desafió mas grande que ha tenido y que lo marcó significativamente,  fue cuando por el accidente dejó de trabajar  por un tiempo y los recursos que le quedaron  de sus ahorros se los gastó,   pero hoy con su pensión ha logrado salir adelante  porque con ella pudo  montar su negocio.
texts.en:
Wilfrido E. O., 63, lives in San Juan Nepomuceno, Bolívar department, with his wife and 7-year-old son. He repairs and rebuilds batteries, a skill he learned 20 years ago with his nephew in the town of El Difícil, Magdalena. He used to work in Cartagena but a traffic accident forced him to stop working and left him without resources. However, having learned this skill, he set up his business which, together with a small pension he receives, supports his family. Wilfrido buys old batteries, takes them apart, refurbishes them, and resells them. He also buys battery parts and builds them from scratch. He has gotten several past loans from the foundation through communal banks but this will be his first individual loan. He is asking for $2.000.000 to buy plates, insulators and battery casings. His dream is to improve his workshop’s location since it is currently in his home and he wants to seal the walls and install new flooring. Above all, he wants to continue to recycle old batteries for use in many more vehicles so that his market will grow. His greatest challenge, which had a huge impact on him, was when the accident forced him to stop working and he spent all his savings. Today, thanks to his pension, he has managed to move forward because it made it possible for him to set up his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy battery parts.

loans.name: Harold Fermin

texts.es: El señor Harold Fermín tiene su negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 6 años, que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado proporcionarle a su familia estabilidad económica. Esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que se aproxima la semana santa y el requiere de la compra de mas productos para su negocio. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito, sus compras las realiza a camiones repartidores y en el mercado, además recibe ayuda de su esposa la cual trabaja como tortillera. El sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Harold Fermín has had a grocery store in his home for 6 years; he has always enjoyed providing for his family. He is asking for new funding to invest in stock items for his store because Holy Week is approaching and he needs to buy several products for the store. His sales are both cash and credit; he buys his merchandise from supply trucks and in the market. His wife helps meet household expenses with her earnings as a tortilla maker. He dreams with improving his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia María es una persona que ha salido adelante por medio de los financiamientos. La actividad económica de Doña Silvia es una pulpería. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio pues ella no tenía un medio de ingreso para sustentar a su familia, es por medio de la actividad que ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su razón del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo así podrá comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Silvia María is a person who has gotten ahead by receiving financing. The economic work of Mrs. María is a general store. More than 18 years ago she started the business because she didn’t have any other income to support her family. It’s with this business that she has been able to have her children advance. She wants the loan for working capital so that she can buy candies, natural drinks, juices, detergents and basic grains. She would like to enlarge her business for better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rafael Arcangel

texts.es: Rafael Arcángel tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. La actividad económica de Don Rafael es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio sus inicios se dieron porque tenía que mantener a 2 hijos y a su familia él es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de realizar su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene algunos pedidos pendientes, así podrá comprar madera. El sueña con mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rafael Arcángel has been working with the Foundation for a long time. His business is carpentry. He has dedicated himself to this activity for more than 5 years, having started in order to support his 2 children and family. He is a very responsible man, who enjoys carrying out his work. The loan he is requesting is for working capital, as he has several pending orders, so he can buy lumber. He dreams of improving the quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 60 años, es una persona que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, Juana es una persona muy activa y que le gusta conversar con sus clientes pues ella se ha destacado por ofrecer a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de variedad de productos, ya que tiene un buen pedido de productos. Ella desea seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is 60 years old, and someone that has been working with the Foundation for many years. She dedicates herself to selling clothing, a business she has been carrying out for more than 10 years. Juana is a very active person, who enjoys chatting with her customers. She has stood out for offering her customers what they request. She seeks a loan that will be destined for working capital to buy a variety of products, as she has many orders. She would like to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Clemencia Benita

texts.es: Clemencia Benita tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y le ha sido de gran ayuda. Tiene 2 hijos que de los cuales tiene que hacerse cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad que con mucho esfuerzo logro mantener. Por lo que ha tenido un gran experiencia en ventas, al inicio no fue tan fácil pues tenía problemas para comunicarse con sus clientes, pero esto no le impidió seguir adelante con mucho sacrificio logro continuar. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y ropa interior. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Clemencia Benita has been working with Fundación Leon for a long time and it has been a great help to her. She has two children that she takes care of herself. Her business is the sale of general merchandise. Clemencia began this business more than five years ago, and with much effort has kept it going. In the beginning, it was difficult, as she had problems communicating with the customers. But this did not stop her from moving ahead, and with much sacrifice, she persevered. This loan will be used for working capital. With it, Clemencia will buy pants, shirts, and underwear for merchandise. Her goal is to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise: pants, shirts, and underwear

loans.name: Heydi Sugey

texts.es: Heydi tiene 32 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene 2 hijos  a su cargo, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos y proporcionarle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios. La ubicación de su negocio en es un pequeño establecimiento en el mercado, es aquí donde ofrece leche, cuajada, queso y mantequilla. El dinero que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para su actividad. el deseo de ella es mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Heydi, age 32, sells dairy products. She has been in this business for over 11 years. She has two children under her care, and she has always been concerned about improving her income and giving her children the necessary education. Her business is a small establishment, which is located in the market. That is where she sells milk, “cuajada” (a type of soft cheese), cheese, and butter. The requested money is to buy raw material for her activity. Her wish is to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Estela

texts.es: Doña Esperanza Estela posee un negocio que es la elaboración de dulces en su casa de habitación. Desde hace 40 años que se dedica a este negocio la mayoría de sus clientes dicen que son muy deliciosos, con su esfuerzo logro sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues ha demostrado ser una mujer muy admirable ya que  a su edad es muy difícil mantener un negocio. Ella realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas de igual manera. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como azúcar, leche, dulce, leña entre otros productos. Su deseo es mejorar cada día la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Esperanza Estela’s business is making sweets in her house. She has been in this business for 40 years. Most of her customers say they are very delicious. Through her effort she was able to get her children ahead. She has shown herself to be a very admirable woman. At her age it is very difficult to maintain a business. She makes her purchases with cash, and she sells the same way. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material like sugar, milk, sweetener, and firewood, among other products. Her wish is to improve the quality of her products each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Laoy

texts.en: Mrs. Laoy L., who is a villager in Rung village in Takeo province, was born in 1964. She is a farmer who owns 2 hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family living, and her husband is a construction worker. In order to improve conditions for her family's living, she wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Laoy L. decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Through this activity, the couple supports three children: one is a laborer in Thailand, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the other is attending a local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos plásticos, hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio vendiendo de manera ambulante con el paso del tiempo con la ayuda de su Mama logro tener en su propio establecimiento en el mercado, por lo que siempre ha sido muy luchadora, ella ha sabido administrar muy bien sus ganancias. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de de diferentes bolsas plásticas, cubiertos, platos, vasos y recipientes. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes, age 43, sells plastic products. She has been in this business for over 14 years. She started by selling as a street vendor. As time passed, and with help from her mother, she was able to have her own establishment in the market. She has always been very tenacious. She has known how to manage her earnings very well. She is currently requesting a loan to buy different plastic bags, cutlery, plates, glasses, and containers. Her wish is to improve the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different plastic bags, cutlery, plates, glasses, and containers

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon N. was born in 1962 and she lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting her family living. In the rice field, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve her rice production, Mrs. Mon N. decided to seek for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed, and she will use the rest of the loan to plow the rice field. Her husband is a cow middleman. Through this activity, they support a child who is enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seed

loans.name: Pisith

texts.en:
Mr. Pisith S., who was born in 1981, is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land on which he grows rice, not for selling but to support his family. Aside from this he is a construction worker, too. His wife, Mrs. Rorm Net, owns a general store in local village.

This couple tries to work hard but they still earn a low income. Thus, they decided to start a new business but they did not have enough money. Accordingly, Mr. Pisith S. is applying for a loan to buy some piglets to raise and some pig feed.

Mr. Pisith S. is the father of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Reab

texts.en:
Mrs. Reab S. is 46 years old and lives in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family.

Mrs. Reab S. is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her family has a problem because her child’s workplace is far from her house. Thus, in order to improve matters, she decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for her child’s transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child's transportation

loans.name: Lorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorng H. is a villager in Roliek village in Takeo province and she is 51 years old. She is a clothes seller, door to door. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Lorng H. decided to request a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Her husband, Mr. Mun Prak, is farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family. He is on the right in the photo. The couple supports two children, one of whom is a grocer who gets a low salary, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Srey You

texts.en:
Ms. Srey You H. was born in 1981 and she lives in Pou Khvet village in Takeo province. She is single and lives with a family member.

Ms. Srey You H. owns a general store in the village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it but she does not have enough money to do this. Thus, in order to improve her family’s living conditions, Ms. Srey You H. decided to ask for a loan to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To buy gasoline to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mrs. Channa K. is a villager in Si Sla village in TaK. province and she was born in 1983. She is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectares of land to grow rice for supporting her family's living. In the rice field, she has some problems because her field has infertile soil, is far from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve rice production, Mrs. Channa K. decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for farming. Her husband, Mr. Sothearot Kuch, is a laborer. She is a mother of two children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for farming

loans.name: Chay

texts.en: The person who appears in the picture is Mrs. Chay R., 33 years of age. She lives in a commune of Phnom Penh, the city of Cambodia. Chay R. is a temporary laborer who is working at the busy local market. To help meet the family's daily expenses, her husband buys and sells used motors in the village for a profit. Chay R. has three kids who are teenagers, one of whom is no longer in school and works as a seamstress in the garment industry. The other two are attending school. Normally, Chay R. has received much cash from her husband’s business, which is the main source of the family’s income. She hopes to improve this investment and is asking for a loan to assist her husband to upgrade the financial capital for his motor sale trade.

loans.use: To upgrade the financial capital for his motor sale trade.

loans.name: Mrs. Nary Pine Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan which consists of eighteen members is located in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. All the members plan to use their loan proceeds for different purpose. Mrs. Nary P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to grow rice to support her family's livelihood and her husband is a palm juice collector. They earn very little income; yet, they try to work hard despite their situation. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Nary P. decide to apply for a loan to buy some piglets and pig food for breeding to start a new business. The couple supports three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy some piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Thorn R. is 36 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City. She has been blessed with four children who are in school. She and her husband are local rice cultivators. Besides farming, Thorn R. raises poultry, which is the main source of the family's income. Thorn R. will take out a loan from Kiva's partner HKL in order to buy extra poultry for her stall.

loans.use: To buy extra poultry for her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Dong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom D. is a villager who lives in Trakit village in Takeo province. She is 49 years old and is a village bank president who has been selected by 20 members. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhom D. and her husband, Mr. Mon Tes, are farmers who own a plowing machine and a 6-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn income for the family. In order to help with her farming, Mrs. Sokhom D. decided to ask for a loan to buy a wheel to support her plowing machine.  This couple has five children, two of whom are farmers who support the parent's farming, while the three others are students in a public school. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a wheel to support her plowing machine.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang P., 28, is a seamstress in a garment factory, while her husband, Mr. Thorng Sithoeun, shown at the right of the photo, is a construction foreman. This couple has a young child who lives at home and who attends school. The family has faced difficulties in travelling to work or anywhere around their community for years. They always pay a lot of money to a taxi driver for their transportation needs. They have been encouraged by their neighbor to seek a loan from Kiva’s project partner, HKL, in the amount of $800, to be used to buy a used motorcycle, so they can use it to provide transportation.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren C. is a 23-year-old married woman and she is a villager who lives in Trapeang Khnaor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.20-hectare (3-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Noem, is a firewood seller who is able to earn a small income to support his family.

Although they try to work hard with their businesses, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Saren C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

This couple has three children, one of whom is attending the local school, while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Suo

texts.en:
Mrs. Suo L. is 51 years old and she is a villager who lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a grocery seller who owns a general store to support her family. She is also a pig breeder at home from which she is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to increase her income to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Suo L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. The rest of the loan she wants use to buy feed for her pigs.

Her husband, Mr. Choeun Chum, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which he cultivates rice to support the family. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun Y. is a 40-year-old married woman who lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Seam Ouk, is a chicken seller from which he is able to earn a small income to support his family.

Since her husband’s business is going well, Mrs. Savoeun Y. wants expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more chickens to enlarge her husband’s business. With this loan, she hopes to increase his income to improve her family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Savoeun Y. is the mother of three children who are all students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for her husband's business

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem S. is 48 years old. She sells different types of desserts from her store at her home. She sells to people who are her nearby neighbors and usually generates about $3 each day. She was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.

Sem S. now has five children, two of whom are married and live separately and the others attend school. She also helps a life partner in her husband, working on the farm field.

Because Sem S.’s business has many clients who come to eat her dessert, she doesn’t have adequate space for her client seating. She is requesting a loan in order to improve her store and buy more furniture such as chairs, tables, and other accessories for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chairs, tables, and other accessories

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S. is 46 years old and she is a villager in Damnak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Hang Sokhon, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living.

Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Chantha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise and pig feed. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family’s living conditions.

Mrs. Chantha S. is the mother of three children, one of whom is on the staff of a casino, while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Nanita's Group

texts.en:
Nanita E. is from the village of Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Nanita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nanita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nanita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nanita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nanita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Mrs. Hean M. is 47 years old and she is a villager who lives in Ang Khchau village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sery Satt, is a duck middleman from which he is able to earn a small income to support his family.

Since her husband’s business is going well, Mrs. Hean M. wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to enlarge her husband’s business.

Mrs. Hean M. is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for her husband's business

loans.name: Edarlina's Group

texts.en:
Edarlina G. is from the village of Old San Mariano. She is 49 years old. Edarlina is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Edarlina G.'s Group'.

Edarlina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Edarlina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edarlina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Edarlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edarlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Edarlina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano, Isabela

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha O. is 46 years old and she lives in Ang Khchau village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land O. which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Samnang Soeng, is a constructiO. worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

In order to increase the family’s income, Mrs. Chantha O. wants to start a new business as a grocery seller. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase groceries to support her purpose.

Mrs. Chantha O. is the mother of three children: one is a car driver while the other two are students in the public school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Mrs. Rat R., age 59, is a local crop farmer. She has been operating this business since she was single and is able to make $2 per day. She has another financial earner who climbs many palm trees to tap juice to turn into sugar to sell. The family takes care of two kids, while another three are now married and live independently.

Rat R. wants to have a vehicle to better provide transportation for the family. However, her goal is not possible because, although she tries to save up money, she hasn’t enough cash yet to buy one. Thus, Rat R. is humbly requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva through HKL to be used to purchase a motorbike to make her family’s traveling more comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to make her family’s traveling more comfortable

loans.name: Reynaldo's Group

texts.en:
Reynaldo O. is from the village of Brgy.Tactac, Sta.Fe, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 52 years old. Reynaldo is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Reynaldo is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Reynaldo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever he sells his raised animal.

In 2010, Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Reynaldo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar P. S. is from the village of Brgy.Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 59 years old. Oscar is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Oscar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP during harvesting season.

In 2007, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Oscar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Kea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kea S. is 58 years old and she lives in Pring village in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a 2.9-hectare (7.25-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

For their farming, they do not have enough money to support the farm crop. Thus, Mrs. Kea S. decided to ask for a loan to pay for a farm laborer.

Mrs. Kea S. is the mother of three children: two are farmers who support their parents’ farming while the last one lives at home and also supports housework.

loans.use: To pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar P. J.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 29 years old, married and has one school-age child. They are from the village of Brgy. Lactawan, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Oscar has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2009, Oscar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Miriam N. owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She is 53 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Brgy. Common, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. Miriam has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Miriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Miriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to repair her vehicle to provide a better service. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. Miriam is the leader of a 12 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
