loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk T. is 46 years old and she is a villager who lives in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeun Cheng, are farmers who own a 5-hectare (12.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice and vegetables to earn a living.

In order to increase their income to improve their family’s standard of living, Mrs. Thouk T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Mrs. Thouk T. is the mother of a child who is on the staff of a printing house. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn B. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is a single woman. Marilyn is engaged in agriculture, particularly in planting of corn and rice. Through this activity she is able to earn a monthly net income amounting to 2,600 PHP. In 2005, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a cow. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn T. is 50 years old and she lives in Svay Pear village in Takeo province. She is farmer who owns a 1.44-hectare (3.6-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living.

In order to support her faming, Mrs. Khorn T. decided to ask for a loan to pay for a plowing laborer and a farm laborer.

Mrs. Khorn T. is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in the garment factory while the last one is a weaver and also supports her mother’s farming.

loans.use: To pay for a plowing laborer and a farm laborer

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Mrs. Aida L. is from Barangay Paradise, Ramon, Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 39 years old and is married with five children. Aida owns and operates a bakery and her husband also supports the business. Their main source of income comes primarily from this business. Aida has operated her business for more than two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She has successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Now Aida has a new loan of 14,900 from PMPC and this loan is intended for the expansion of her business and also to purchase other ingredients for making bread. This is her 3rd loan from PMPC. Aida owns a motorcycle which will be needed in delivering their bread to different sari-sari (variety) stores. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her bakery

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim S. is 48 years old and she is a villager who lives in Svay Pear village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phar Yarng, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living.

Aside from farming, Mr. Phar Yarng is a motorbike taxi driver from which he earns a small income to support his family living. He is on the left in the photo.

For their farming, Mrs. Kim S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and to pay for a plowing machine.

This couple has five children: one is a farmer who supports the parents’ farming; another is a laborer; while the other three are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay for a plowing machine

loans.name: Sally's Group

texts.en: Sally M. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the town of Luttuad Diffun, Quirino. Sally has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Sally joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Sally is the leader of a 5 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Sally M.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Lay Chhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people make up this village bank loan offered by AMK. Mrs. Lay C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members who are located in Moeang PraC. village in Takeo province. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mrs. Lay C. and her husband, Mr. Nhoung Leng, have a recycling business and earn a small income to support their family living. In order to support this business, Mrs. Lay C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to pull a trailer to transport recycled products.

This couple has two children who are students in the local school and also support their parents’ business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business

loans.name: Mr. Then Sang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Then S. is 35 years old and he is the village bank president who has selected by the members of this eight-member group located in Andoung Kien village in Takeo province. Each member will use the loan to support a different purpose.

Mr. Then S. and his wife, Mrs. Ry Roth, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. In order to support their crop, Mr. Then S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

Aside from farming, Mr. Then S. is a recycler who can earn a little income to support his family. This couple has three children who are all students in the public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Mrs. Rom Son Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Rom S. is a 31-year-old married woman who also leads a loan group made up of eight members who live in Chvea village in Takeo province. Each member will use his or her portion of the loan to meet a specific business goal. Mrs. Rom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she earns a living by cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Tou S., makes a living selling dried fish. Mrs. Rom S. will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide as well as more dried fish for her husband to sell. The couple has three children, all of whom are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and other items for various local businesses

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Mrs. Saom S. is 49 years old and lives in Tralach village in Takeo province. She owns two-hectare field on which she earns a living by growing rice. Her husband, Mr. Ly Chy, makes a small income working in construction. Although both of them work hard, they are not making an adequate income, which is why Mrs. Saom S. has applied for loan to buy piglets to breed. She believes that this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living. The couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed and food for them to eat

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Mr. Kan S. is 64 years old and lives in Tralach village in Takeo province. She owns a two-hectare field on which she earns an income by growing rice. Her husband, Mr. Saream Sieng, makes a small income as a consultant to the local commune. In order to increase their income, Mr. Kan Some has applied for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. The couple has one child, who is employed as a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Mrs. Pok C. is 54 years old and lives in Choes village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Mann Phath, are farmers who own 1.5-hectare field on which they make a living by growing rice. Mrs. Pok C. supplements their small income by selling groceries in the local village. Despite their had work, they are not able to earn enough of an income to support their family. That is why Mrs. Pok C. decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow to breed. The couple has one child, who makes a living as a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Mrs. Pech Saom Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pech S. lives in Kampeaeng Tboung village in Takeo province. She is 37 years old and serves as president of an eight-member loan group. Each member of this group will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Pech S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she makes a living by growing rice.  Her husband, Mr. Sambo Sok, earns a small income in construction. Mrs. Pech S. will use her portion of this loan to buy some piglets to breed. She hopes that this new business will allow her to improve her family's life. The couple has four children, three of whom are students. Their youngest child is not yet old enough to go to school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to breed

loans.name: Leidi Adai

texts.es: Leidi Adai R. S. de 22 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja haciendo viajes para personas particulares en un pick up, y su pequeño hija de meses de nacido. Leidi posee una venta de zapatos deportivos para niños y adultos, la cual esta ubicada en el centro de Santa Rosa de Lima, en el departamento de La Unión, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes, ya que es una zona muy concurrida, ya sea por personas del lugar como de otros lados de todo el país las cuales vienen hasta Santa Rosa de Lima,  ya que es un lugar de mucho comercio, donde se puede encontrar todo tipo de artículos a muy bajos precios. Debido a la amplia competencia que posee, Leidi solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de zapatos en diferentes estilos y precios, esto será de mucho utilidad para ella ya que permitirá aumentar sus ventas, las cuales beneficien a su familia en primer lugar, o que es el deseo de Leidi.
texts.en:
Leidi Adai R. S. is 22 years old and she resides in the district of Sonsonate. She lives together with her husband, who works making trips for specific people in a pickup. Leidi also has a baby girl who was born a few months ago. Leidi owns a stand selling sport shoes for kids and adults, located in the center of Santa Rosa, Lima in the district of La Union. La Union is a place which has many customers and it's a very busy area because of locals or others from around the country who have come into Santa Rosa, Lima. La Union has a lot of trade, where you can find all types of articles at very low prices. Owing to the level of competition, Leidi is requesting a loan, through which she can obtain the necessary capital to invest in her business, allowing her to buy larger numbers of shoes in different styles and prices. This will benefit her and allow her sales to increase. The increase in sales will benefit her family first, which is Ledi's desire.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of shoes

loans.name: María Fidelina

texts.es: María Fidelina H. D. M. D. 52 años D. edad, resiD. en Zacatecoluca, departamento D. La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor y junto a su hijo quien se dedica a estudiar. María  posee su propio negocio, el cual consiste en la compra D. ganado con la intención D. comercializar su carne y sus productos lácteos en primer lugar la leche. Así mismo desD. hace 2 años que se dedica a la compra y venta D. maíz, la cual venD. a una empresa muy famosa que venD. harina D. maíz. El negocio ha sido muy estable, sobretodo porque cuenta con la ventaja D. habitar en una zona muy apta para la crianza D. ganado y para la siembra D. maíz, lo cual le ayuda mucho con su negocio. María solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda comprar más ganado, con e fin D. poder comercializar mayor cantidad D. carne D. res y leche. DesD. hace seis años que ella venD. carne, lo cual le ha permitido contar con muchos clientes, ya que es muy conocida por ser una persona responsable y trabajadora quien desea salir adelante y brindarle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María Fidelina H. D. M. is 52 years old and resides in Zacatecoluca, in the district of La Paz. She lives together with her spouse who works as a farmer and with her son who dedicates himself to his studies. María has her own business which consists of the purchase of cattle with the intention of selling their meat and milk products - mostly the milk.She has also dedicated herself to the purchase and sale of corn which she sells to a very famous business which sells corn flour. Her business has been very stable, mostly because it's based on the advantage of living in a zone which is very well suited for raising cattle and for planting corn. This greatly helps María with her business. María solicits a loan from Integral as it will enable her to purchase more livestock and commercialize a greater quantity of beef and milk. For the last six years she has been selling meat, which has permitted her to gain many clients, and she has become very well known as a responsible and hardworking person who wants to get ahead and give her family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es: Rosa Elizabeth H. G. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal, y así mismo lo comercializa con personas que visitan las playas de La Libertad. Rosa se dedica a la venta de mariscos, trabajando en conjunto con su esposo, ella vende los mariscos de forma ambulante por las playas del departamento de La Libertad. Debido a la temporada de verano y Semana Santa, muchas personas acuden a la playas a disfrutar de algunos días de vacaciones, por lo que Rosa desea poder aumentar sus ventas, ofreciéndoles mayor variedad de mariscos como: camarones, pescado, conchas y pescado fritos, esto ultimo es lo que más se consume en esta temporada ya que es una tradición del país. Es por esta razón que Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más mariscos y no solo comercializar el que su esposo pesca, ya que esto le permitirá percibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa Elizabeth Hernádez Gutierrez is 44 years of age. She resides in the community “La Libertad”. She lives with her husband who is devoted to the craft of fishing which he commercializes to the people who visit the beaches of La Libertad. Rosa is devoted to the selling of seafood, working together with her husband, she sells the seafood by walking along the beaches of the community La Libertad. Due to the summer season and the holy week, many people frequent the beaches to enjoy some of their vacation days. Because of this, Rosa wishes to increase her sales and offer a larger variety of seafood like: shrimp, fish, shell fish, and fried fish. Fried fish is most popularly consumed in this season because it is a tradition in her country. It is for this reason that Rosa applied for a loan which will allow her to obtain the money necessary to buy more seafood and not only commercialize what her husband fishes, as this permits them to receive more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood

loans.name: Julio Hernán

texts.es: Julio Hernán F. R. de 37 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y le ayuda con el negocio. Julio posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, en la cual muchas personas de su cantón como de otros aledaños llegan a su negocio a consumir sus productos, esto debido a que en el lugar que Julio vive no existen muchas tiendas por lo que él desea aprovechar esta situación y poder brindarles más productos de gran utilidad para e hogar. Es por esto que Julio solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos alimenticios, como golosinas, bebidas y otros más los cuales son los que mayor  demanda poseen. Julio solicita el préstamo a Integra y posee la ilusión de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su madre gracias a este.
texts.en:
Julio Hernán F. R., 37 years of age, resides in the community of “The Liberty”. He lives together with his mother, who dedicates herself to the chores at home and she helps him with the business. Julio has a store that markets products of basic necessity which many people of his street, like the others surrounding, come to his business to purchase. This is because in the place that Julio lives, not many stores exist so he wants to make the most of the situation and be able to offer more useful products for the home. This is why Julio requests the loan, through which he can buy larger amounts of food products like candy, drinks, and more that are in high demand. Julio requests the loan to have the hope to better his quality of life and the life of his mother.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy comsumable and home related products

loans.name: María Deysi

texts.es: María Deysi Marilú B. de 43 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, una hermosa ciudad ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales los tres menores se dedican a estudiar y el mayor a trabajar.  María posee un comedor, el cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación, en donde desde hace muchos años ella se dedica a la venta de comida, tanto en las mañana como en los mediodías. Debido a que cuenta con muchos años de poseer su negocio cuenta con muchos clientes, razón por la que la cocina que tiene no le da a bastos para elaborar la comida necesaria para atender a sus clientes, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar otra cocina, la cual le facilite cocinar diferentes tipo de comida, y así atender a más personas. Así mismo desea poder comprar verduras, granos básicos, bebidas para contar con más materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos. María es una persona muy trabajadora  quien desea poder mejorar la economía de su familia y por esta razón desea mejorarlo.
texts.en:
María Deysi Marilú B., age 43, lives in Santa Tecla. It is a beautiful city located in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company, and their four children. The three youngest go to school, and the oldest works. María has a restaurant, which is located in her house. She has been selling food for many years. She sells in the mornings and at midday. Because she has had her business for many years, she has a lot of customers. That is why the stove that she has is not sufficient to make all of the food she needs to take care of her customers. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral. With the loan she will have enough money to buy another stove. That will facilitate her cooking different types of food, and she will be able to take care of more people. She also wants to be able to buy vegetables, basic grains, and drinks in order to have more raw material to make the food. María is a hard-working person who wants to be able to improve the family’s economy. That is the reason she wants to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stove and raw material to make food

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan Alberto R. H. de 47 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su compañera de vida quien le ayuda con el negocio. Juan posee una venta de repuestos de electrodomésticos, así mismo accesorios para estos. Desde hace 6 años que él posee este negocio, a través del cual ha podido salir adelante con sus ganancias, contando con la ventaja de ser la única venta de productos electrónicos en el lugar. Es por esto que Juan Alberto solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, sobre todo aquellos los cuales son más solicitados como: baterías, audífonos, entre otros más. Juan posee el deseo de poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposa, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, y es por esto que debe trabajar mucho para mantenerla a flote.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto R. H. is 47 years old. He lives in Santa Tecla, which is located in the La Libertad department. He lives with his life partner, who helps him with the business. Juan sells replacement parts and accessories for domestic appliances. He has had this business for six years. Through the business he has been able to get ahead with his earnings. He has the advantage of being the only business in his area that sells electronic products. That is why Juan Alberto is asking for a loan, to be able to buy a greater quantity of products. The products that are requested the most are batteries and headphones, among others. Juan wishes to be able to increase his sales in order to have greater economic stability for himself and his wife. This is the only source of income that he has. That is why he needs to work hard to keep it afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electronic products

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe S. de 41 años de edad, reside en la colonia Guadalupe, ubicado en la ciudad de Soyapango, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos de 16, 14 y 11 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo de su madre. Morena posee un negocio en el cual comercializa desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo diferentes bebidas y golosinas, su puesto está ubicado frente a la empresa Salud, en donde elaboran productos lácteos, esto beneficia mucho a Morena ya que la mayoría de empleados del lugar acuden a su puesto a comprar comida, así mismo no posee mucha competencia, ya que solo hay dos negocios más de venta de comida. Morena solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder contar con el dinero necesario para invertir aún más en el negocio, comprando materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos y comprando más bebidas y golosinas, lo cual le permita contar con más clientela y percibir mayores ganancias, lo que le brinde la ayuda necesaria para darles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe S., age 41, lives in the community of Guadalupe, located in the city of Soyapango in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her three children, ages 16, 14, and 11, who are able to be in school thanks to their mother’s enormous effort.

Morena has a business selling breakfasts and lunches, as well as different types of drinks and sweets. Her stall is located opposite a business called Salud where they manufacture dairy products. This location is of great benefit to Morena since most of the employees come to her stall to buy meals. She doesn’t have much competition since there are only two other places selling food.

Morena is applying for a loan from Integral with a view to being able to have the money necessary to invest even more in her business. This will permit her to serve more customers and have greater profits, which will provide her with what she needs in order to give all that is necessary to her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making meals.

loans.name: Verónica Agustina

texts.es: Verónica Agustina D. D.
texts.en: 41-year old Verónica Agustina D. D.

loans.use: to buy meat and basic necessities

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Mrs. Chay N. was born in 1975 and has been established in a small family home located in Sotnikom district, Siem Reap province, where she lives with her husband and children. To generate a daily income, Chay N. distills rice wine and sells it to people who order and buy directly from her home. Additionally, she sometimes uses the leftover from distilling wine to feed a few pigs, which she will sell when they come to maturity. 

Chay N. has been relying on the income from her husband’s job, planting sesame and peanut crops. He owns a machine that he uses to mill rice for a fee. This couple has been married for many years. They are blessed with two young school-aged children. To improve the investments and daily profit, Chay N. is applying for a loan to buy a new milling machine for service. She intends to use some of the loan towards raising pigs and crops.

loans.use: To buy a new milling machine and to raise pigs and crops.

loans.name: Thuot

texts.en: Mr. Thuot P., aged 49, is a local farmer. He plants peanuts, rice, and cashew crops on his own farmland that he inherited from his grandparents. He has a life partner, his wife, who appears in the photo. She is helping him with business activities and is also the good mother of six children. Four of the children are now married and have already started new homes. The remaining two children are students and also help their parents in their jobs, when they are not studying at school. Actually, Thuot P. will use his first loan to allow him to improve his daily profit. He will buy a cow, insecticide, fertilizer, and crop seeds to improve his crops.

loans.use: To buy cow, insecticide, fertilizer, and crop seeds.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang S. is 47 years old and she is a villager. She lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer. She owns a piece of land, on which she cultivates rice to earn money for the family's living. Her husband, Mr. Mao Oung, is a duck breeder. He breeds the ducks for selling their eggs. Since her husband's business is going well, she would like to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Heang S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks, for duck eggs, to enlarge her husband business. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more ducks.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 42-year-old married man and father of 3 children. Two of his children are still school-aged. He has been working as a home electrician for the past 20 years. He offers electrical services to his village and its surroundings. He works on a freelance basis, upon the request of his clients. 

Today, Antoine is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy new electrician tools and he is expecting to expand his business. He is very confident that he will be able to achieve substantial growth in the coming years as a result of the loan.

loans.use: To buy new electrician tools.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon K. is a 25 year old single woman who lives in Pea Ream village, in Takeo province. She is a weaver. She earns a small income, enough to support herself. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk. The rest of the loan will be used to pay out for weaving laborers. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her living. Now she is living with two other members of the household.

loans.use: To buy more silk.

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en: Mrs. Sovanna C. is 66 years old and lives in Ponley village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50 hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. Even with the farm, she still doesn't earn enough income to improve the family's living conditions, so Mrs. Sovanna C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. Mrs. Sovanna C. is a widow with two children. One of her children is a receptionist in a private school and one is a staff member of a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Mien

texts.en: Mrs. P., 43, sells a few groceries from her store in front of her home. She became a grocery seller in early 2000 and typically earns a suitable profit. She has another family member, her husband, who is a village consultant advisor. The family always takes time to plant rice crops during the whole farming season. P. has given birth to three children. Two of the children are no longer in school and work in the construction field and one is a school-aged child. P. is taking out her loan to buy a bicycle to ride. With the rest of the loan, she will buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle and more groceries.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mr. Pich N. is 41 years old. He is a villager in Ponley village in Takeo province.  He and his wife are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, they own a rice mill to earn an income to support the family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Pich N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow. The rest of the loan he wants use to buy two piglets for breeding. This couple has five children. Four of the children are students in the local school and support their parent's business. The youngest child is three years old. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Mrs. Sovann H. is 40 years old and lives in Prey Mean village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Bunthorn Chea, is a construction worker. He receives a small salary to support his family. Even with both businesses, they still don't earn enough to improve the family's standard of living. Thus, Mrs. Sovann H. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. This couple has two children. One child stays at home and supports the mother's business and the other one is six years old. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Mrs. Phalla Y. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Chy Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she also owns a coffee shop where she can make a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Ngory Ny, is a construction worker who receives a little salary to support his family. Mrs. Phalla Y. is now requesting a loan to buy an ox to add to the old one and the rest of the loan she wants use to buy a cart and a plow for supporting her farming. Mrs. Phalla Y. is the mother of a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen T. L. is a 35 year-old business woman. There are 4 peopL. in her family. Her two children are in high school. Their school fees are expensive. Therefore, she has to spend most of her time running her vegetabL. and fruit shop to earn enough for these fees. Her shop is always full of customers. Her husband is a worker who installs water pipes under the order of customers. Whenever he has free time, Yen T.'s husband will help her to manage their shop. 

She is the group leader of a four- member group loan. Since 2004, she has belonged to SEDA and has repaid her loans punctually. This cycL., she wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND (400 USD) to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables for her shop, to attract more customers. She wants to buy a new motorbike that she will use for deliveries.

About other borrowers in her group:
Hien T. N. is 29 years old. She lives in a family with 3 generations, but the main income is made by her and her husband. Everyday, she has to wake up early to make vermicelli to sell at the local market. She can earn 100.000 vn dong of profit per day. Her husband is a mechanic and he has a stabL. salary. Currently, she needs 8,066,000 VND(424 USD) to buy a machine to use for making vermicelli.

Dien T. N. is 29 years old. She has 2 children who are attending junior school and high School. She has a 7200 sqm paddy to grow rice and vegetables. After her time in the field, she raises pigs and chickens. Her husband is a seasonal employee. Therefore, their income is quite stabL.. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND(350 USD) to expand her livestock raising.

Loi V. N. is a 31 year-old farmer. He is living with his wife and one son in Xuan Non commune. He raises chickens (for eggs) and pigs. The merchants in the neighbouring area come to him to buy livestock to raise, in wholesaL.. Besides this business, he is also a constructor, so he has considerabL. income to manage his family. Currently, he needs 6,322,000 VND(350 USD) to have an amount of money to buy food for his poultry.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit and vegetables for her shop to attract customers

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chhorn H. is 51 years old. She is a villager who lives in Kouk Roka village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn enough for her family's living expenses. Her husband, Mr. Sakhon Un, is a duck egg seller, where he can make a small income to support the family's living. Since her husband's business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chhorn H. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more duck eggs, in order to expand her husband's business. This couple has two children, one is a soldier and one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more duck eggs.

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng C. and her husband, Mr. Thy Chamroeun (pictured together), live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Their daughter attends school; the son is still young and stays at home. 

Loeng has been a silk weaver since 1993, while her husband has been a boat builder for more than twenty years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to fill-up the land of her house and to buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business, as well.

loans.use: To fill-up the land of her house and buy silk materials for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 61-year-old married man living with his only wife. This old man was working in producing all kind of roastery for the past 42 years. In addition, he delivers his products to the related markets to make a good income for his family. Due to the long period in this occupation, he has made a good business reputation and he was gained a big number of customers. 

Today, Khalil is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase a special toaster machine for making roastery in order to enlarge his business productivity and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To purchase a toaster machine.

loans.name: Hub

texts.en: Mrs. Hub P. is 45 years old and she is a villager who lives in Pou village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice in order to earn for his family's living expenses. In this farming she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farming crop. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and to pay out for hiring a water machine to water her rice and to pay out for plowing. Aside from farming, she also sells boiled rice. Her husband, Mr. Toak Srey, is a motorbike taxi driver. He can make a small income to improve his family's standard of living. This couple does not have any children. Her husband is on the left, in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer; rice seed and pesticide.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon P., 62 years old (shown in the photo), is a silk weaver. She has three married children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her daughter on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Khon is old, however, she still strong enough to work. 

She does not have enough capital to purchase silk materials for her weaving business, so she is asking for her first loan of $200 to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Phav

texts.en: Mr. T., 46 years old, has had a small business which the main activity is to fish in and around the river. He and his wife always get up in the morning and head toward the river, where they have always been fishing. This couple has been responsible for five children. All five of the children are students and also assist their parents, when they are free. In the past, T. has rented a neighbor’s boat to fish and right now he wants to own a boat. Because T. has no money, he has decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s lenders, through HKL project. He will buy a boat that he can use to cross the river for his fishing operations. Mr. T. is not in the picture because he was busy at his business when the photo taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a boat.

loans.name: Srei

texts.en: Mrs. Srei K. is 53 years old and she is a villager who lives in Pou Roung village, in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.50-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn for the family's living expenses. In order to support the farming crop, Mrs. Srei K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to pump water to support the farming crop. Mrs. Srei K. is a widow with four children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other two are students in the local school and also support the mother's farming efforts.

loans.use: To buy a water machine.

loans.name: The

texts.en:
Mrs. The P. (shown in the photo), 50, is a widow with one daughter who is a silk weaver. She lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. .  

The is a farmer. Besides farming, she is a silk weaver as well. She is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Mrs. Kin T. (pictured above), 51, and her husband, Mr. Buntho Thean, also 51, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1983 and have four children: two sons- one of them is a construction worker and another one stays at home and two daughters- one weaves silk at home and another one works for a restaurant.    

Kin has been a silk weaver for almost twenty years. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell at Phnom Penh market. Her husband drives a motor taxi. She is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Mrs. Kean E. is 59 years old and lives in Klaong Tvear village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she owns a small grocery store which makes her a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she is asking for a loan to buy more groceries. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family's income. Her husband, Mr. In Ork, is a construction worker and the couple has two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other works in a hotel. .

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en: Mrs. Voeun T. is a 34 year-old woman who lives in Thmei village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Thok Yeng, breed ducks which brings in a small income to support their family. Since the business is going well they want to expand it so Mrs. Voeun T. is asking for a loan to buy more ducks to enlarge her business. This loan, will increasing her income and the family's standard of living. Mrs. Voeun T. is the mother of four children; one is working and the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhum H. and her husband, Mr. Den Kem, have been married since 1979 and have two daughters. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Besides being a weaver, Sokhum has started a new business selling Khmer noodles and other food in the local market.  Her husband is a mason and boat repairer. She hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $300 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Tob

texts.en: Mrs. Tob L. is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn the family's living. Mrs. Tob L. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her farm. Her husband, Mr. Vith Soen, is a construction worker and earns a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Tob L. is the mother of four children; three are students who also help with the farm, while the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Kean

texts.en: Mr. Kean H., 39 and his wife, Mrs. Kunthea Thoem, 33, have been married since 1998 and have three daughters. Two of them attend school and the third is still young and stays at home. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Kean has built wooden houses since 1992, while his wife is a silk weaver. He is requesting his first loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his wife’s weaving business.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 25-year-old single man living with his family. In 2008, he decided to open his own phone shop after five years of experience selling mobile phones and mobile accessories. In addition, he has prepared a speciA. corner of his store to sell perfumes to gain extra profit. Wassim is very confident with his decision to start his own business and he's thankful for the revenue which allows him to ameliorate his life situation. Wassim is requesting $1,000 to expand his shop by buying more mobile phones and perfumes to attract more clients.

loans.use: buying more mobile phones and perfumes

loans.name: Navoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Navoeun D. (in the photo), is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Yan, also 35 years old, have been married since 1994. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of the children are in school and the third is still young and stays at home. They live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Navoeun used to be a garment factory worker. She started a new business selling gasoline and ice in front of her house. Her husband drives a motor remoque taxi. Remoque is a motorbike with a trailer attached to the back. 

Navoeun is applying for a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Rik

texts.en:
Mr. Rik L. is 57 years old, and currently resides in Siem Reap province. He is a Khmer medical doctor who has learned the skill of producing medicine from his grandfather. The medicine is made from many kinds of tree roots. Rik L. is a good father of two school-aged children, who are dependent on him. He has a life partner in his wife, who owns farmland on which she cultivates a variety of crops. 

Rik L.’s wife has often faced difficulty irrigating her crops because the farmland is located far from the watering system. Because of this problem, Rik L. has decided to ask a loan in order to hire a laborer to dig a small pond, where he will pump the water for crops.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to dig a small pond for irrigation

loans.name: Suong's Group

texts.en:
For this loan, Mrs. Suong S. is the group leader, selected by the members. The group consists of six members, located in Pea Ream village in Takeo province. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. 

Suong S. is a silk weaver who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chork L., is a farmer who owns a 1.20-hectare field on which to cultivate rice to earn for the family's living. 

Suong S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to expand her business. With this loan, she hopes to increase the income to improve the family's standard of living. This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are students who also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy more silk in order to expand the business

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida D., 54, from the town of Palacian Aglipay, Quirino, is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Aida D.'s group.

Aida, who is married and has seven adult-aged children, owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch M. is 46 years old and she is a villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nhar Nget, is a taxi driver who owns a car for taxi driving and can make a small income to support the family's way of life. 

In order to support her husband's business, Touch M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a car machine to replace the old one. This couple has two children: one is a driver who supports the father's business, while the other is a staff employee in a casino club. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a car machine

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se S., 28, sells sweets for children, as well as provides a sewing service for extra income. She also relies on the income from her husband, who is a building foreman. This couple is helping each other in order to generate cash to raise and educate their four children. All of them are going to school. Se S. sees that her husband’s business is profitable, which is the important source of family income. 

Recently, her husband received an order from people who need him to build a new house, but he lacks equipment to perform this service. Se S. is therefore looking for a loan to allow her husband to purchase the essential construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase essential construction materials for home building

loans.name: Agnes Baluyot's Group

texts.en: "Do your best and God will do the rest," Agnes says. Agnes B. owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Sta. Maria Buguey, Cagayan. Agnes has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Agnes is the leader of a 9 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn N. is 51 years old and she is a villager who lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Horn Sao, are farmers who own 2.50 hectares of land on which to cultivate rice to earn for the family's living. For this farm, Mrs. Sorn N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and the rest of the loan would be used to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds to support the farming crop. 

Aside from farming, Horn Sao is a Khmer noodle seller who can make a small income to support his family. This couple has four children: one is tailor and one is a silk weaver, while the other two are construction workers. Sorn N.'s husband , Horn Sao, is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water machine as well as fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey R., age 44, has lived with his five family members for years in a medium-sized wooden house along the village road of the province of Siem Reap. Mr. R. currently earns daily income by buying and selling piglets. He normally buys the pigs from farmers who live in the rural area. He uses his motor to deliver them to the customer's house. 

To meet the family's foods needs, his wife makes skewers for sale. They have been married for years and are blessed with four single children who help them in the business of making skewers. Mr. R.'s pigs are commanding better prices that make it easier for Mr. R. to earn more income. Mr. R. is lacking capital, so he would like a loan to purchase additional pigs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs to sell

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Hovd Province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent. His two daughters, ages 5 and 3, attend kindergarten and haven't reached school age yet. 

Ganbold operates a carpentry business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2004, and his wife helps him with his business when needed. Besides the carpentry business, he also operates a taxi service with a car that he bought with the previous loan that he received from XacBank. Ganbold has been operating both businesses successfully. He is focused on the future and says, “My wife is looking for a permanent job and we will work to provide a better life for our family." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1475 USD) loan to purchase large amounts of timber and small products for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and other inventory for his carpentry business

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy T. D. is 34 years old. She lives in Pho Cho. She has two children. 

Thuy T. D. owns a shop, serving the customers of the local community by selling blankets, pillows and cushions. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. A member of the SEDA microfinance program since 2004, she has been a dynamic, energetic and respected leader of a five-member group. 

In this loan cycle, there are two members borrowing money in her group, Thuy and Thanh. Thuy wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND (350 USD) to expand her store. Thanh T. N. is 32 years old. She is a tailor. She wants to borrow 6.758.000 VND (350 USD) to buy cloth.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Sae

texts.en:
Mrs. Sae N. is 35 years old and lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plowing machine and five-hectare field on which to cultivate rice to earn for the family's living. Aside from farming, she is a pig breeder at home. Her husband, Mr. Muy Kheav, is a construction worker and can receive a small salary to support his family's living.

Sae N. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for pig breeding business and rice seeds for her farm crop. Sae N. is the mother of five children, four of whom are students in the local school, while the youngest is six years old.

loans.use: To buy pig food for her pig breeding business, as well as rice seeds for her farm crop

loans.name: Ednalyn Macabasag Group

texts.en: "Health is wealth" is the principle in the life of Ednalyn M.. Ednalyn owns and operates a store selling food products including fish and snacks in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Isca Gonzaga, Cagayan. Ednalyn has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Ednalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ednalyn is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. Ednalyn is the leader of a 13 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Ednalyn M.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en: Mrs. Sreymom H., 42 years old, lives in Chrak Chi Koam village in Takeo Province where she owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is also a rice middleperson earning a small additional income.  A widow with two children who are students in the local school, Sreymom is now requesting a loan to add to her savings to replace an old motorbike and to buy more rice to enlarge her business activities.

loans.use: To replace her old motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a 33-year-old single man living with his father, opened a car electricity repair shop in his village in 2002.  Joseph has been involved in this occupation for the past 15 years, and with the help of severA. microloans, he has been able to develop his business over the years.  Today, Joseph is asking for a Kiva loan of $1,200 to buy new tools to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income to help his father in the household and with the heavy expenses of life.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Baatarsuren

texts.en:
Baatarsuren is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His wife, Oyuntuya, works in a private company, while his two daughters, ages 5 and 3, attend kindergarten. Presently, Baatarsuren operates a cell phone trading and repair business with his younger brother in town, selling a variety of cell phone and spare cell phone parts to his many customers. He has been operating his business since 2007, and has steadily expanded the business.

A very hardworking person with many plans for the future, Baatarsuren says, “I would like to expand my business and open new branches in the future. I trained my younger brother in repairing cell phones and I have been planning to create a cell phone repairing center for him.” He is now requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~ 1100 USD) loan to purchase spare cell phone parts and cell phones for his business.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun H. is 48 years old and she is a villager who lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who own 2-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn her family living. Her husband is a chef who can earn a small income to support the family living.  
                   
Mrs. Oun H. is requesting for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and the rest of the loan she wants use to pay out for farming labor and to buy rice seed, pesticide to support her dry farming season. Mrs. Oun H. is a mother of six children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory three are students in the local school and also support their mother farming. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow, rice seed, pesticide, farming labor

loans.name: Phallin

texts.en: Mrs. Phallin Y. and her husband, Mr. Sokhom Noun, live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1996 and have three sons and one daughter — three in school and the youngest still at home. Phallin has run a grocery store in front of her house for more than ten years with the help of her husband. She also rents a space in her house to garment factory workers. She hopes to continue expanding the number of rooms she rents to the workers in order to generate income. She is requesting her second loan of 400USD, to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Clive Road W. G. Of Jinja Group

texts.en:
Z. Cathy is 46 and is married with two children. She operates her twenty-year-old garment sales business in Jinja central market.

80,000 shillings is the amount this experienced businesswoman makes in a month. This is paltry for a woman with no other form of income. It is for this reason that Cathy wants to get this loan to improve her financial prospects.

By her own account, the future of her business is promising once Cathy gets this loan. With it she wants to purchase more garments to give her business a new lease of life.

loans.use: To purchase more surplus garments for her business

loans.name: Batdolgor

texts.en: Batdolgor is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian tent, in a yard which belongs to her relative. Her two daughters, aged four and two, attend kindergarten. Her husband,  Narantsogt, operates a transportation business with his truck. Batdolgor has a tailoring business to earn a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She makes a range of clothing with a variety of designs per her customers' requests. Batdolgor is a professional seamstress who has a loyal customer base because of her good service. Her business is very important for her. She says, “I would like to expand my  business and  improve my family's standard of living.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1465 USD) loan to purchase necessary materials at wholesale prices for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sal

texts.en: Mrs. Sal P., 39, and her husband, Mr. Vai Long, 43, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1988 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, and the other three are in school. Sal has been a farmer for fifteen years, while her husband has been a construction contractor for twenty years. Because her children commute to school far away, they often have to take a motor remoque or taxi. (A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer attached.) Since taking a remoque to school is expensive, Sal is asking for her first loan of $300 to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To add to her own savings to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.
